loans.name: Resurection Group

texts.en:
In this part of Africa, a coffin in which a man is buried in represents the last honour he receives on Mother Earth. While some people are buried in wooden coffins, many people have a high appetite for expensive coffins, as it displays their last honor from their loved ones. 

Theresa a 46-year-old woman imports coffin handles and paints from different counties and supplies coffin makers at competitive prices. She is one of the few women in Zimbabwe involved in the coffin business.

The coffin business is a good business in the city of Harare. Though Theresa does not prefer to use the term “lucrative” to describe her line of business, it has helped her pay bills and school fees for her four children. Her business continues to thrive, irrespective of the bleak economic situation and financial situation in Zimbabwe. 

Theresa has been receiving many orders ranging from economical coffin handles to expensive coffin handles. Her business has the capacity to grow but lacks funding.

Theresa and a group of two other women formed a group called Resurrection, and have received their second group loan from Thrive Microfinance. 

She hopes that a loan from Kiva will help expand their businesses and finish building her house

loans.use: to increase her range of coffin supplies.

loans.name: Shanduko Group

texts.en:
Born in 1978 in a village in Marondera, Zimbabwe, Barbra endured a painful hardship being shuttled from one guardian to another, after being orphaned at the age of eight. 

As a teenager, Barbra moved to the high-density suburb of Glenview, in Harare, a move that she did not know would change her life forever. However, she found it hard to make it on her own until her friend, Catherine, decided to take her in and taught her how to run her own business as a cross border trader.

Barbra is now a married mother of three children. It is the thought of a better life for her children that makes her work hard day after day and sleep on the pavements of the border post month after month. It is no longer the instinct of survival that drives her, but the vision of a better future. She is a woman who believes that the world has changed and women should take the initiative to empower themselves. 

Her world has changed too; she runs her own stall at a flea market selling clothes. She gives credit to Catherine who helped her rise from the dust, by encouraging her to be active in developing herself and giving her direction in business.

When Barbra received her portion of a group loan, her eyes, that tell part of her story of constant hardships, were filled with tears of joy. 

A group loan and training from Thrive Microfinance has helped Barbra open another flea market selling clothes from South Africa, Botswana, and Zambia. 

She hopes that a loan backed by Kiva will help her develop her rural home, put secure running water for her family and help her group Shanduko, expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Kholé

texts.fr:
Kholé est un client régulier de ce guichet qui a déjà bénéficié de six crédits dans le cadre de son activité. Il fait de l’embouche depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Marié et père de famille, il travaille afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Kholé s’occupe lui-même de ses bêtes et leur consacre plus de huit heures de temps par jour c’est voir combien il adore faire ce métier.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Le bénéfice lui permet d’acquérir d’autres bœufs et de développer son activité. Il envisage de construire un grand enclos pour augmenter la quantité des bêtes et leur permettre de se développer normalement.
texts.en:
Kholé is a regular client of this branch office. He has benefited from six loans for his business. He has been raising livestock for over ten years now. A married father, he works in order to meet family needs. Kholé takes care of his animals by himself and devotes over eight hours of time each day to them. This shows how much he loves working in this trade. 

He takes care of his family’s day-to-day expenses. The profit enables him to acquire more cattle and to develop his business. He envisions building a large pen to increase the quantity of his animals and to allow them to develop normally.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then resell

loans.name: Ndouniane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndouniane est un client d’un des guichets ruraux de l’IMCEC. Il s’active dans l’élevage de bœufs depuis plus de 7 ans. Il vient pour la troisième fois solliciter un crédit qui va lui permettre de disposer d’un fond de roulement pour mener à bien son activité. Il possède actuellement trois bœufs : une femelle, un mâle et un petit, ce dernier qui sera embouché et pourra être revendu à l’occasion des marchés hebdomadaires. 
Marié et père de famille, Ndouniane se voit le devoir de s’occuper de son foyer en les nourrissant et en veillant à l’éducation de ses enfants.
Il aimerait diversifier son activité et bénéficier d’un financement qui lui permettra de réaliser ce projet d’acquérir des chèvres et des moutons.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndouniane is a client of one of the rural branch offices of IMCEC. He has been active in raising cattle for over seven years. He is here for the third time to request a loan to allow him some working capital for carrying out his work. He currently owns three head of cattle: a cow, a bull, and a calf. The calf will be fattened and could be sold at the weekly markets. 

A married father, Ndouniane takes on the duty of taking care of his home by providing food and overseeing his children’s education. He would like to diversify his business and benefit from a loan allowing him to realize his plans for acquiring goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock for her food wholesale business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve her broiler business.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gora, marié et père d’une grande famille de fils et de petits fils, s’active encore dans le domaine de l’agriculture et de l’élevage pour accompagner ses enfants qui veulent prendre la relève, mais aussi pour s’occuper un peu. Cela fait plus de 15 ans qu’il évolue dans ce domaine : il possède des champs qu’il exploite avec ses enfants. Dans ce même espace, il entretient des bœufs et les embouche afin de les revendre dès qu’ils sont à terme. 
Le crédit sollicité lui permettra d’acheter deux à trois bêtes et de prévoir aussi leurs alimentations. 
Gora est bien connu dans le marché, il a une clientèle assez fidèle qui achète ce qu’il propose puisqu’il veille à ce qu’il soit de meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Mr. Gora, a married father of a large family, including children and grandchildren, is active in the domain of agriculture and livestock farming to accompany his children, who want to take over the business, but also to keep busy. He has been working in this domain for over fifteen years: he owns fields he puts to use with the help of his children. In the same space, he maintains cattle and fattens them for resale at the right time. 

The loan requested will enable him to purchase two or three animals with plans to feed them. Gora is well-known at the market. He has fairly loyal customers, who purchase what he offers, since he oversees what may be the best in quality.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then resell

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou est agriculteur depuis sa naissance, il ne connait  que l’élevage depuis plusieurs années. Il n’a bénéficié d’un seul crédit au sein de l’IMCEC ; il fait un renouvellement pour pouvoir acheter quelques bœufs et développer son activité. Il vit à la campagne et l’environnement est beaucoup plus propice là- bas pour faire de l’élevage, il y a de l’espace pour faire paitre les animaux qui peuvent manger de l’herbe dans la campagne. Modou ne s’occupe plus de la dépense quotidienne car il y a ses enfants qui se la partage, lui ne fait que donner un coup de main pour les petits besoins de la famille. La finalité est qu’il puisse les appuyer afin qu’ils  puissent être autonome et prendre le train en marche dans leur vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou has been a farmer since he was born. The only thing he has known for several years is raising livestock. He has never had a loan from IMCEC; he is making renovations to be able to purchase some cattle and develop his business. He lives in the countryside, and the environment is much more promising there for raising animals. There is space for pasturing the animals, which can eat country grasses. 

Modou no longer covers day-to-day expenses, since his children share in this. So he only lends a hand to meet the sundry needs of the family. His aim is to support them, so that they may be autonomous and not miss out on what their lives may offer.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad tranquila, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, en el mercado de su distrito, su hijo le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos para los preparativos de su producto como pollo, maíz, plátano, entre otros y de esta manera ofrecer variedad de tamales a sus cliente, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old. She lives in the district of Lagunas, a tranquil community. The majority of its population works in agriculture, business, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

She works selling tamales in the market in her district. Her son supports her with this work. She has requested a loan to buy supplies to prepare her products such as chicken, corn, and plantain, among other things, and in this way offer a variety of tamales to her customers, generating greater income for her family and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her products such as chicken, corn, and plantain, among other things.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara, a widow, has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Molave and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations and to buy farm inputs. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Barbara knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. 

In the future, Barbara hopes to save more money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, desde hace 5 años, trasladando a sus clientes a los caseríos cercanos, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manera el espera brindar un mejor servicio lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gaspar is 52 years old and lives with his son in the Oyotún district, a rural zone where residents make a living working in agriculture, trade and with cattle. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region in the north coast of Perú. He has provided transportation services in his motorcycle taxi for the past 5 years, taking customers to nearby communities.  He has experience in this business and good personal and work references in the district.

He requests the loan to repair and maintain his vehicle which is currently in bad condition. This way he hopes to provide better service which will have positive results in the level of income and therefore improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Mary Liliana

texts.es:
Mary Liliana tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, cerdos, desde hace 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposo comercializan los animales en el mercado de su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para engordar y ofrecer a sus clientes, con esto ella espera incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mary Liliana is 40 years old, married, and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, a rural area whose inhabitants work in farming, trade, and livestock.  It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast. 

She has raised and sold animals, such as roosters, chickens, hens, ducks, and pigs for 10 years.  With her husband's help, they sell the animals in their local market.  She has requested a loan to buy a larger quantity of animals to fatten and offer to her customers, which she hopes will increase her profits and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals to fatten and offer to her customers

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 02 hijos, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad donde sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino y aves de corral como gallinas, pollos y patos, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales de corral como patos, gallinas, cerdos, etc. para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Anselmo espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anselmo is 63 years old, married, has two children, and lives in his own home in the district of Pucará, a community that works principally in farming, trade, and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains.  

He raises and sells goats and farm birds, such as hens, roosters, and ducks.  He has experience in this business and good personal and professional references in the area.  This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of farm animals, such as ducks, hens, pigs, etc., to increase his business's inventory.  With this, Anselmo hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to his customers, which will generate more income that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of farm animals, such as ducks, hens, pigs, etc.

loans.name: Brayan Edgardo

texts.es:
Brayan tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad rural que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, cuenta con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera Brayan espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brayan is 18 years old, single, and lives with his mother in their own home in a small community in the district of Cayalti, a rural community that works in agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

He works raising and selling pigs. He has over one year of experience in the business and has good personal and work references from the residents of his district. He requests a loan to buy a greater number of pigs and feed to raise them. In this way, Brayan hopes to make his business grow, obtain more income, and be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of pigs and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Women Of Excellence Group

texts.en:
Our group lending method is a good method. Women come together and share different ideas, encourage each other and challenging each other to work hard. 

We encourage women to choose group members that they know very well and that their relationship should be one based upon trust and unity. One such group that joined the Thrive program is Tagoneswa, which consists of five women, who engage in different income generating projects.

Pumuzani is the chairlady of the Tagoneswa group from Highfields, in Harare. She started business as a tomatoes vendor after her husband stopped working. Her small business grew to a small vegetable stall also selling snacks and refreshments, at the local Lusaka market. 

The small profits she was getting enabled her to support her small family and apply for a passport. After the acquisition of her passport Pumzani added cross border trading to her business. After hearing about Thrive Pumuzani her friend’s formed Tagoneswa group. They participate in a lot of trainings availed to them. She believes the lessons will make her a better business woman.

With her Kiva loan, Pumuzani is looking forward to growing her cross border business and increasing her chicken batches from 100 at a time to 200.

loans.use: to grow her cross border business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two used cars, repair them and start his car rental business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar electric fence.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a divorced man with a son named Juan. They live in El Alto, but recently moved to a place where he pays rent.

Juan works as a carpenter and needs a loan to purchase wood. He would like to have his own house and his own joinery in the future 

Juan hopes you can trust him again; he is healthy and takes good care of his son.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro 7 Group

texts.en:
Ines is a member of the Trabajando para el Futuro 7 (Working for the Future) group, located in the city of Samana. It is composed of five business woman micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and fruits. One member also runs a beauty salon and another is a tailor.

Ines lives with her three children. She says her greatest challenge is helping her children grow up well and become professionals. 

She is very excited to receive her 14th loan with Esperanza Internacional, to buy sewing materials, like needles, threads, fabrics, lace, etc. She is a dressmaker. 

Ines runs her business from her house, located in a rural communities of Samana. She has had her business for more than eight years. Her dream is to have a successful business, to provide her children what they need, and to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr:
Ngor est un client dans un de nos guichets situés en zone rurale. Il a ouvert son compte en 2011 et a pu bénéficier de quatre crédits remboursés normalement. Son activité consiste à élever des bovins à fin de les revendre. Cela fait 9 ans maintenant, qu’il exerce cette activité ; il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 21h. Ngor est marié et père de cinq enfants, dont il s’occupe grâce aux revenus de son activité. 
Ngor veut en fait, augmenter son cheptel car vers les mois qui viennent, le prix des bœufs sera abordable et il y aura beaucoup d’opportunités pour la revente.
Comme projet futur, il veut construire son propre bâtiment.
texts.en:
Ngor is a client at one of our branch offices located in rural areas. He opened his own account in 2011 and was able to benefit from four loans, which were repaid normally. His business involves raising cattle to be resold. He has been in this business for nine years now. His day starts at 9 AM and ends at 9 PM. 

Ngor is a married father of five children, whom he takes care of, thanks to the income from his business. He wants to increase his herd, since the price of cattle will be affordable in the coming months. And there will be many opportunities for reselling. For future plans, he wants to build a structure of his own.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr:
Samba évolue dans l’embouche depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant, il possède un enclos où  il fait son activité, il a actuellement plus de six têtes de bœufs avec trois veaux. Il en est à son cinquième crédit qui lui permettra d’avoir un fond de roulement pour l’entretien de ses bœufs et si possible l’achat d’une autre vache pour accélérer la reproduction et la vente. Samba travaille de 10h à 21h et s’occupe lui-même de leur entretien.
Samba s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et de l’éducation  de ses enfants.
Comme projet, il veut faire du maraichage pour diversifier ses revenus.
texts.en:
Samba has been working at fattening livestock for over ten years now. He owns a corral, where he operates his business. He currently has over six head of cattle and three calves. He is on his 5th loan enabling him to have the working capital for maintaining his cattle and, if possible, purchase more cows to accelerate reproduction and sales. He works from 10 AM until 9 PM and takes care of them by himself. 

Samba covers the day-to-day expenses of his household and his children’s education. For future plans, he wants to work in market-gardening in order to diversify his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou, âgé de la trentaine d’année, s’active dans le commerce de bœufs depuis plus de cinq ans. Il habite dans un village ou l’élevage est la grande occupation de la population. Ceux qui ont les moyens, embouche eux même pendant la durée requis pour aller revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Les autres, achètent des bœufs à terme, à un prix abordable, pour les revendre quelques jours après. Modou a donc besoin d’une somme de 350 000F pour acheter un bœuf qu’il pourra revendre plus tard à un prix plus intéressant.
Modou est marié et père de famille, il gère la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de son enfant ainé.
Modou désire un jour, avoir un fond consistant qui puisse lui permettre d’emboucher lui-même les bêtes et pour un grand nombre.
texts.en:
Modou, in his thirties, has been active in the commerce of cattle for over five years. He lives in a village where raising livestock is a major occupation of the people. For those who can afford it, fattening livestock for the duration requires going to the weekly markets to make sales. For the others, they buy cattle over time at affordable prices and resell them a few days later. Thus, Modou has need of 350,000 francs to purchase a head of cattle to be able to sell later at a better price. 

Modou is a married father. He manages his family’s day-to-day expenses and the schooling costs for his oldest child. One day, Modou would like to have substantial capital, so that he himself may fatten a large number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell a few days later

loans.name: Elena Petrona

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la fisioterapia.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, optimista, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa y amable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona sur, caracterizada por las redes viales que comunican a la ciudad y porque se encuentran 1 de los 2 aeropuertos internacionales, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Elena es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su Vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fisioterapia; ella se ocupa de tratar a personas que se están recuperando de daños físicos y a aquellas que buscan un alivio al dolor causado por problemas físicos crónicos.  “mis clientes por lo general son enviados por médicos de familia y especialistas médicos que trabajan con los pacientes y que necesitan un plan de tratamiento más amplio y programado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de cremas y material de fisioterapia. Su sueño es mejorar su consultorio, ella desea realizar la compra de material de fisioterapia como;  cremas y equipos para masajes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de cremas y material de fisioterapia para abastecer su consultorio y sanar a muchas personas.
texts.en:
Elena is a 26-year-old woman; she is married, has a one-year-old son, and her business is physical therapy.  

She is patient, a good listener, caring, dedicated to her work, generous, and kind.  She does her work in the southern region, which is known for its roadways, which connect to the city, and because it is where one of the two international airports is.  It has a tropical climate with temperatures during the day ranging from 21-35 degrees Centigrade.  

Elena is tan with dark eyes, black hair tied back, and of average height; her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of the work she does.  She shares her life with her husband, who has a salaried job, and with her son who is already walking.  They live in a rented house made of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.  Her business is physical therapy; she treats people who are recovering from physical injuries and people seeking relief from pain caused by chronic physical ailments.  "My clients are generally referred by family doctors and specialist doctors who work with the patients and who need a more comprehensive and structured treatment plan," she tells us.  The advantage of her business is that she has a long list of clients; the disadvantage is her lack of investment capital to buy creams and physical therapy supplies.  Her dream is to improve her practice; she wants to buy physical therapy supplies, such as creams and massage equipment.  This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the three years she has had her business.  

For these reasons, Elena is requesting a loan to buy creams and physical therapy supplies to stock her practice and heal many people.

loans.use: to buy creams and physical therapy supplies to stock her practice and heal many people

loans.name: Valle De La Luna Group

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 42 años, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 18 años y 1 hija mujer de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de carne de pollo.
Ella es buena madre, dedicada, paciente, comprensiva, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mallasa’ situado en cercanías del radio urbano de la ciudad, Se trata de una meseta amplia que alberga a muchos eucaliptos, donde existen áreas verdes para la práctica deportiva y recreación al aire libre. De clima agradable, y se puede visitar todo el año.
Cristina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera) complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, sostiene a su bebe en su regazo). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela, la hija menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo, energía eléctrica y no tiene alcantarillado.
La necesidad por mejorar su actividad la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de escobas, estudiante de ingeniería, venta de salteñas, venta de comida, venta de frutas, librería y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de pollo; ella se encarga de comprar pollo de la granja para llevarlo al mercado y ofertarlo a mejor precio, el trabajo lo realiza sola en un mercado de la zona, “inicié mi negocio con mi mamá que ya no trabaja, algunas veces me ayuda mi hijo mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes antiguos y continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de operación. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea comprar pollo por mayor para aumentar su oferta, mejorar sus ventas y terminar de construir su casa. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo por mayor para aumentar su oferta mejorar sus ventas y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Cristina is a woman aged 42, married, has two boys aged 12 and 18 and one daughter, aged 3. Her business is selling chicken. She is a good mother, dedicated, patient, sympathetic, optimistic, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business in the 'Mallasa' zone, situated near the urban area. It's of agreeable climate and one can visit all year.

Cristina has tanned skin, long black hair that she keeps braided, brown eyes, short stature, dressed in the traditional form (hat, shawl and skirt). She is of medium physical complexion, her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and because of the business she does. (Seated to the left, she's supporting her baby in her lap).

She shares her life with her husband, who works as a carrier and with her children. The eldest study in the school, the youngest daughter isn't school age yet. They live in their own house constructed from brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof that has well water, electricity and doesn't have sewage.

The necessity of improving her activity led her to forming a bank of people to apply for a loan and improve their activities with businesses like: sale of brooms, engineering studies, sale of salteñas [regional food], sale of food, sale of fruit, a bookstore and sale of second-hand clothing. Her business is the sale of chicken: she is in charge of buying chicken from the farm to take it to market and offer it at a higher price. She does this work alone in the market of the area. "I started my business with my mom who doesn't work anymore, sometimes my oldest son helps," she comments.

The advantage of her business is that she has old and continuous clients, the disadvantage is the lack of operating capital. Her dream is to finish constructing her house. She wishes to buy chicken in bulk to increase her offering, grow her sales and finish constructing her house. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years she's dedicated to this activity.

It's for these reasons that Cristina is applying for a loan for the purchase of chicken in bulk to increase her offering, improve her sales and finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to buy chicken in bulk to increase her offering, improve her sales and finish constructing her house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 66 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children now at their adult age. 

Carmen earns a living from her pension as a surviving spouse. She is also engaged in agri-farming business.  Carmen earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers and sprays for her existing rice production activity.

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Carmen hopes to engage in a cookie baking business.

loans.use: To purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva owns and manages a boarding house space for rental in Singangan, Philippines. This business has been doing well in supporting the needs of her family. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase construction materials for her boarding house spaces to provide a safe and comfortable stay and be able to draw more occupants. This will help her sustain the needs of her family and her children's education. 

She wants to expand her business and aspires to have a commercial building in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her boarding house spaces to provide a safe and comfortable stay and be able to draw more occupants

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad pequeña donde la vida es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamaca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cultivo, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 37, lives in his own house of rustic materials with his partner and his son in the district of San Felipe, a small community where life is tranquil and its inhabitants dedicate themselves to agriculture and animal husbandry. It's located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn. With 20 years' experience in the work he has experience in this sector and good references in his district. He will use the loan that will be granted to him for agricultural labor, application and incorporation of pesticide products, fertilizers and labor for his crop. This will help him improve his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively, as well as have an opportune harvest and therefore have greater production, a better quality of product. Therefore, he will not have problems in selling his product which will generate him greater income that will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to use it for agricultural labor, application and incorporation of pesticide products, fertilizers and labor for his crop.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is a snack vendor from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years and she vends near school. She has five children. 

She is a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative with good standing. With that, she asks for financial assistance amounting to PHP 12,000 to  buy oil, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for snack vending and to help her husband in supporting the needs of her family. 

With the help provided by PMPC, she is very thankful that she can have additional income for her family.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora has mastered her hog raising business in Tudela. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always go there for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 12,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: To build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is managing her eatery business in Sindangan. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. 

This business has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Betsaida

texts.en:
Betsaida signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Betsaida is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Gelda Soledad

texts.es:
Gelda tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Gelda espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gelda is 42, lives with her partner and their two children in the Colasay district, a community dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry. It's found located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru.

She works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. She's worked at this business for the past 10 years, which is why she has fixed clients who provide good personal and work references for her. She will use the loan for the purchase of manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance for her coffee crops. With this, Gelda hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will have a positive impact in her level of income and therefore her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to provide maintenance to her coffee crop.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el Caserío de San José, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales caprinos, porcinos, aves y ganado vacuno, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, es una madre emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de más animales para su comercialización y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Digna is 43 years old and lives together with her children in the small village of San José, a rural zone in the district of Pucará. It is a community characterized by its warm climate. Its population works in the cultivation of rice, this being the most widely produced crop, and also general business and livestock. It is located in the Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

She works raising and selling goats, pigs, birds, and cattle. She has worked in this business for over 10 years. She is an enterprising mother who puts effort into the work she does. She has experience in this business and has good personal and work references in her district. She has requested a loan to buy more animals to sell, and in this way generate greater income for her family, which will allow her to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar lighting system.

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es:
Fredesbinda tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su hija y dos nietos en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, pollos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is 48 years old, single, and lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in a rural area where life is quiet and the inhabitants work in farming and livestock.  It is located in the district of Cayatí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.

She raises and sells animals, such as hens, chickens, and turkeys, among others; she has over ten years of experience in this business and good personal and professional references in the area.  Her business is located in her home.  She is requesting this loan to buy a larger quantity of animals and feed to fatten them.  This investment will help her have a wider variety of animals to offer her customers, which will generate more income that will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and feed to fatten them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for energy efficient items to resell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 32 years old single man who lives at his parents house. As you can see from the picture, it is a modest place. He is also the father of a five year old daughter.

Henry is an experienced disc jokey who works at many places; has been in business for over a decade.

Henry needs a loan to buy new sound equipment for his business He hopes you can help.

Henry would like to have his own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new sound equipment for his business.

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) 3. This group is comprised of five entrepreneurs (women and men) and is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. 

Their community is located in a rural area, surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Ramona sells miscellaneous products, such as clothes. She will use her part of this loan to increase her inventory. Romona started her business almost eight years ago, by taking loans and investing the money in her business. 

Ramona has two children and they live together with her long term partner. 

Her most important challenges is to have a successful business. 

She is receiving her 14th loan from Esperanza Internacional, and because her previous loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business. 

She would like to save her profits to make bigger investments in the future. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jeremias 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Natividad is the coordinator of her group, Jeremías 1 & 2. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children. 

She enjoys marketing and sales; that's why she took a loan and started selling natural medicines and products. 

Natividad started her business with her first Esperanza loan, to sell natural products. She says, "I started my business and added other products, and I have done very well." This is her eigth loan.

Natividad will use the profits to reinvest in her business, because she wants to improve it more and save. Her most difficult challenge is that her husband can live according to the Christian life. 

She is dreaming of having a successful business, a new and beautiful house and providing what her family needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy items to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives at El Alto and sells perfume and other cosmetics to make money. She goes around the entire city offering her products to her customers and tries to get new customers  

Emma works hard and wakes up very early so she can interact with a lot of people. 

Emma is married but her husband is unemployed, so she needs a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business 

Emma would like to have her own store front location in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Adiouma

texts.fr:
Adiouma est le nom d’un habitant d’un village situé à quelque kilomètre de la ville principale, où IMCEC s’est implantée. C’est un sociétaire qui a eu à bénéficier deux crédits payés convenablement. L’activité d’Adiouma est l’agriculture plus précisément, l’élevage de bœufs. Il pratique cette activité depuis plus de 15 ans dans un champ qu’il a aménagé pour cela. Il travaille avec ses enfants qui font paitre les bœufs dans la forêt à partir de 7h jusqu’à 18h.
Adiouma sollicite un renouvellement afin d’acheter de la nourriture pour bétail destinée à ses bêtes dans le but de renforcer leur poids du fait que l’herbe se fait rare durant cette période.
Ce vœu serait de stocker du foin pour pouvoir bien alimenter ses bœufs.
texts.en:
Adiouma is the name of a villager living a few kilometers from the main town, where IMCEC is established. He is a partner, who has benefited from two loans, paid back appropriately. Adiouma’s business is in farming, that is, livestock farming. He has been in this business for over fifteen years in a field he has arranged for this. He works with his children, who take the cattle to pasture in the forest from 7 AM until 6 PM. 

Adiouma is requesting a renewal to purchase some feed for his animals with the aim of building up their weight, since grasses are hard to come by at this time. His wish would be to stock up on hay for feeding his cattle well.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr:
Dès le jeune âge, Doudou s’était déjà imprégné du travail d’éleveur en suivant les bœufs de ses parents. Il s’est familiarisé avec le métier et a par la suite investit dans ce domaine. Il a eu l’appui de l’IMCEC qui lui a octroyé deux crédits avec lesquels il a pris le départ. Doudou a acquis une expérience de plus de 17 ans dans ce domaine, il est disponible pour ses bêtes durant toute la journée de 9h à 20h. 
Doudou est marié et père de 5 enfants dont trois sont scolarisés et c’est grâce aux revenus de l’activité qu’il réussi à tenir cette engagement envers ses enfants et sa femme.
Il a comme ambition de faire de l’agriculture en faisant du maraichage.
texts.en:
From a young age, Doudou was immersed in the work of livestock farming as he followed his parents’ cattle around. He became familiarized with the trade and then invested in this domain. He had support from IMCEC, which granted him two loans with which he began. Doudou has acquired over seventeen years of experience in this domain. He is available to his animals all day long, from 9 AM till 8 PM.  

Doudou is a married father of five children, of whom three are in school. Thanks to the revenues from his business, he has succeeded in his dedication to his children and wife. His ambition is to work in market-gardening.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and then resell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres unidas al progreso está en su  ciclo 28 del programa de comité, es un grupo ya antiguo que viene trabajando de manera unida, todas se ayudan las unas a las otras, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en una situación de pobreza extrema. La Sra. Maria tiene una librería donde tiene todo tipo de productos, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cuadernos, libros, lápices, bolígrafos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas al Progreso is in its 28th loan cycle with the communal bank program.  It is an established group that works as a team; they all help each other.  They are in the poverty eradication program, which helps them improve their living conditions.  

One of the members is Maria, whose survey showed her to be in the first level of poverty, which means that she is in a situation of extreme poverty.  Maria has a bookstore where she sells all kinds of products and through her work she earns the means to help her family.  

She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received to keep helping her loved ones.  She is requesting this loan to buy notebooks, books, pencils, pens, and other items, so she can keep up her sales.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, pencils, pens, and other items.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres Kuña Aty, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedora,  donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Laura integra este grupo, son 19 personas, pero entre ellas se destaca esta señora, quien es muy luchadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora. Laura está poniendo todo de sí para poder seguir creciendo y lo hace con la venta de ropas que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty women's communal bank is in its first loan cycle with the women's communal bank program; they are hardworking and above all enterprising women who all work and help each other to get ahead.  

Laura is a member of this group; there are 19 people, but she is one of them and she is very hardworking and above all very enterprising.  Laura is giving her all to be able to keep growing and she does this by selling the clothing she has. 

She is requesting this loan to buy jeans, tops, t-shirts, pants, and other items so she can keep making sales, as she has been.  She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy jeans, tops, t-shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Solar  está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante por medio de la ayuda mutua y conjunta. Son 18 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas.
La Sra. Matilde es la Presidenta del grupo ella se desempeña como excelente costurera de Ropas y se describe como una mujer luchadora que trabaja por poder salir adelante y necesita el préstamo para poder tener más variedad de ropas y maquinarias, etc., y así poder seguir con su lucha diaria para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Solar is in its 14th cycle with the women's communal bank program; they are women who are the heads of their families who want to get ahead by helping each other as a group.  There are 18 women, all of them friends and neighbors. 

Matilde is the president of the group; she works as a successful seamstress and she describes herself as a determined woman who works to get ahead and needs this loan so she can have a wider variety of clothing, machinery, etc.  This will allow her to continue her daily fight to support her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Pagadian, in the Philippines. She is single and lives with her parents. They have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. 

Evelyn makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for land preparation, holing, and planting of banana and cassava seedlings on their land. She wishes to sustain her business and to be able to provide for their needs.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation, holing, and planting of banana and cassava seedlings on their land

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is from Pagadian. She is earning a living in her retailing business. 

To generate more income, Elvisa decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. 

Consequently, she requested a loan to restock more inventory for her store to increase sales. 

Elvisa smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for her store to increase sales

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Zosima has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional heads of piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hog. Zosima wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. 

Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional heads of piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hog

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 53 years old, married, and lives at Calaran, Calamba, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan to buy additional feed. She really hopes amd prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a hardworking mother of two children.  She lives in Misom, Baliangao, Philippines. 

Her husband is a fisherman but  the income is not enough to to supply their daily needs.  So she finds ways to help her husband in her own way.   Anecita joined Paglaum because of the benefits and services offered by the Cooperative.  

Gardening is her favorite hobby which later on gives her an income.  In order to maximize the limited area, she start planting in different plastic garbage cans.  

As of now, she applied for a loan from Paglaum, which she will use to buy fertilizer for her vegetables and additional seedlings and compost.  She is very happy and at the same time she wants to save to buy a fishing boat someday for her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and compost

loans.name: Nicer

texts.en:
Nicer is 27 years of age and a resident of Sindangan, Philippines. She is married with three kids.  

Her family has a little fishing business from which to earn for a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Nicer and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. 

 They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 14,900 loan.  They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Nicer smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita, a responsible mother, is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more assorted goods for her store. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods for her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and operate a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen food to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Julieta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase spices, cooking oil, can goods, etc.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spices, cooking oil, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old. She is married and has six children. With two children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old. She is a married woman who has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maribel has a general store business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as snack food and canned goods.

Maribel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as snack food and canned goods.

loans.name: Ma. Rina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Rina works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling Natasha products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Ma. Rina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks for her direct selling Natasha products business.

Ma. Rina has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, fanta, cigarettes, sugar, salt, cards and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fanta, cigarettes, sugar, salt, cards and coffee.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana está estudiando para tener un mejor futuro conseguir un trabajo estable y el  días de mañana poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Su objetivo es tener un titulo universitario, para que pueda progresar y salir  adelante. Ella está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Rossana is studying so she can have a better future and get a stable job so that one day she can provide her children with a good education.  

Her goal is to get a university degree so she can make progress and get ahead.  She is pursuing a degree in accounting.  

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se ha hecho la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras se encontraban en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Amalia, quien tiene un tambo donde fomenta la producción y venta de leche, como también la producción de sus derivados en leche. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que pone todo lo mejor de si.
Amalia pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para su tambo, y con ello poder seguir con la producción y con ello poder ayudar a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres en Acción" is in its second loan cycle of the Enterprising Women communal bank program, where all are working and helping one another to succeed. The poverty elimination survey has been done, in which some women were found to be in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Amalia, who has a farm where she produces and sells milk, as well as milk products. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to succeed. That is why she does her very best.

Amalia is requesting this loan so that she can buy livestock, and thereby be able to continue her production and in this way be able to help her family. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy farm animals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia vive con sus padres,  pero luego de terminar sus estudios primarios se propuso empezar a estudiar en la universidad y hoy está estudiando la carrera de Veterinaria.
Ella es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser una profesional y ser alguien en la vida de esa forma.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar libros y pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her parents. After finishing her primary studies she was determined to begin studying at the university and today she is studying veterinary medicine.  She is a person who is giving her all to be able to have a professional career and in this way to be someone in life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy books and to pay her fees.

loans.use: to buy books and pay university fees

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea  vende cosméticos y trabaja como manicurista a domicilio cuenta con una buena clientela formad. Ella a la par que trabaja, también estudia, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Está estudiando la carrera de bioquímica, por medio de su carrera quiere ser alguien en la vida e ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea sells cosmetics and works as a traveling manicurist; she has a good amount of clientele.  In addition to working, she is also in school; she is a very hardworking and determined person.  

She is studying for a degree in biochemistry; she wants to use her education to be someone in life and improve every day.  

She is requesting this loan to pay her school fees so she can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en prótesis dental, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Romina es una mujer que quiere salir adelante y con ello poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, es por eso que está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Romina is from the city of Caaguazú; she is studying for a degree in dental prostheses.  She is a very hardworking and determined person.  

Romina is a woman who wants to get ahead and help her loved ones, which is why she is giving her all.  

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can keep working toward her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. 

She is a member in good standing and attends various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

Filomena has a small piece of agricultural land near her home and requests a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy farm inputs. 

Filomena dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and adequate income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has two children. She lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City.  Norma and her husband earn a living through farming. They mastered doing this type of activity when they got married and supported her children's education and their family needs. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in January of 2013. She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. Norma requested a loan. This will give her farming income a big boost. 

Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agri-business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a good and  high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita has four decades of farming experience. She inherited a piece of land from her parents that was cultivated. When she married a farmer, they both decided to purchase another farmland and to grow various commodities. 

In 2010, Alita joined Paglaum and obtained several loans for her business. Recently, she obtained another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. She hopes to have a good harvest, so she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina makes good earnings every quarter on her rice farm in Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she had a higher cost of living when her children entered college. Sabina approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. 

She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a business woman from the municipality of Tudela, province of Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and has two school age children. 

Sally runs a sari-sari store business and is a rice retailer. She has been in business for almost five years. Her involvement with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative has helped her develop her business. 

Sally has a previous loan that financed the concreting of her house's walls. Now, she seek another loan to renovate her kitchen. She is grateful for the help given by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 64 years old, lives in Danlugan, Pagadian, Philippines. She is married and gifted with two children. 

Rosita's husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, and other agricultural commodities. Rosita has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband to plow the rice field and to plant corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Rosita decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 6,000 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. 

Rosita has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain needed working capital. She hopes to save more money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land

loans.name: Jovieta

texts.en:
Jovieta is married and has three kids. For a living, she engages in buying and selling firewood to the local community. Jovieta has been doing this for five years. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. Therefore, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital for her existing business. She wants to pay for more loads of firewood for retail. 

Jovieta is a new member of PMPC. 

In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life

loans.use: to pay for more loads of firewood

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Louisita

texts.en:
Louisita  is 54 years old, and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Louisita has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from  buy and sell pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old and married with five children who attend school.

She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like diapers, shampoo, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for eleven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase items like diapers, shampoo, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Renel

texts.en:
Renel, 43, is a married woman with four children. Three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Renel has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requests a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Renel has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Renel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Emma has been in this business for30 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jenny Mei

texts.en:
Jenny Mei is 25 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Jenny Mei has a bread retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of bread to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Jenny Mei would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mary Teope

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Teope works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Mary Teope is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mary Teope has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ndarikana Group

texts.fr: Kituki est une brave femme, membre d’une banque villageoise «Ndarikana», âgée de 33 ans, mariée à un commerçant, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 étudient, 2 n’étudient pas et 2 sont gosses. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 150kg de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Kituki is a good and honest woman and a member of the 'banc villageois' called Ndarikana. She is 33 years old, married to a merchant, and the mother of eight children, of whom four are students, two are not students, and two are just kids. This client is a vendor of grocery items. She displays her merchandise at the town’s secondary market. She started her business with funds from her husband. She has been in this business for seven years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 150 kg of potatoes. Thus, Kituki would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs. We are keen to indicate that a client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to purchase 150 kg of potatoes

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu is 34 years old and a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her son, her daughter, and herself. Her children are both obedient and clever. Her family is now living in the Mai Son District of Son La Province. 

Her main job is cultivation and animal breeding. The income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and to save a small amount. Her son is going to take the examination for the final grade this year. She wants to invest in his education by paying private tuitions, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow money to invest in her son’s education.

She will work hard to have money to repay the M7-MFI loan on time, and she hopes that the loan will help her children to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her son’s education.

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Primavera está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julina, que a través del esfuerzo que ella realiza y también el trabajo en equipo dentro del comité, van mejorando en su negocio que es la Artesanía, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
Sra. Juliana solicita  este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y otros insumos necesarios para realizar las prendas de Ao poi,   y con lo cual mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
La Primavera Group is in its 14th loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, where each of them puts their best effort toward growing and getting ahead.  

One of the group members is Juliana who, through her own efforts as well as group work within the bank, has been improving her craft business.  She is a very hardworking and above all determined person.
