Juliana is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, and other supplies she needs to make Ao Poi garments, which will improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads to make Ao Poi crafts

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Joaquina to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. She is living in a town with her family.

She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like oil, sugar and coffee. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 55 years old and from Mahayag. She has a small piece of land for her agricultural activities. Virginia has sought several loans from Paglaum for her farmland and she wants to avail herself of another loan to purchase fertilizer. She is now preparing for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, eggs, shampoo, water, coffee and cigarettes.

Emila opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, shampoo, water, coffee and cigarettes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is  taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She does carpentry, which helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her carpentry business a year ago with her own working capital of $600.

She will use the loan to buy wood, machines and saws.   

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood, machines and saws

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI since January, 1994 and was one of the first members of the program. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family lives mainly by working on breeding and cultivation. They have 7,000 m2 of cultivated land for planting coffee, so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the expenses for food and save a little amount. 

She wants to invest in doing cow breeding, but does not have enough money, so she wants to borrow a loan to invest in a cow-breeding business.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and is hoping that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding by bringing her family tens of calves next year.

loans.use: to invest in a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Hiep's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiep, born in 1992, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her three children, two daughters and one son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from planting coffee, which was all her assets when she was married and stayed separately with her parents (9,000 m2 of cultivated land for coffee). Each year when harvesting coffee, the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expense and saves a small amount. 

Unfortunately, her son was born with a cleft palate, and she wants to send him to the hospital for medical treatment but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to give her son a medical checkup and treatment. 

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and is hoping that the loan amount will bring her son a beamy smile; then he will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to give her son a medical check up and treatment

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 50 years old with four children; she is a single mother and a hardworking entrepreneur.

Her spa was her bread and butter. It helped support her children's education and with daily expenses.

Russel started as a massage therapist on call with only PhP 300-500 per day; nevertheless she dreamed of having her own spa someday. She got her opportunity when her brother, working abroad, gave her capital of PhP 150,000 which she used to rent a space, bought two beds and hired a massage therapist to help her with massage service. She worked hard to provide customers good service, and in time customers patronized her services and recommend her spa to their friends.

Russe'sl Spa now has seven beds with seven massage therapists and is earning a net of PhP 20,000-30,000 weekly. 

Russel shared her blessing by supporting her nieces and nephews in their schooling, and supports her old relatives in their medicine maintenance expenses. Russel makes sure that her employees have employee benefits and supports them through formal training, if they want to apply abroad or to a more exclusive spa center.  

Today, with growing customers, Russel wanted to expand her spa and rent another space to be made into a spa massage center, but her lack of capital prevents her from doing so.

Now Russel is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 100,000 to buy two massage beds, oils, curtains, towels and rental payment for the space for her new spa. These will help increase her income and provide more employment to her community.

Russel wanted to expand her spa in the future so she can provide better future for her children, continue to support her relatives, and to help her community through employment.

loans.use: To buy two massage beds, oils, curtains, towels and rental payment for the space for her new spa massage center

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is applying for a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).

She is married and she has one child, and she is 38 years old. 

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, biscuits, body lotion, candles, shampoo and fish. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Natalia is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, biscuits, body lotion, candles, shampoo and fish

loans.name: Unity Is Progress Group

texts.en:
Cynthia is a member and group representative of the Unity is Progress Group. She has her hand raised in the picture. Cynthia is a local distributor of Elsa Clean cook stoves to rural communities in her area. She earns additional income from the sale of car tires to car owners. 

Cynthia comes from Assin Praso, in the central region of Ghana.

Cynthia believes education is a top most priority for her children and she is doing everything within her capacity to send her kids to good schools with better facilities. 

Cynthia is 40 years old and married with five school age children, ages 21, 19, 16, 14 and 9. 

There is a high demand for her clean cook stoves, since they improve indoor air quality and the health of users. The benefits of the stove far exceed the cost of the stove. 

Cynthia and her group members need this loan to buy more stoves to meet the growing demand from their customers. Funding her loan will also reduce the number of trees cut down to provide fuel.

Cynthia and her group members thank all their micro lenders for their generosity and help in improving the forest within their communities.

loans.use: to buy stoves for resale.

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
Vet, born in 1978, is a Thai woman who lives with her husband and two sons in Mai Son district of Son La province

Her two sons are both obedient and good at studying. The oldest son is a high school senior and the younger attends junior high school.

Vet's main income comes from animal breeding and cultivation. 

From a family of farmer, she wants to care for her children with a good education, but the income from cultivation and breeding is just enough to cover the family’s living expense. Although she is able to save a small amount of money. 

However, that saved money is not enough to pay for her children’s education fees, so she wants to borrow a loan to invest in her children education. 
	
Vet really hopes the loan will help her children learn, and that they will have a brighter future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children's education.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is 33 years old with three children. His wife is helping him with their business of wholesale hardware store and grocery store.

Bryan has been accustomed to hard work since he was eight years old. Living in the province with his grandmother in a poor life status, he learned to sell rice cakes and vegetables after school. As a teen he experienced working as an eggs, crackers and fish ball vendor and worked as a janitor in a mall to earn a living. Bryan dreamed of having his own business someday so he saved most of his earned money and he used the rest to support his grandmother in the province.

Bryan's business opportunity came to life in 2004 when he roamed the market in their community and took orders to deliver cooking oil and condiments (vinegar, fish sauce and soy sauce) from his savings of PHP 5,000 and from there on his business grew. He was taking more orders and delivering his goods to most of the local store areas in their community.

But like most businesses, Bryan also experienced a downfall in 2007 when his family became sick and frequently hospitalized so he spent most of his income and capital to finance the expenses. Together with a bad partnership, his business went bankrupt.

Instead of giving up, Brian tried again using what was left of his money. He roamed his community for orders, this time asking for hardware and grocery orders and delivered them to their doorstep. He delivered them himself, oblivious to the backbreaking work of carrying heavy packages for his customers and working seven days a week.

Bryan now has four branches of his wholesale hardware and grocery store with 17 employed helpers. He is now earning a net of PHP 300,000 a month.

Bryan shared his blessings with his community not just by being a good example but by supporting five of his employees for their education and working for six hours. He also supports his employee’s 11 children with their school expenses through scholarships.

Brian's customers continue to grow and more orders are piling up but he is unable to provide goods and deliver without additional capital. Brian is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 150,000 to buy paint, pipes and brushes, cement, steel, nails and other hardware items to sell and deliver to his customers

Brian wants to expand his wholesale hardware and grocery store to provide a better future for his family and help his community more with employment.

loans.use: to buy paint, pipes and brushes, cement, steel, nails and other hardware items to sell and deliver to his customers.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie, 45 years old, is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Rosalie has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods, school supplies and personal products. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods, school supplies and personal products.

loans.name: Glory Be To Our Saviour Group

texts.en:
Afia, 62 years old, is a vendor. She is the group representative of Glory be to Our Savour group. Afia comes from Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana. Afia lives with her husband and her 4 children, aged 19, 16, 14 and 8. Two of the children attend school. 

Afia has 8 years of experience as a trader, selling fish to the people in her community. She is well known for her quality smoked fish; hence her fish is highly patronized by her customers. Afia and her husband are also peasant farmers to supply food for the family. 

Afia needs a microloan to buy more fish on a large scale from fishermen, which she will then smoke and resell to her customers. She is hopeful of expanding her business in the next five years to be able to use her profits to gradually sell on the market days of the surrounding villages. Afia will also continue to use the rest of her profit to support her children's education. Afia thanks all her lenders for their kind support in realizing her business dreams.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Angelica Camille

texts.en:
Angelica Camille, 23 years old, is married and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Angelica Camille has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelica Camille has been in this business for 3 years and has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Angelica Camille would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna esta estudiando la carrera en ciencias de la educación, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quiere salir adelante, y es por eso que esta poniendo todo de si. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello pudo estudiar.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas de la carrera, y con ello poder estar mas cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Mirna is a very hard-working and enterprising person. She is taking a degree in Education and wants to do well for herself. This is why she is doing the best she can. 

She mentions that she used her latest loan to pay her tuition fees and that is how she could keep on studying.

She is a very enterprising woman. Once more, she is requesting a loan to be able to pay her university tuition fees. In this way, she will be one step closer to fulfilling her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov is a 29-year-old married mother of a dependent child. She earns her main income from selling sugar cane juice and she has been in the business since 2014. Her husband is a 29-year-old factory worker. The family resides in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

Both Sreypov and her husband earn around US $15 each day. Sreypov would like to request a loan as she lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work and for family use. With the motorcycle from the loan, her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expanses. In the future, Sreypov is going to save money to expand her business, renovate her house, and support her only child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 55 years old, is married and has five children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 22 years, Elena has operated a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more beverages such as coconut wine, etc. to sell. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beverages such as coconut wine, etc. to sell

loans.name: Johanna Esther

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer hábil, creativa, muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de leche, mantequilla, con la particularidad de que ellas misma la fábrica en un “taller” que tiene ubicado en su casa, compra le leche fresca recién ordeñada y la procesa, paralelo a esta actividad para complementar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar se dedica a la venta por catálogo, perfumes, ropa, accesorios, billeteras, cremas de manos, productos faciales y aunque no genera mucha utilidad trata de incentivar mucho esta compra en su zona.

Ella es madre soltera, crío a tres hijos por su cuenta con la ayuda de los ingresos que le daban sus dos actividades económicas, su propósito es que ellos estudien una carrera universitaria, que se enfoquen de lleno en esto que ella sigue sosteniendo el hogar lo hizo por muchos años y no dejara de hacerlo ahora.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen, trabajen en un buen puesto en alguna empresa reconocida, ir poco a poco realizando modificaciones a su vivienda y tener salud para trabajar muchos años más.

Johana solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche, envases y una mesa en acero inoxidable, para fabricar sus productos lácteos y productos por catálogo, como pijamas, dulces, ropa, abrigos, accesorios, relojes, lociones entre otros.
texts.en:
Johana is an agile, creative and very hardworking woman who sells milk and butter that she makes herself in a “workshop” in her home.  She buys fresh, recently obtained milk and processes it.  She also sells perfumes, clothing, accessories, wallets, hand creams, and facial products via catalog to help pay the household expenses.  Even though it’s not very helpful, she tries to sell a lot in the area.

She is a single mother and raised three children on her own with the help of her income from her two businesses.  Her goal is for them to attend university, for them to focus on this, and for her to continue supporting the household as she has done for many years.  She will not quit now.

Her dreams are for her children to graduate and work in good jobs at a well-known company, to make modifications to her house, and be healthy so she can work for many more years.

Johanna is asking for this loan to buy milk, containers, and a stainless steel table to make her dairy products.  She also wants to buy catalog products such as pajamas, candy, clothing, coats, accessories, watches, lotions, etc.

loans.use: to buy milk, a table, and merchandise.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 48 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. Elisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elisa has been in this business for 20 years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Divine Help Group

texts.en:
Alberta comes from Assin Akonfudi in the Central Region of Ghana. She is 39 years old. She is married with three children aged 12, 8 and 4 years old, all of whom are in school. Alberta sells coal pots, LPG gas stoves and Elsa clean cook stoves. Alberta and her group members are the only local distributors of Elsa clean cook stoves in their community. Due to the availability of fuel, which is waste material within their community, the demand for the Elsa stove is very high within the community and its surrounding villagers. The Elsa clean cook stove uses palm kernel shells as fuel. The Elsa stove improves indoor air quality and the health of the users, and is cost saving.

Alberta and her group members need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the growing demand. Funding their loan will also reduce deforestation and help greening of the environment. Alberta and her group members thank their micro lenders for their generosity and help to improve the environment within the communities they operate.

loans.use: To buy Elsa stoves for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 38 years old, and married with five children, three of which attend school.  For 1 year now she has operated an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines

Gemma requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.  She has borrowed 1 other time from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gladys Estella

texts.es:
Una maquina fileteadora es la herramienta que necesita la señora Gladys para llevar su negocio de confección al siguiente nivel, ella presta sus servicios a otras empresas, con esta actividad logra generar el sustento para su familia que la conforman 3 hijos y aunque vive con su pareja, él solo recibe un salario mínimo que para una familia tan numerosa no alcanza.

La ventaja principal que tiene comprar una máquina de coser es que podrá aumentar la confección de prendas, sacara mayor cantidad en menor tiempo, podrá comprometerse con grandes cantidades sin quedar mal en la fecha de entrega, se presentaría la oportunidad de contratar a una persona para que le colabore, su negocio crece y esto la llena de entusiasmo, por eso pide amenamente que la apoyen en su crecimiento ya que con el monto que solicita comprara dicha máquina.
texts.en:
A filleting machine is the tool that Gladys needs to take her clothes-making business to the next level.  She offers her services to other companies and generates income to support her family, made up of three children.  Even though she lives with her husband, he only receives a minimal salary that is not enough for such a large family.

The main advantages she has at buying a sewing machine is that she will be able to increase her ability to make clothes in less time, be able to commit to larger quantities without missing the due date, be able to hire another helper, and grow her business, which fills her with enthusiasm.  She is asking for your support in her growth because she will use the money to buy said machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yustania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yustania es una mujer de veintinueve años de edad que vive por la belleza, le encanta crear peinados, hacer maquillajes, aplicar tratamientos en la piel, entre otros. Ella tiene un salón de belleza, se dedica a ser estilista desde sus diecinueve años de edad cuando inicio a estudiar belleza como carrera técnica. Su trabajo duro, la llevo a que ahora tenga una clientela fiel a sus servicios y un negocio prospero. 
En estos momentos que el salón de belleza de Yustania, tiene la capacidad de crecer, ella recurre a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo, con este, planea comprar más productos que conforman su materia prima para trabajar, por ejemplo shampoo, acondicionador, cremas capilares, cremas para la piel, pintura de uñas entre muchos otros. Su principal objetivo es alquilar otro local para hacer más gran su salón, en futuro se visualiza como el mejor salón de belleza, ofreciendo un servicio único y completo.
texts.en:
Yustania is a twenty-nine-year-old woman who lives for beauty; she loves to do hair, makeup and facial treatments, among other things. She has a beauty salon and has been working as a stylist since she was nineteen years old, when she started studying beauty as a technical degree. Her hard work has now brought her a loyal customer base for her services and a prosperous business.

At this time, Yustania's beauty salon has the capacity to grow. She came to Kiva along with MiCrédito so they would grant her a loan. With this, she plans to buy more products that form her raw material for working, such as shampoo, conditioner, hair creams, skin creams, and nail polish, among many other items. Her main objective is to rent another space to make her salon bigger. In the future she sees it as the best beauty salon, offering a unique and complete service.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair creams, skin creams, and nail polish, among other items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Irene has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like body spray, etc.

Irene has been in this business for one year. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like body spray, etc.

loans.name: Merylin

texts.en:
Merylin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merylin is 49 years old and one of her children is in school.

Merylin has a bakery business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, etc. to use in her business.

Merylin has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merylin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and eggs to use in her business

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rodilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and selling firewood. Rodilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of purified water to sell to customers.

Rodilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leah is 35 years old now.

Leah has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Leah has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 39 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, and other groceries.

Marina has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 38 years old and has one child in school.

Mary Ann has an Avon dealer business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like underwear, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Zamera

texts.en:
Zamera is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zamera is 57 years old and one of her children is in school.

Zamera has a buy and sell of bananas business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

Zamera has been in this business for five years. In the future, Zamera would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 33 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ella Jane

texts.en:
Ella Jane is 35 years old and single.

Ella Jane works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ella Jane has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from tricycle passengers.

Ella Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Myna

texts.en:
Myna is 53 years old and has one child. Myna is married, and her child is in school.

Myna is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Myna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Myna has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merry works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from seaweed. Merry is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Merry has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like farming rice.

Yolanda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with one child who is in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for the family.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Emerilyn

texts.en:
Emerilyn is very thankful to Kiva for the loan amounting to PhP 30,000, which she used to buy cavans of rice, processed meat products and canned goods and took the Christmas season opportunity to increase her income. Emerilyn's business is doing well, and from the revenue of her income, her stall that sells cooked meals now has tables and chairs for those who want to dine in.

Recently, an opportunity came to Emerilyn when she saw a rental space near the construction of a condominium. She wanted to rent the space to put up an eatery and take the opportunity to increase her income.

Today, Emerilyn is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to buy fish, meats, vegetables and spices for the menu, make a rental payment and buy kitchen and dining utensils for the space to be made into an eatery in which her husband, a cook, will operate. She also plans to hire a helper from their community to help them with the customers.

Emerilyn's ultimate goal still is to save and be able to buy a house which her family can call their own, as well as continuously support the education of her children.

From general enterprise, Emerilyn is now a small enterprise, since her business is not just to provide for their family expenses but a business generating an income and also helping with the community.

loans.use: to buy fish, meats, vegetables and spices for the menu, make a rental payment and buy kitchen and dining utensils for the space to be made into an eatery

loans.name: Ernesto Nicolaz

texts.es:
Ernesto se levanta todas las mañanas a cuidar su cultivo. Este hombre luchador lleva más de veinte años cosechando maíz y frijol. Él inicio en el mundo de la agricultura con la ayuda de su abuelo, quien también llevo una vida laboral en el campo y que al fallecer le heredó a su nieto la finca donde trabajaron juntos. Ahora tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y está a cargo de cuatro hijos que asisten al colegio todas las semanas y lo apoyan en las cosechas.
La siembra de maíz y frijol se aproxima nuevamente por lo que Ernesto tiene que prepararse para tener excelentes resultados. De manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para agilizar los trabajos. Esta inversión le permitirá elaborar una cosecha de calidad que le traerá más ingresos y que le permitirá seguir sustentando a su familia completa. En sus planes está adquirir un crédito más adelante para ampliar las hectáreas de su finca.
texts.en:
Ernesto gets up every morning to care for his crop. This striving man has been planting corn and beans for more than twenty years. He started in the world of agriculture with the help of his grandfather, who also spent his life working in the fields. When Ernesto's grandfather died, he left the farm where they worked together to his grandson. Now Ernesto is 35 years old, married, and responsible for four children who go to school every week and support him with his crops.

The season for planting corn and beans is approaching once again, so Ernesto has to be prepared in order to get excellent results. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for labor to help with the work. This investment will allow him to prepare a quality crop that will bring him more earnings and allow him to keep supporting his whole family. In the future he plans to get a loan to expand the hectares of his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bacilio Jose

texts.es:
Bacilio tuvo que cambiar sus libros del colegio por herramientas útiles para trabajar en la agricultura, desde sus doce años de edad. Luego de laborar tantos años como jornalero decidió independizarse y realizar sus propias huertas de maíz y frijol, con las cuales ha podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos proporcionándoles sus estudios. Este hombre luchador de 46 años de edad ya lleva treinta años en esta actividad que le ha permitido crecer. Ahora además de ser un hombre exitoso cultivando, posee una pulpería y vende cuajadas que elabora su esposa.
Bacilio cuenta con el apoyo de sus de hijos y de su esposa para realizar una buena siembra. Él sueña con extender su cosecha de maíz y frijoles, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar abono, fertilizante y pagar mano de obra. Además desea invertir en su pulpería comprando arroz, gaseosa, caramelos, galletas, entre otros productos.  Este préstamo le permitirá surtir su negocio y realizar una cosecha de calidad. En un futuro desea solicitar un nuevo crédito para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Bacilio had to change his school books for useful tools to work in agriculture when he was 12 years old. Then after working so many years as a day labourer he decided to become independent and grow his own corn and beans with which he has been able to get his children ahead in life by providing them with their studies. This hard working 46 year old man already has thirty years working in this activity which has allowed him to grow. As well as being a successful farmer he also has a convenience store where he sells cuajada cheese made by his wife.
Bacilio relies on the help of his children and his wife to sow the seeds well. He dreams of expanding his corn and bean harvest and this is why he is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilisers and to pay for labour. Furthermore, he hopes to invest in his store by buying rice, sparkling water, sweets and biscuits among other products. This loan will allow him to stock up his business and have a good quality harvest. In the future he hopes to apply for another loan in order to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene como principal objetivo superarse, su trayecto en la universidad ha sido largo pero muy gratificante, porque ella ama estudiar. En la actualidad, se encuentra en su quinto año de la licenciatura de Ingeniería Agronómica. Su tía ha sido la única persona que ha confiado en ella  y le ha apoyado en su camino como madre soltera de un niño de un año de edad y como estudiante.
Esta esforzada joven ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo y con este pueda adquirir una laptop, la cual es vital en su desempeño académico, con una computadora portátil puede mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos. Para ella la agronomía tiene un campo laboral muy amplio, en un futuro se ve egresada y emprendiendo un negocio propio, también desea estudiar una maestría, desea convertirse en una profesional exitosa que contribuya al desarrollo.
texts.en:
María is a woman whose main objective is to better herself. 

Her journey through university has been long but very rewarding because she loves studying. Currently, she is in her fifth year for a degree in Agronomic Engineering. 

Her aunt has been the only person who has believed in her and has supported her in her journey as a single mother of a one-year-old child and as a student.

This hard-working young woman has approached Kiva and MiCrédito to ask for a loan with which she will buy a laptop. This equipment is vital for her academic performance because with a laptop she can improve the quality of her assignments. 

For her, the field of agronomy has a very extensive labour market. She sees herself graduating from university and starting up her own business in the future. She also wants to pursue a master's degree. She wants to become a very successful professional who contributes to development.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es:
Al entrar a la finca de Abel este joven de 27 años de te recibe con una sonrisa amable y muy humilde, presentándote su trabajo como agricultor y ganadero. Él inició en esta actividad desde pequeño que ayudaba a su padre cultivando maíz y trigo, hasta que un día la cosecha fue tan buena que él papá le pagó lo suficiente para comprar su vaca e irse independizando poco a poco. Ahora ya tiene siete años cultivando su propio maíz y cuidando a las vacas que poco apoco se han ido multiplicando gracias a su esfuerzo.  
 Ahora Abel está casado y es padre de dos pequeños de cinco y de un año de edad, que son su motivación para salir adelante. Él tiene siete años trabajando en su propio negocio quiere invertir más, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar gallinaza y piedra cantera para hacerle un bebedero de agua a las vacas. Este préstamo le permitirá cuidar más a sus vacas y así poder tener una leche de calidad para poder venderlas. En sus planes está pedir otro crédito más adelante para comprar dos vacas más.
texts.en: When you enter Abel's farm, this 27 year old young man welcomes you with a kind and very humble smile, introducing himself as a farmer and rancher. He started this job when he was very young when he helped his father cultivate corn and wheat, until one day his harvest was so good that his father paid him enough to buy his own cow, and he started becoming independent little by little. Now, he already has seven years cultivating his own corn and taking care of the cows, which have been multiplying little by little thanks to his effort. Nowadays, Abel is married and has two young children, who are five and a year old, and who motivate him to move ahead. He has seven years working in his own business, and he wants to invest more. For this, he is requesting a loan to buy poultry manure and quarry stone to build a drinking trough for the cows. This loan will allow him to take better care of his cows, so he is able to have quality milk in order to be able to sell them. Among his plans is to request another loan in the future to buy two more cows.

loans.use: to buy poultry manure and quarry stone.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman, 40 years old, lives in Sadnyasari village, West Bali where most of the inhabitants work as farmers, breeders, salesmen and service workers. She has two children, both of them still in school. Her husband works as a farmer. Ni Nyoman works as a traveling salesperson for a living. She sells various kinds of chips to every kiosk in her village. She makes the chips from bananas and cassava. She puts sugar and fruit flavorings on the chips to make various types of chips. She wraps them with plastic and the price per pack is 5,000 IDR with 10 pieces of chips in each pack.

To enlarge her business, she needs a loan of 4,000,000 IDR. She has plans to produce more chips and will sell them not only in her village, but to other villages. Ni Nyoman also needs an employee to help her. Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase more bananas, cassava, and plastic and pay her employee. With her new business plan, Ni Nyoman expects an increase in profit and she will save all the profit and use it as capital.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, cassava, and plastic and pay her employee

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El Sr Elvio es jubilado, y como un medio de poder generar ingresos para su familia se dedica a la producción de leche, cultivo de productos agrícolas para autoconsumo y alimentación de sus animales vacunos, y otros.
Realiza esa actividad con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa, comenta que proviene de una familia de Agricultores  muy humilde. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera, que le permitirá poder seguir con la producción de leche que tiene.
texts.en: Elvio is retired, and as a means of generating income for his family he makes a living by producing milk and by growing fruits and vegetables for subsistence, for feeding his cows, and for others. He does this work with the help of his children and his wife. He says that he comes from a very humble family of farmers. He is asking for this loan to buy a milk cow, which will allow him to continue producing milk.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow for sales

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso is a brave woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is searching for a job, but recently he has been unemployed.

Tojiniso is a responsible, hardworking, and kind person who supports her husband until he finds a job. She has a business of keeping, feeding, and selling livestock.

They live in a house with no wall to enclose her land and the place where her house is. She is afraid that thieves may get into her house and steal something. She is worrying and does not sleep well.

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan to build a wall. She awaits your kindness and hopes they will live safely.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Faridahon

texts.en: Faridahon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a small village near the mountains. She is married and has five children. Her husband works as a constructor seasonally. He tries to work hard in order to earn money and feed their big family. Faridahon supports and helps her husband. She has been a teacher for almost 20 years at a secondary school. She is well known among students and teachers. She requested a loan to buy construction supplies and renovate her house. Her husband knows well how to renovate a house and it would cost them less. She hopes to have a better condition for living. She awaits the Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and renovate her house

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 45 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are in school.

Loreta is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Loreta has been in this business for twenty years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 41 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Crispina works very hard to provide for them.

Crispina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Crispina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Crispina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sylbeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sylbeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine-vending. Sylbeth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Sylbeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 28 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Ailyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks, biscuits, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, junk foods, and other groceries.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Antonia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy and sell of ready to wear clothing.  Vivian is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Mrs. Thuong  is 38 years old. There are five people in her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard but has a lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan from small business and hired labour.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut, head of the Piling Subur group, is responsible for the payment to MUK. Ni Ketut sold all of her fattening pigs which had been maintained for six months. Ni Ketut is very pleased with the benefits she gets. This is all because of MUK, Kiva and the lenders. She said thanks for the support that she had. The profits, after deductions for payments to MUK, are saved for future needs and business capital.

The Piling Subur group continues to have a loan. The loan in this period is still used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Now Ni Ketut has a sow and many piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive, 500,000 IDR per piglet. She used her loan to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages. She and the members of Piling Subur hope this effort will be advanced and that they can become independent in the attempt, so that they no longer need to borrow. One member is not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en: Soeut is a 39-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care. She has been in this job for over two years. One of the two children works as a construction worker and another one attends school. Her husband is 42 years old and he is an ice cream seller. The family can make about $22 each day. Soeut is short of the money to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet and a portion to buy chickens to resell during the New Year days, therefore she would like to take out a loan. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. This loan will help her have enough finances to build a bathroom for the family use and to buy chickens to resell. For her youngest child's education, Soeut hopes to help her child in earning a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom with a toilet and a portion to buy chickens to resell

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a small village. She is married and has a big family. She is a teacher in a secondary school. She teaches the Russian language to students and she is well known among teachers and students. She has six years experience and knows her job very well. Munira is an attentive, bright and kind person. She is sick now. She wants to be treated in the hospital and continue teaching students. She likes her job and wishes to be healthy. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to be treated in the hospital.

loans.use: to be treated in the hospital and continue teaching students

loans.name: Hayniso

texts.en: Hayniso is a brave woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is living in a remote district where houses are in bad condition since Soviet Union. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a constructor and works seasonally. She has many years of practice doing business. She is a tailor and sews traditional women's dresses. She has permanent clients and is well known for her pretty dresses among customers and friends. Her daughter-in-law helps her to do business. Hayniso is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate her apartment to work in a better place. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment to work in a better place

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 48 лет, вдова, многодетная мама 8 детей, самому младшему сыну 9 лет, старшей дочери - 29 лет. У Жылдыз- среднее образование, у нее очень большой трудовой стаж: работала в школьной столовой помощником повара, 9 лет продавцом в магазине. Сейчас Жылдыз занимается сельским хозяйством и получает пенсию по потере кормильца в размере 3,887 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 25 овец, также обрабатывает 6,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает фасоль. Дети и близкие родственники помогают по хозяйству. В месяц семья Жылдыз получает совокупный доход около 28,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание большой и дружной семьи, но Жылдыз не унывает и ищет источники дохода. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) 2 коров и 10 овец. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния ее семьи.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 48 years old. She is a widow and mother of eight children. Her youngest son is nine years old and her eldest daughter is 29. Zhyldyz has a secondary education and long work experience: she worked as an assistant cook in a school cafeteria, and worked for nine years as a shop assistant. Now Zhyldyz farms and receives a surviving widow's pension of 3,887 som (KGS). Through hard work, today Zhyldyz has two cows and 25 sheep on her farmstead, and also cultivates 6.0 hectares of land on which she mostly grows beans. Her children and close relatives help her on the farm.

Each month Zhyldyz's family receives a gross income of about 28,000 som (KGS). These are insufficient means to support a large and close-knit family, but Zhyldyz is not disheartened and looks for sources of income. In order to further develop her farmstead, Zhyldyz has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) for two cows and ten sheep. After buying the cows, they will be put on their own farmstead. Zhyldyz plans to invest the income from the loan in further augmenting her business and improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows and ten sheep in order to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is 33 years old and a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is hired labour and her husband is a woodworker. She would like to get a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay mainly from the loan each month.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Mrs. Chien is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rural area, and raising poultry and cattle is her main job, which she has been doing for more than 20 years. She has also a daily income from a small business. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially for her children.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagrosa is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Milagrosa has a business of buy-and-sell salt in the Philippines. Milagrosa requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of salt to offer for sale.

Milagrosa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Milagrosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of salt to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mary works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling salt. Mary is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ginalyn is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ginalyn has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a 41-year-old married rice farmer with four children. She lives in a village in the province of Kampong Speu, Cambodia. Three of her four children are working in a factory and the youngest one attends school. Her husband is a 41-year-old construction worker. 

Thea would like to expand her rice farm, so she needs a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her have enough money to buy more farmland and gain more rice crops. For her future plans, she hopes to keep expanding her rice farm, build fences around her house and help her youngest child to earn a high school diploma.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Tukad Kemiri Group

texts.en:
As per the agreement, the Tukad Kemiri Group made their payment on time. During the loan period, they can manage the pigs well. With the instructions from their vet, the group kept the pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Nyoman sold her piglets and earned a profit. Now she became a piglet seller. She’s really happy about that and decided to continue her loan to increase the population of her pigs. She used all of the profit for her family's daily needs and saving.

After they calculated and evaluated the last period, the Tukad Kemiri group decided to continue their loan. The loan will be used to increasing their pig business by purchase new piglets or quality feed. 

Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase three super-quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan will go well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their business until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase three super-quality piglets for fattening

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario esta en pareja actualmente, y con ella tiene 2 hijos, por quienes ambos están luchando y esforzándose para darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Actualmente se dedica a la producción de huevo al por mayor desde hace más de un año, tiene ya una buena clientela que siempre compra de él los huevos que vende.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de gallinas ponedoras, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario has a partner with whom he has two children. Him and his partner are working hard to give their children a respectable life without deprivations.

His current occupation is the production of eggs for sale in bulk. He has been in this business for more than a year and has a loyal clientele.

He is requesting this loan to buy laying hens to be able to continue with his job. He thanks the lenders for the opportunity he is receiving of being able to maintain his occupation.

loans.use: to buy laying hens for egg production.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa se destaca porque su integrantes son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo, es más están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá ir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vilma, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se ha abierto camino con sacrificio y esfuerzo, tiene ya muy buena cantidad de clientes, y sueña con poder tener el día de mañana un local propio de ventas.
Agradece por esta oportunidad, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa stands out because it's members are very hardworking women who want to get ahead. Each one puts forth her best effort and they are part of a poverty elimination program, which will enable them to continue growing and improving everyday.

One of the members is Sra. Vilma, who makes a living selling various types of clothing. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, who has paved her way with sacrifice and effort. She now has a large number of customers, and she dreams of being able to have her own store to sell from. She is thankful for this opportunity, and she says that she is requesting this loan to be able to buy various types of clothing such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.use: to buy various type of clothing to sell such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Ma. Suzette

texts.en:
Ma. Suzette is 59 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Suzette has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Suzette requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Ma. Suzette has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Linnette

texts.en:
Linnette is 39 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Linnette owns and operates a small general shop, selling food items such as rice and canned goods. She has been doing this for four years.

She has requested a loan of $6000 SBD to buy bags of rice and canned goods. She hopes to pay for her children's school fees with the profits she makes with her business. She also plans to help cover her family's daily expenses and wishes to expand her business in the future. 

Linnette joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $6000 SBD helps Linnette buy new stock, including bags of rice and a variety of canned goods, for her general store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Thuoi's Group

texts.en:
Thuoi, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic man. He lives with his wife and his son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Thuoi's family's main income is from his wife’s civil servant salary of VND 4.5 million per month, so he has to spend it very economically in order to have enough money to cover the family’s living expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to build a sanitary unit. 

Thuoi really hopes for the loan amount so that all members of his family will have better living conditions. He will work hard to get money to repay the loan  on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a sanitary unit.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 28-year-old married factory worker with a child, and she is from the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory in the city since 2012, earning around $7 per day. Her husband is a 30-year-old factory worker in the city as well, earning around $7 per day. 

Now she would like to buy construction materials to build a new house, but she is short of the finances, so she needs a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough construction materials to build a proper house and live in better conditions. For her future plans, Thy is going to save money to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and to support her only child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Keta

texts.en:
Keta is 56 years old with six children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. Keta hopes to expand her business to gain more profit; to do this, Keta needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, and a backpack sprayer. 

She joined SPBD in 2015 to seek financing for business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 2° Del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son todas unas personas muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien tiene una despensa, es una mujer muy trabajadora que con su esfuerzo y lucha diaria ha podido mejorar y salir adelante. Ella ha podido crecer y mejorar cada día, y hoy día tiene ya gracias a ello una muy buena clientela. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, carne, lácteos, bebidas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, y quiere seguir capacitándose para poder crecer.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in its 2nd loan cycle. They are from the committee of women programme and are part of the poverty elimination programme. They are all very hard-working women and are above all very enterprising. 

One of the members is Olga who has a provisions store. She is a very hard-working woman who, through her effort and daily hard work, has been able to develop and get ahead. She has been able to grow and improve every day, which means that today she has a very good customer base.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy fruit, vegetables, meat, dairy products, drinks and other items and continue with her sales. She is a very hard-working and determined person and she wants to continue training so that she can develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, dairy products, drinks and other items

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina se dedica a vender sus ropas, es una persona que trabaja y se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, ella comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que le permitió poder seguir con las ventas de sus prendas.
Quiere seguir trabajando y esforzándose a diario, es por eso que pone todo de si para poder seguir creciendo. Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones y otras prendas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liduvina makes a living selling clothes. She is a person who works and puts forth much effort to be able to get ahead and help her loved ones. She says that her previous loan helped her a lot, since it enabled her to be able to continue selling clothing.

She would like to continue working and exerting herself daily. She gives all of herself to be able to continue growing. Today, she is requesting another loan so that she can buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, and a variety of other garments. Through this, she can continue selling in the way she has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to buy various type of clothing to sell such as T-shirts, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy packages of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is living in a village with her family. The place where she lives is well-known as a place of poor water. She is married and has two children. 

She has many years' experience of doing business. She is busy with buying and selling livestock. She likes her business very much and pays attention in keeping livestock. Her husband helps her to do the business. She has permanent clients for her livestock because she feeds the livestock with good forage. 

Lutfiya is planning to widen her business and buy additional livestock. She requests a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She hopes to have good livestock and earn enough money from her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a brave woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is divorced and lives with her parents. 

She participated in startup training provided by IMON and decided to open a new business. She wants to be a tailor and sew traditional women's dresses. She has good conditions in her home for sewing, but she does not have a sewing machine. Now she has appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders for a loan to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to have it and do business in order to help her parents with the finances.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Ester

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Ma. Ester is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell beauty products. Angelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy clothes to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Angelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Estrella is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Estrella has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Venida

texts.en:
Venida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Venida is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Venida has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Venida requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more supplies for her seaweed product business like plaster, etc.

Venida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Venida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her seaweed product business like plaster, etc.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Annabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and kitchenwares for her food business.

Annabelle has been in this business for two years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchenwares for her food business.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is 55 years old and married with three children. Mamerta works very hard to provide for them.

Mamerta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, shampoo, home product care and other groceries.

Mamerta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Mamerta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, shampoo, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 56 years old and has four children. Manuela is married and has three children who are in school.

Manuela is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Manuela requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Manuela has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Manuela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lee

texts.en:
Lee is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lee is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lee has been raising pigs  for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 58 years old and has five children. Sabina is married and has one child in school.

Sabina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sabina has been raising pigs for one year, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sabina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is very thankful to Kiva for granting a loan amounting to PHP 26,000, which she used to buy motorcycle replacement parts such as motorcycle wheels, LED lights and side mirrors, as well as rider and motorcycle accessories such as high speed sniper and leg shields to sell to her customers.

Edna's net income increased by 15 percent, and she was able to pay the loan on time. The revenue of her income helps with the continuing education of her children and medical expenses for her mother-in-law.

Edna's business is doing good in that they hired two mechanics to help them with the repairs. As Edna's customers are growing, the stock of her motorcycle accessories is not enough to supply the demand, especially if there are bulk orders from one of her customers.

Edna is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy additional motorcycle parts and accessories such as side mirrors, head and tail lights, suspensions and brake parts. With the loan, Edna has high hopes to generate more income and provide more for her family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and accessories to sell to customers of her motorcycle parts and repair shop.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer de treinta y nueve años de edad, que ha salido adelante por sus propios méritos. Inició a vender tortillas como una alternativa para generar un ingreso que soportara el salario de su esposo y para que a sus dos hijos no les faltara nada. Ahora ella ha logrado tener una clientela fiel y su negocio de venta de tortillas se ha vuelto más estable. 
Esta luchadora mujer ha detectado que puede aumentar la producción de tortillas, pero para poder hacerlo necesita tener más capital, es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva y MiCrédito, para que le otorguen un préstamo que le permita comprar leña, quintales de maíz, entre otros. En un futuro planea comenzar a vender otros alimentos además de tortillas. Actualmente comercializa su producto en su hogar y a los trabajadores de una fábrica, sus planes son vender su producto a más empresas que le requieran.
texts.en:
Brenda is a 39-year old woman, who came out ahead by her own efforts. She began selling tortillas as an alternative to generate income to support her husband's salary and so her children won't lack for nothing. She has now managed to have faithful customers and her business of selling tortillas has become more stable.

This tenacious woman has found a way how she can increase the production of tortillas, but in order to do this, she needs to have more capital. That is why she turned to Kiva and MiCrédito, to grant her a loan, which enables her to buy firewood, corn, and the like, by the quintal. 

For the future she is planning on starting to sell other kinds of food in addition to the tortillas. At the moment, she is selling her product from her home and to workers in a factory. Her plans are to sell her product to more companies that have a need for it.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and the like, by the quintal.

loans.name: Chuyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuyen is a hardworking woman who is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. 

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standards. Her family’s income is mainly from small business. With more than 10 years' experience and with support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La Sr. Olinda es de la ciudad de Pilar, se dedica a la venta de comidas y minutas en general, está casada, tiene tres hijos, su marido trabaja en la agricultura y tienen una casa propia.
