Ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida, hace más de  5 años, y realiza sus ventas a las personas que trabajan en una fábrica como también a las personas que trabajan por la ruta en reparación.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora, pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Olinda is from the city of Pilar. She sells food and quick meals in general. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works in agriculture and they have their own house. Olinda has been selling food for more than 5 years. She makes her sales to people who work in a factory as well as those who are working on the road that's being repaired.

Olinda is a very hardworking and enterprising individual. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, and greens, among others, to continue making meals and thus keep working just as she has been.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables, meat, and greens, among others, to continue making her meals.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is a hardworking man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. He is living in a rural area where he cannot find any respectable job because he is far from the city and access to the Internet is low. 

He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper and keeps up the household. Firuz, as a head of the family, is responsible to feed their family. He is a businessman and does business in agriculture. He buys and sells fruits. He sells fresh and clean fruits and has permanent clients every day. 

He is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to prepare his personal documents.

loans.use: to prepare his personal documents

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a businesswoman in Sindangan. She is 43 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. 

Ann runs a retail store selling Venetian blinds made of bamboo, commonly used in Filipino native houses. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for her business. Ann believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for her business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a pensioner. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 44 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Gertrudes is in the agricultural business of farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gertrudes requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gertrudes has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yusenis Pahola

texts.es:
Yusenis una mujer de 30 años de edad dedicada a la confección a terceros, ella es una mujer separada, se convirtió en madre cabeza de familia, tiene una nena de 10 y un nene de 6, es una empresaria que se levantó del golpe de la separación con su esposo, asumiéndola con temperamento y madurez, hoy en día esta mujer cuenta con 5 empleados y un negocio que crece.

Toda su experiencia en confecciones la adquirió cuando era una empleada en un trabajo similar, ahora se pone a observar el potencial de su negocio y quiere hacer todo lo que este en sus manos para crecer y ser muy exitosa.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la confección como lo son hilos, telas, remaches, agujas espaciales, realizar un mantenimiento, comprar elásticos, nylon entre otros.

Este préstamo ayudara a la consecución de sus sueños los cuales son comprar vivienda, generar empleo, sostenibilidad de negocio puesto que tendrá sus insumos para buscar lograrlos.
texts.en:
Yusenis is a 30 year old woman who makes clothing for other people.  She is a separated and became the head of her household.  She has a 10 year old daughter and six year old son.  She is an entrepreneur who rose from the shock of separation from her husband and took it on with temperament and maturity.  Now she has five employees and a growing business.

She gained all of her experience as an employee doing similar work and now she sees her business’ potential and wants to do everything she can to grow it and be very successful 

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as thread, fabric, rivets, and special needles, perform maintenance, buy elastic, nylon, and other things.

This loan will help her achieve her dreams which include buying a house, creating jobs, and maintaining her business given that she will have supplies to do it with.

loans.use: to buy supplies and perform maintenance.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelia is 48 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Amelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Amelia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Caacupé, trabaja como secretaria en una empresa constructora, y a la vez estudia la carrera de educación bilingüe, su deseo y mayor objetivo es llegar a ser docente y enseñar las lenguas castellano y guaraní, para poder alcanzar su objetivo principal.
 Aspira a ser una buena educadora y obtener un trabajo sustentable que le ayude a seguir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Caacupé. She works as a secretary at a construction company and, at the same time, she is studying for a degree in bilingual education. Her desire and biggest goal is to become a teacher and teach Spanish and Guarani languages in order to achieve her main goal. She hopes to be a good educator and obtain a sustainable job that will help her move forward. Maria is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Lucy, a 33-year-old, youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother of two children. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Nandihills in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Lucy passionately loves dairy farming. She has been farming for the past four years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

Lucy has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up. Lucy, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this and is applying for a 60,000 KES loan through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a particular variety of dairy cow. She will not only get milk from the cow but also manure that will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Lucy said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Lucy hopes that through her accumulated profits she will be able to start adding value to her milk by packaging it and producing other dairy products.

This loan will change Lucy’s life and secure the future of her school-aged children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo actualmente vive con sus padres y un hermano, trabaja en una Gráfica para poder solventar sus  estudios, ya que estudia en una universidad privada la carrera de enfermería, su proyecto es terminar la universidad para poder trabajar en un hospital público en la ciudad y de esa forma ayudar a sus padres y a la comunidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Aldo currently lives with his parents and his brother. He works in graphics in order to afford his education since he studies nursing at a private university. His project is to finish his degree so he can work in a public hospital in the city, which will allow him to help his parents and the community. Aldo is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is married and has two children. The family lives in Liloy in the Philippines. For the past four years she and her husband have farmed rice and raised hogs. She has become very learned and adept in her job.

Mitchelle joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to access its insurance and credit programs. She is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for her fields as well as more piglets, animal feed and vitamins. These uses will help her boost her income greatly.

Mitchelle is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals in order to sustain her and her family’s needs. Right now she is helping to support her sister in obtaining a college education. She hopes to buy a parcel of land someday to expand her farm and venture into a rice-retailing business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fields as well as more piglets, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Turakul

texts.en:
Turakul is a hardworking man. He was born in the southern part of a country in 1964. He is living in a rural area. He is married and has five children. His wife is a teacher. In the area where he lives, it is common for a man rather than a woman to take a loan, because it is most common for a woman to be a housekeeper. 

Turakul is a teacher at secondary school. He needs to work hard in order to feed his big family. He is planning to buy livestock and get additional income for family expenditures. He is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy livestock. He wishes his children will be fed and have everything that they need to live.

loans.use: to buy livestock and get additional income for family expenditures

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda es de Ciudad del Este, comenta que sus metas son la de recibirse de aquí a 2 años para que pueda ayudar a sus padres y así salir adelante y crecer cada día más como persona y como profesional.
Es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Elda is from Ciudad del Este. She says that her goal is to graduate 2 years from now so she can help her parents and thus succeed and grow more each day as a person and as a professional. She is an individual who is giving her all in order to grow and be someone in life. Elda is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her hog-raising business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. Recently, Marissa requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion. Someday Marissa hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en: Penninah is a smallholder dairy farmer from a village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Just like many farmers in the area, Penninah also does crop farming for subsistence but milk is her main source of income. This year, she is planning to focus more on crop cultivation and making it bigger. She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to purchase tools and farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings. Doing horticulture alongside dairying will help her to offer a wider variety of farm produce at the market and thus make more from the limited farmland space. Income generated from selling crop produce will help her meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to grow crops

loans.name: Angel Enoc

texts.es:
Angel un hombre de 49 años de edad que se dedica  a la venta de alimentos como comidas rápidas cerca de su casa, anteriormente vendía en una mesa que ubicaba afuera de su casa y tenía empaques plásticos donde ponía todos los alimentos, se dice antes porque su idea es evolucionar e invertir para trabajar la misma actividad pero de una manera más cómoda y por ello solicita su apoyo, se sentirá muy motivado si recibe su apoyo ya que con el dinero que podría obtener del préstamo, compraría un carro de comida rápidas y comprar un horno para realizar productos de panadería y cocina gourmet.

Por ello formalmente Angel se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los dos productos mencionados anteriormente, teniendo como principal beneficio la agilidad, comodidad para preparar comidas y principalmente que con el carro de comidas podrá desplazarse.
texts.en:
Angel is a 49 year old man who sells food, such as fast food, near his home.  He used to sell from a table outside his home, and he had plastic packaging where he put all the food.  We say “used to” because of his idea of evolving and investing so he can work the business in a more comfortable way, so he is asking for your support.  He will feel very motivated if he obtains this loan and will buy a fast food cart and oven so he can sell bread and gourmet food.

So, Angel is asking for a loan to buy the aforementioned products and have the agility and comfort to prepare food and be able to set up with the food cart.

loans.use: to buy a food cart.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат, 28 лет, не замужем, 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, хороший трудовой стаж, после окончания двух университетов, она работала секретарем, лаборантом, экономистом и кассиром, сейчас работает главным бухгалтером. В качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, и 1,0 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 8 овец. Доходы от кредита Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurzat is 29 years old. She is unmarried and has two children. She has a higher education and good work experience. After graduating from two universities, she has worked as a secretary, a laboratory technician, an economist, and a cashier, and now works as a chief accountant. She raises animals and grows crops for additional income, having started about ten years ago. Thanks to Nurzat's hard work, today she has three cows on her farmstead and 1.0 hectares of land where she grows beans. In order to further develop her farmstead, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 95,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and eight sheep. Nurzat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and eight sheep to increase her herd.

loans.name: Reberwet Tree Nursery Group

texts.en: The lady raising her hand in the photo is Caren, a member of Reberwet Tree Nursery Group. She is 29 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a vegetable farmer. She grows maize, beans and potatoes to earn a living. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, she learned how to draw her budget and plan well for the future. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva and intends to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers that will help in improving her productivity, hence she will be able to provide food to her family.  Caren is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to help boost farming productivity.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

Rita raises pigs to be sold in her community or markets nearby. She has been doing this for five years.

Rita needs a loan to purchase additional piglets, pig feed and cement. She wants to use the cement to improve her pigs' pen. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's standard of living and expand her business in the future. 

Rita joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of  $6,700 SBD helps Rita buy ten piglets, pig feed and cement for her piggery.

loans.name: Mbukima Shg Group

texts.en:
Raising her hand is Domitilah, who is 47 years old, married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She has a grocery store and also farms maize and beans.

Domitilah and her co-member of the Mbukima Shg group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from its enterprise development training. She and her partner are obtaining a 20,000 KES loan, and she will use her portion to buy hybrid seed for her farm and more kale, cabbages and fruit to sell in her store. Both uses will help ensure food security in her household.

Domitilah is happy for Kiva’s assistance and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed for her farm and more kale, cabbages and fruit to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres emprendedora, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimí, una ciudad rural, de difícil acceso, alejada de la capital del país. Es una zona que está creciendo poco a poco, pero que tiene muchas carencias.
La Señora Daici,  es una de las integrantes, ella es docente, pero también tiene una despensa en la que trabaja arduamente para poder tener de esta manera un mejor sustento para su familia. Es una mujer muy luchadora que pese a las adversidades quiere poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, verduras, lácteos, bebidas y otros, y con ello poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos por medio de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emrendedora group is in its first cycle with the committee program.  The group is from the city of Villa Ygatimí.  It is a rural city with difficult access that is far from the capital of the country.  It is an area that is growing little by little, but it lacks a lot.

Daici is one of the members.  She is a teacher, but she also has a grocery store.  She works there arduously in order to be able to support her family better in this way.  She is a very tenacious woman who, in spite of the adversities, wants to be able to get ahead and help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies in order to be able to stock her grocery store.  She will buy things like vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, drinks, and other items.  With this she will be able to continue helping her loved ones through her earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana vive con sus padres, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a vender lencerías y ropas, además de realizar trabajos de manicura y pedicuro a  domicilio, su mayor objetivo es ser una profesional abogada.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Adriana lives with her parents. In her free time, she sells underwear and clothes. She also does manicures and pedicures at home. Her main goal is to become a professional lawyer. She is a hardworking and determined individual who is giving her all in order to be someone in life and grow. She is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a widow who has a sari-sari, or general store in Liloy in the Philippines. She is a hardworking mother who is determined to pursue her goals for the good of her family.

Carmelita learned that she could obtain financial assistance from Kiva’s partner PMPC. Consequently, she requested a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more inventory for her store and so increase sales. She smiles at the thought of providing her family with a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad is expert in her business of selling. She has been in her sari-sari store business for 15 years. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with two children. She requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from PMPC to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items for her business. Caridad is thankful to PMPC for the help!

loans.use: To restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Armée Du Salut Group

texts.fr: Faida est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédit «Armée du Salut», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 44 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 7étudient et 1 gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché de la périphérie de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter de friperies de détaille. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Faida is a vendor, a member of the "Armée du Salut" ["Salvation Army"] borrowers' group, and a client of the Hekima microfinance institution. She is 44 years old and has eight children, seven of whom are in school and one is still very young.  Faida  launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She  has been selling used clothing at a market on the town's edge for eight years. 

She will buy second-hand clothing at retail prices. She would like to grow her loans and be able to pay for her children's schooling and food. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 54 years old, married and has three children. For the past twenty years she has worked steadily cooking and selling food as a business in the Philippines.

Neria has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for the food she cooks and sells. She wants to save enough money to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old, married and a father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2014 to benefit from its training, especially regarding enterprise development. He has greatly benefited from the skills he acquired to effectively manage his business.

Paul is borrowing 10,000 KES to buy motorcycle repair tools to use in training and creating jobs for youths who wish to learn the trade. This venture will also increase his own income and so help him provide for his family’s basic needs.

Paul is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for this financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle repair tools to use in training and creating jobs for youths who wish to learn the trade.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is the woman in the photo. She is married and the mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has benefited greatly from the financial management and enterprise development training.

She weaves baskets for sale using wool and sisal. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy sisal and wool in bulk at a lower cost, and hence realize an increased profit margin, and at the same time increase her stock.

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more sisal and wool in bulk at a lower cost, and hence realize a bigger profit margin, and at the same time increase her stock.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Liz  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es soltera, le ayuda a su madre en el taller de costura que tiene  y por la noche estudia  gracias a su trabajo.
Está estudiando la carrera de Kinesiología, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia , aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Liz is from the city of San Lorenzo and is single. She helps her mother in her sewing workshop and at night, she studies thanks to her job. Liz is studying for a degree in Kinesiology. She is a very responsible individual and is dedicated to her studies and to her family. She hopes to become a good professional and to continue studying and serving people. Liz is requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El Joven José vive en la ciudad de Itá con sus padres, es estudiante, está cursando el cuarto año de Licenciatura en Psicología, el mismo trabaja con su padre hace varios años el cual se dedica a las ventas varias, es soltero. Su mayor anhelo es terminar su carrera y así poder conseguir un trabajo donde pueda percibir un salario mayor y así  seguir estudiando y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en: José lives in the city of Itá with his parents. He is a student and is in his 4th year studying a Psychology degree. José has been working with his father for several years selling a variety of products. He is single. His greatest desire is to finish his degree and thus get a job where he can earn a higher income in order to continue studying and that way help his parents. José is requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue striving towards his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rita está en el ciclo número 1 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien es la directora de Finanzas del Comité.  Ella se dedica al comercio, es decir tienen una empresa familiar de materiales de construcciones, y además se dedica a la venta de joyas por cuenta propia. Su marido también trabaja, es funcionario de una empresa Constructora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcción para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita group is in their 1st loan cycle with the Enterprising Women's Committee program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey.

One of the members is Lidia who is the Director of Finances for the Committee. She works in commerce, that meaning that she has a family construction material business and she also sells jewellery on her own. Her husband also works as an official in a construction company. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy construction materials to sell. In this way she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue to grow as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy construction material to sell.

loans.name: Melan

texts.en: Melan has started her small-time small grocery business and became profitable, helping to support her husband in raising their family. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she has good salesmanship and characteristic effort. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia has always had an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Aloran and has made good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Celia knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Celia hopes to buy a rice thresher to potentially earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 62 years old and married with four children. Simplicia works very hard to provide for them. Simplicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Simplicia has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, school supplies and other personal care products. 

In the future, Simplicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Naum does not possess a university degree, but as an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya she commands a lot of respect. For the past seven years she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of her immense knowledge, farmers flock to her home to seek technical advice on the best techniques. Naum has identified free space on her farm that she wants to fully utilize by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices have been going up in the recent past. Naum, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this trend. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure to boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk should never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Naum said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Naum hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting to offer services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. She hopes that this loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is 49 years old, married with four children, and living in Kasese Uganda. Shem is a salary earner who supplements his salary with farming coffee and bananas. He has a dream of educating his children to university level. He is faced with a challenge of lack of appreciation from political leaders and the unpredictable weather changes. Shem wants money to buy land to expand his piece of land for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy land to expand his piece of land for agriculture.

loans.name: Rurii Women Group

texts.en: The person raising her hand in the photo is Rahab, a member of Rurii Women Group. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of six. She does maize and bean farming. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits out of her business. Rahab is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm seeds and fertilizer to help boost farming. This will greatly boost her business which will result in increased income which will enable her to cater for her clothing, food and other needs for the family. Rahab is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to help boost farming, and thus earn more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es  Horticultor y pintor de obras,  tiene su huerta con cultivos de locotes y otras verduras que luego comercializa en su propio barrio y ciudades cercanas.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos pudo construir una vivienda propia donde actualmente está viviendo con su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un sistema de riego para poder usar en su huerta, la cual es su base de manutención para su familia.
texts.en: Blas is from the city of Carapeguá. He is a market gardener and a painter. He has a vegetable garden, where he cultivates bell peppers and other vegetables that he later sells in his own neighborhood and in neighboring cities. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to build his own house, where he is currently living with his family. He is requesting this loan to invest in buying an irrigation system for his vegetable garden, which is the basis of support for his family.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Jose” está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo.
La Sra.  Pabla una de las integrantes, ella tiene un carrito y sale a vender lomitos, de su propia fabricación todos los días. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las capacitaciones vaya mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y está poniendo todo de su para crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, huevos, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “San Jose” is in their 2nd loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. She is from the city of Concepción, which is an area somewhat far from the center and in is growing. The area is a bit hard to access so the members of this group want to fight to go on growing.

One of the members is Pabla. She has a cart and goes out selling lomitos (pork sandwiches) that she makes herself every day. She wants, as time goes by and by taking training, to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is very good at what she does and is doing all she can to grow and get ahead. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying meat, vegetables, eggs, condiments and others and in this way continue with her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, eggs, condiments and other products to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 46 years old and currently lives with her husband and two children. A farmer who plants corn and beans, she is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family.

Rosenda wants to increase sales and so has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina. a 58-year-old married mother of three, is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalina has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for three years. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking 42-year-old smallholder farmer from Kapsowar who practises horticultural farming for a living. She is a self-driven lady who believes in the coming together of people to overcome challenges and obstacles. 

In Koibarak village where she comes from, farmers lack financial services. Agnes rounded up a group of them on a mission to get ahead but lacking  adequate financial resources. They formed Chemwon Group, and Agnes was appointed the chair lady. The group started saving and table banking and soon sought financial resources using their savings and group cohesion as security. Needless to say, Juhudi Kilimo Microfinance took them in. 

Agnes is now seeking an individual loan from Kiva via Juhudi Kilimo to expand her horticultural farm. She will use the loan to pay for basic farm inputs. Some of the profits generated from this investment will be rolled back into the business, while the rest will go toward her household expenses.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Las Artesanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  Las Artesanas se encuentran en su ciclo numero 3 del programa de comité está conformado por 17 mujeres  que luchan por un progreso digno y por el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evangelista,  en ella se destacan  las ganas y deseos de superación  siempre  demuestra una actitud positiva dedicándose a su labor de todos los días. Ella es artesana y está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, agujas y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida, y con ello poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: The group is called "Las Artesanas". They are in their third loan cycle of the committee program. it is formed by 17 women, who work hard for a dignified progress and for the improvement of the quality of life of each of them. One of the members is Evangelista. She is characterized by her wish and desire to progress. She always shows a positive attitude, devoting herself to her job every day. She is an artisan, and is giving her best effort to move ahead every day. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying threads, needles, and other things, in order to continue with her job as she has been doing so far. She is putting her best effort to be something in life, and with it to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles and other things.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La Sra. Monica es de la ciudad de Pilar, está casada, y tiene dos hijas, comenta que su marido trabaja en un Puesto de Salud, ella se dedica al rubro de las ventas ambulantes hace más de  10 años, y realiza las ventas de sus productos varios en el pueblo mismo y por todas las zonas aledañas, tiene movilidad propia, moto que utiliza para realizar sus ventas.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de mercerías, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Señora Monica is from the city of Pilar. She is married and has two daughters, and she says her husband works in a health care facility. She has been a travelling vendor for more than ten years, selling her varied products in the town itself and throughout all the surrounding areas. She has her own transportation, a motorcycle that she uses to carry out her sales.

She is a very hardworking, enterprising person. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of articles of clothing, footwear, notions, and other items.  In this way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing, footwear, notions, and other items.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura en Contabilidad, a la vez que estudia también está trabajando como Consultora Contable en una empresa con la cual ayuda a su familia.
Es una persona que quiere salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que está poniendo todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Delia is studying for an Accounting degree. At the same time, she is also working as an accounting consultant at a company, which helps her family. She is an individual who wants to succeed and be someone in life, which is why she is giving her all. Delia is requesting this loan to pay for her tuition so she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Reciel

texts.en:
Recie, who is married and has had a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines for four years now, earns additional income from fishing. She works hard to support her family. 

Now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell, Reciel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rocio Enith

texts.es:
Rocio una dama de 38 años de edad, cabeza de familia, le gusta el emprendimiento, ser su propia jefe, ella tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, trabaja en los difíciles terrenos de las calles con su carro de helados y la venta de dulces, papas en bolsa, chocolates y gomas de mascar, el negocio lo inicio en el año 2012 empíricamente y por necesidad económica.

Se siente muy bien de trabajar en su negocio, tiene ingresos legales, aunque es humilde saca muy orgullo pues a su hija nunca le ha faltado un plato de comida en la mesa, no se le negó la oportunidad de que estudie por falta de recursos, ella se rebusca sus maneras para salir adelante.

Pero la historia de esta empresaria no termina, ella cuenta con dos empleados, tiene dos carros de helados como los que podemos ver en la foto, ella misma los surte y les paga un jornal, una mujer muy organizada que se nota las ganas de progresar que tiene.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de sabores de helado, dulces, gomas de mascar, conos para servir helados, servilletas, papas en bolsa, se compromete a pagar muy puntual, apoyala dale alas a esta empresaria que quiere volar hacia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rocio, a 38 year old woman, head of the family, likes entrepreneurship, being her own boss, and has an 18 year old daughter.  She works the difficult parts of the street with her ice cream cart and also sells candy, potato chips, chocolates, and gum.  She started the business in 2012 on her own out of financial need. 

She feels good about working her business.  She has a legal income, although a humble one she is proud because her daughter is never in need of a plate of food on the table, and she was not denied the opportunity to attend school due to a lack of resources.  She gleans her ways to get ahead.

But the story of this entrepreneur has not ended.  She has two employees and two ice cream carts as we can see in the photo.  She supplies them and pays them.  She is a very organized lady with a desire to progress.

She is asking for a loan to buy flavors of ice cream, candy, gum, ice cream cones, napkins, and potato chips.  She is committed to make her payments on time.  Support her and give wings to this entrepreneur who wants to fly to a better future.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides the services of making shutters for buildings. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. Parveen is applying for a loan from a Kiva field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 48 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Analie works very hard to provide for them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Analie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.en: HAGURUKA is a group led by Regine who is 47 years old. The group name means “Stand Up” in English. This member is married with ten children aged between five and 29 years. They all go to school. She is a tailor and has been doing business for the past ten years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises pigs that she sells in her community. She has been raising pigs for ten years.

Margaret has requested this loan to buy additional piglets, pig feed and a water pump for her business.
She hopes to help cover her family's weekly expenses, pay for her children's school fees and improve her business with the money she earns. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $5,700 helps Margaret buy six piglets, pig feed and a water pump for her piggery.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
The person who appears in the photo is Felista, a mother of five. She first joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from the Savings and Resource Mobilization and Enterprise Development training modules. 

Felista is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy locally-produced mango fruits to enable her make and sell natural mango juices in her neighborhood and hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy locally-produced mango fruits to enable her make and sell natural mango juices in her neighborhood and hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 27-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide them with a better future. Joan was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 7 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. 

Joan has space on her farm to use for dairy farming, so she respectfully requests a loan to buy a dairy cow. Nandihills is an area that has a large population and there is a high demand for milk. Joan, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. 

Joan plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Joan patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Divino Niño Jesús” está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Todas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras que han puesto todo de sí para poder crecer cada día.
La Sra. Paola se dedica a la venta de ropas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vende sus productos de manera ambulante, y con lo que obtiene puede ayudar a su familia. Quiere ir creciendo y mejorando cada día, es por ello que pone todo de sí y tiene mucho entusiasmo de poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” group is in its 11th cycle within the Comité de Mujeres program, where they all work together and help each other get ahead.  All of these women are very hardworking and sacrificing and have given their all to grow daily.

Paola sells clothing and is a very hardworking woman who sells her products on foot and helps her family with her earnings.  She wants to continue growing and improving each day, so she gives her all and is very enthusiastic about continuing to grow.

She is asking for this loan to buy articles of clothing such as shirts, pants, and other things so she can continue working as before.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Erajshoh

texts.en:
Erajshoh is a brave man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married. 

For almost eight years Erajshoh has been in the agriculture business. He buys and sells livestock. He keeps and feeds livestock, then sells them in the  animal markets of the district and village. 

He got sick, and unfortunately he has no money to be treated in a medical clinic. Erajshoh appealed to IMON and KIVA lenders to support him to be treated in a medical clinic. He will need to go to a medical clinic in the city, because in the area where he lives they do not have a medical clinic. They just have a medical center which provides basic help.

loans.use: to be treated in a medical clinic

loans.name: Lolita Juliet

texts.en:
Lolita Juliet finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 56 and married, she busies herself to provide for the family. 

She took the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with her capital to support her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Lolita Juliet wishes to expand her business and to be able to open a flower shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 37 years old, married, and has two children.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Sylvia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years.

Sylvia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.ru: Шарипа, 59 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Шарипы - среднее образование, она в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Шарипы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, лошадь и 10 овец. На 2,96 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства Шарипа старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма. Шарипа планирует увеличить доходы от бизнеса и направить прибыль на постройку нового дома для ее сыновей.
texts.en: Sharipa is 59 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes a second source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows, one horse and 10 sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans for resale on 2.96 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 17,000 som (KGS) and tries to invest her savings in the development and expansion of her business.  Sharipa has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few steers for fattening.  She is planning to increase the income she makes from her business and to use her profits to build a new house for her sons.

loans.use: to purchase a few steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jemma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store.  Jemma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more ready to wear clothes such as t-shirts, pants, shorts, slippers, etc.

Jemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothes such as t-shirts, pants, shorts, slippers, etc

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a smallholder farmer from Arimi location in the Molo area of Kenya. Molo experiences a cool and wet climate making agriculture the main economic activity of the constituents. Dairy farming, in particular, is a big business in Molo. This has led to the swarming of milk processing plants and creamery companies. The upside is that farmers like Salome have a ready market that offer economic prices. 

Salome is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a heifer. Heifers are more valuable to farmers since they will not only produce milk but also bear calves which will increase their asset base. 

With your loan, Salome will not only make additional income from the new cow, but also have enough milk to sell and feed her child.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, flour, chicken, and utensils for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, flour, chicken, and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. Noemi requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries, such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft-drinks, bread, spices and other personal care products.

Noemi has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear items. Noemi aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft-drinks, bread, spices and other personal care products.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is a 57 year old mother of 10 children.  She runs a small business selling tuna fish sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Faaiuga needs a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, containers, and butter to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profits. 

Faaiuga became a member of SPBD in 2014 and she is a citizen of Samoa.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, containers, and butter

loans.name: Rheby

texts.en:
Rheby is 28 years old with two children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines. Rheby requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rheby has been in this business for five years. She also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear items and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married, 37-year-old woman, and mother of four children. Three of the children are still in school.  

She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Jonalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

Jonalyn requested a 11,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as chicken, meat, spices, cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as chicken, meat, spices, cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is 41 years old, married, and has five children.

Meliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 60,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Meliza has borrowed and paid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Meliza aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and married with ten children. Two of her children are in school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from motorcycle passengers and fattening pigs.

Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nadeua Group

texts.en:
Yommala’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Yommala and her group are excited that the TerraClear filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Yommala and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within these 2 years filter users, like Yommala’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illnesses and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and a tailoring business. 

Helen is borrowing 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Kaengphosee Group

texts.en:
Lack understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Lack knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Lack purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water.   

Lack is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina works hard to support her family. Regina is married and has a farming fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

Regina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Regina has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kangpa Group

texts.en:
Khanthong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Khanthong and her group are excited that the TerraClear filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khanthong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, and within these 2 years filter users, like Khanthong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Consolata, pictured above with her child in the background. Consolata is from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Consolata is 35 years old and a proud mother of three lovely angel-looking children, whom she really adores and cherishes. Aside from doing a side hustle business, Consolata is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past fourteen years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.

Consolata practices mixed farming, growing maize and keeping dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows Salat. She really enjoys taking care of her dairy cows. Although Consolata has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. She needs to increase her land. She is respectfully requesting a loan to buy more land. Through this loan, her cows will have enough grazing land and she will be able to plant more crops on the land. Through the purchased land, Consolata will be assured of a better harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Consolata's plan is to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more and more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married 45-year-old woman with six children. She lives in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal, in the Solomon Islands.

Elizabeth raises chickens that she sells in her community. She has been doing this for two years. She needs this loan to buy additional chicks for her business. She plans to help meet her family's weekly expenses and would like to improve her business with the money she earns. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El socio Ricardo pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio”
El socio Ricardo alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de materiales de construcciones socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio vende lo que son bloquetas, ladrillos entre otros, él socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que el socio solicita el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de broquetas entre otros.
El socio Ricardo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ricardo is part of the village bank “Tercer Milenio”. He spends his days selling construction materials. He is responsible and dedicated. He sells cinderblock and bricks, among other things.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time. He will use the loan to buy cinderblock and other things. He is thankful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and promises to pay it back in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy cinderblock and other things.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Patria-Rupuyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE PATRIA-RUPUYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulalia ella es conviviente y tiene 53 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the village bank “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE PATRIA-RUPUYOC”, located in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convencion in the state of Cusco.

Eulalia, 53, is married and has one son. She grows fruit on her land - plantains, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6am to 5pm. She has been doing this work for a number of years and it's going well for her. Her dream is to increase the land that she cultivates.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is thankful to those who are part of her dream through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

The other members of the bank work in clothing sales, animal sales, grocery stores and food sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosinha

texts.en:
Rosinha is taking a loan of $ 600.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 200.00.  

She will use the loan to buy inventory to keep in her store such as water, biscuits, fish, noodles, a refrigerator, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and beer.

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy water, biscuits ,fish, noodles, a refrigerator, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and beer

loans.name: Thabor Group

texts.en:
Saeng understands the difference the TerraClear water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Saeng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Saeng purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water.    

Saeng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Hadyeun Group

texts.en:
Thone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

Thone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Thone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

Thone is excited the TerraClear filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  The water filter Thone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Thadorkkham Group

texts.en:
Sone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

Sone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Sone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Sone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Sone is excited that the TerraClear filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Beungxe Group

texts.en:
Khanxai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khanxai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 


Khanxai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, and within these 2 years filter users, like Khanxai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Natan Group

texts.en:
Kamgphon understands the difference the TerraClear water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Kamgphon knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Kamgphon purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  
The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water.   

Kamgphon is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
La socia Armandina pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio”.
 La socia Armandina alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende lo que son arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Armandina is part of the village bank “Tercer Milenio”.

Armandina has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, milk and other things. She is responsible and dedicated.

She will use the loan to buy sugar, oil and other things. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments in the established timeframe. Through this loan she hopes to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil and other things.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Del Mirador Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS GAVIOTAS DEL MIRADOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adriana ella es conviviente y tiene 59 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank "Las Gaviotas del Mirador." This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, in the province of La Convencion, department of Cuzco. Mrs. Adriana is a common law wife, and she is 59 years old. She works raising animals, she raises guinea pigs and chickens. Through this business, she wants to have her own grocery store because she wants to have her own business. She also would like to have a larger space to sell her animals. She is asking for this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as animal food. The other members work selling animals, in agriculture, in a grocery store, and in a food stand. The member is grateful to those who make this dream possible and is committed to make her payments in the established time.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as animal food.

loans.name: José Abel

texts.es:
Don José es un caficultor del Norte de Nicaragua. Su finca está certificada bajo comercio justo, lo cual le da un valor agregado a su producción. En período de mantenimiento y cosecha, este pequeño emprendedor genera empleos a pobladores de su comunidad. 

El café, es la principal actividad de ingresos para José y su familia, y para mejorar  la productividad de su café, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permitan realizar las aplicaciones adecuadas a su cafetal, a fin de lograr mayor rendimiento y calidad, y con ello incrementar sus utilidades este año para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a coffee farmer in northern Nicaragua. His farm is certified fair trade which adds value to his product. During the period of maintenance and harvest, this small businessman generates jobs for members of his community.

Coffee is the main source of income for Jose and his family. In order to improve his productivity, he is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs to apply to his crop with the goal of better performance and quality. This way he will incrementally increase his profit every year in order to met the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Wuanghin Group

texts.en:
Mon and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.
