Mon and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease, and after totaling up the costs, Mon and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Mon and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Mon is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es:
Ronaldo es un empresario que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 10 años. Sueña con crear un ambiente de confianza en su finca para sus empleados y aumentar la productividad de sus cafetos para incrementar sus ingresos y los de sus colaboradores.

Para este año, Ronaldo está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos necesarios que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su cafetal y tener mejores rendimientos a los obtenidos en años anterior. Su pequeña finca se ubica a una distancia larga y de difícil acceso del centro del municipio, lo cual incrementa los costos de los insumos en su comunidad, por lo que al contar con un financiamiento, también le permitirá acceder a insumos a menor precio, ya que bajaría al municipio a comprarlos directamente al proveedor

La meta de este pequeño emprendedor es incrementar los ingresos y rendimientos de su cafetal, disminuyendo los costos e implementando buenas prácticas agrícolas y de administración.
texts.en:
Ronaldo has been growing coffee for 10 years. He dreams of creating a trusting environment on his farm for his employees, and of increasing the productivity of his coffee plans in order to increase his income and that of his partners.

This year, Ronaldo is asking for a loan to buy needed inputs that will allow him to improve conditions on his coffee plantation and have better performance than last year. His small farm is located a long way away and is difficult to access from town, which adds to the costs of buying inputs in his community. This is why he would like a loan, and also so that he can buy them at wholesale and get a better price.

This small businessman's goal is to increase his income and productivity of his coffee plantation by decreasing his expenditures and implementing agricultural and managerial best practices.

loans.use: to buy agricultural input for his coffee crop to improve productivity.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 29 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kuan3 Group

texts.en:
Maichab’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Maichab and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, and within these 2 years filter users, like Maichab’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Maichab and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Zohir

texts.en:
Zohir is a hardworking man. He is living in a rural area where agriculture is a common business to do. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. He is married and has two children. His wife helps him to do the business. In the area where he lives, business is done mostly by men, not women.  

For almost 15 years, he has been doing business in agriculture. He plants vegetables and fruits and sells them in the domestic market. He loves his activity and earns enough money to feed his family. Zohir is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process his land and gain a good harvest from his planted seeds. He wishes to have a good harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process his land and gain a good harvest from his planted seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, and chainsaw

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia Claudia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia vende cemento, arena y clavos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Claudia continues her work selling construction materials. She sells cement, sand and nails. She works from 8am to 8pm. She's been in the business for some years now and it's going very well.

Her dream is to grow her construction supply business. She asks for a loan to buy cement, sand and nails. She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails and sand.

loans.name: Mauro Juvenal

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,el es cesante de educacion,el socio por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere sañir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.El socio solicita el credito para comprar tortas y sandwichs.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mauro Juvenal continues his business selling food. He was laid off from his job in education and this small business is how he makes a living. His dream is to grow his food sales business.

He asks for a loan to buy cakes and sandwiches. He is happy about the loan and promises to meet his payments.

loans.use: to buy cakes and sandwiches.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
El socio continua dedicándose  al negocio de la construcción, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas entre otros.
El socio Cecilio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad y seguir creciendo cada vez más.
texts.en: The member belongs to the community bank "Tercer Milenio" in the province of Urubamba, in Cuzco, Peru. He continues to work in construction. He has been working in this business for quite a long time, and his job is going well thanks to the dedication he gives to his work every day. He is a responsible and dedicated person, he wants to continue working in his business to be able to continue supporting his family. He is asking for a loan to buy tools among other items. Cecilio thanks Kiva for allowing him to develop his business and to continue growing more each time.

loans.use: to buy tools among other items.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old, married and has three children. 

Gina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 39 años de edad, y desde pequeña ha estado relacionado a la producción de café, a lo cual se dedica desde hace 15 años, como fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia, además del cultivo de cacao. 

Es una emprendedora esforzada, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que su finca cumpla con los criterios de los procesos de certificación comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, demostrando la labor que día a día viene realizando en su pequeña finca.

Su meta para este año es aumentar la productividad de su café,  mejorando la nutrición de sus cafetales, por lo que está solicitando un crédito que le permita darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su cultivo, y asegurar mayor rendimiento y calidad, y con ello mayores ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos, los cuales son los que la motivan cada día a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Irene, 39, has worked in coffee production since she was young, and it has been her job and income source for her family for 15 years now. She also grows cacao. She is a forceful entrepreneur who has worked hard to get her farm to meet the criteria for Fair Trade Certification, U.T.Z. and C.A.F.E Practices. This proves the effort that she puts in every day on her small farm.

Her goal for this year is to increase her coffee production by improving the nutrition of her coffee plants. This is why she is asking for a loan that will allow her to adequately maintain her crop and assure better productivity and quality. With the increased income she will be able to assure the wellbeing of her children, who are her motivation to move forward every day.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee plantation and get a good harvest.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.  She has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kouyaudom Group

texts.en: Bouthan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bouthan and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Bouthan and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Bouthan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nadee Group

texts.en: Phomma understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phomma knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phomma purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Phomma is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sinxai Group

texts.en: Chid is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Chid and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Chid and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Chid and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chid and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Donekeo Group

texts.en:
Bai understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Bai purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent to buy charcoal, and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. 

Bai is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years.  This will allow her and her group to continue receiving the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a farmer from Mahayag. She grows rice on her farm and earns enough to support her family well. Francisca doubles her effort to continuously support her three children; she joined Paglaum in 2011 and has accessed several loans for her farm. 

Francisca is happy to maintain the status of a member in good standing, which enables her to receive special loan rebates and lower interest rates. She now has applied for another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. For the coming enrollment period, Francisca hopes to send her children to school and save for a house renovation.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: Lagi is a 57-year-old mother with 11 children.  She is strong and fit to operate her business of selling vegetables at the market, which is how she earns a living. Lagi hopes to gain more profit from the business.  To do this, she has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, vegetable seeds, chemicals, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Lagi became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, vegetable seeds, chemicals, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en: Azamjon is a strong man. He was born in the southern part of the country in 1978. He is living in a rural area where most men do business and women keep house. He is married and has three children. To raise his children and feed his family, he needs to work hard and earn money. For about two years, he has been working as a master of welding. He does his job very well and has permanent clients. The money that he earns from his work is not enough for every day needs like food and clothes. He is planning to do additional business in agriculture. He has good conditions in which to keep livestock at home. He requests a loan to buy livestock. He awaits the Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie works hard to support her family. Connie is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Connie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes such as shorts, t-shirts, blouses and more.

Connie has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothes such as shorts, t-shirts, blouses and more.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 32-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker and has been in this service for six years. Out of his savings, he has managed to start a mini-supermarket to supplement his income. 

Julius' dream is to own a big super market where he will make more profits. Julius is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks, rice, and cooking oil to sell in his mini super market.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks, rice, and cooking oil to sell in his mini super market.

loans.name: Bonheur Group

texts.fr: Rose est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Bonheur», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 26 ans, mère 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en huile de palme, arachides et les épices. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Rose is a merchant, member of the "Bonheur" community bank, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 26-year-old mother of four children, all in school.

She started her business with funds received from her husband. She has been selling food products at the roadside of one of the city's busy avenues for the past two years. She will resupply with palm oil, groundnuts and spices.

She wants to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: resupply with palm oil, groundnuts and spices.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are still in school.

Analie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Analie has been in this business for four years now and earns additional income from food vending. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 35 years old and has two children. Ritchel is married and both of her children are sent to school.

Ritchel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ritchel has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kuan Group

texts.en:
Thone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Thone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Thone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Thone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xong Group

texts.en: Sangthong understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Sangthong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Sangthong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Sangthong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so  he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of one son. Three years ago, Husam opened a store selling tv satellites and receivers in the city. He imports his products from outside Palestine. 

Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more modern products for his satellite store to resell, which will increase his sales and income.  Husam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more modern products for his satellite store to resell.

loans.name: Annie Grace

texts.en:
Annie Grace works hard to support her family. Annie Grace is single and has a farming fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

Annie Grace requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Annie Grace has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mcclaire

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, McClaire works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. McClaire is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to resell.

McClaire has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a production worker at Serendipalm, which is an oil palm mill that is organic and fair trade certified. She lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. She is 44 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are still attending school.

Lucy is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped to develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. She wants to secure a microloan to expand her oil palm field, allowing her to fund her children's education and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Yang Group

texts.en:
Kor’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Kor and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Kor and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. In this 2 years, filter users, like Kor’s family, hope to identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 38 years old and divorced with two children, both of whom are in primary school.

Kwasi is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Moila

texts.en: Moila is a 69-year-old mother with ten children.  She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Moila has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Moila became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Elisé Group

texts.fr: Chirimwami est une commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Elisé», âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons dans un dépôt relais dans la ville depuis 11 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va s’approvisionner en bières Primus, Amstell, Simba et Sucrées. Ainsi, Il souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Chirimwami is a merchant who supports her husband, and a member of the "Elisé" loan group. She is a 33-year-old married mother of 10 children, all attending school.

She has been selling beverages in a relay depot of the city for the past 11 years, and is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her activities. She will resupply with Primus, Amstel, and Simba beers, and soft drinks.

She wants to educate and feed her children, and she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: resupply with Primus, Amstel, and Simba beers, and soft drinks

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 49 years old, married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries like rice, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

Editha has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries like rice, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maria Angelica works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Maria Angelica is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, spices, soy sauce, cooking oil and other materials for her business.

Maria Angelica has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, spices, soy sauce, cooking oil and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is single and has an auto repair service business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts, tires, interiors and other materials for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts, tires, interiors and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lovely 38-year-old lady from Kipsaiya location in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Kapsowar's cool and wet climate supports agriculture, which is the economic activity of most of the people in the area.

Jane wants to venture into dairy farming. She is seeking a loan of KES 63,100 to buy a heifer. Part of the loan amount will also be used to insure the newly acquired asset. Jane plans to sell milk from the cow daily and use the money to clear her debt, which is consolidated into monthly installments.

In the future, once she is done servicing the loan, she will seek a second loan to buy another cow. The milk sold from the first cow will generate her personal income and the milk from the second cow will be used to service the second loan. With continued support from lenders, Jane will gradually but surely increase her asset base, advance her credit record and make more income -- all ingredients to becoming the target client of big financial institutions like commercial banks. Her main goal is to grow her business and to raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sok works as a farmer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: La Charmante Group

texts.fr: Gisèle est une commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédits «La charmante», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 53 ans, marié à un artiste, mère de 9 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 5 mariés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement  dans un magasin de la ville depuis 23 ans. Elle va acheter des tricots, souliers, pantalons, jupes, blouses,  chemises etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Gisele is a merchant, member of the "La Charmante" credit group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is 53 years old, married to an artist, and the mother of nine children, four of whom are in school and five are married.

For the past 23 years she has been a vendor of various clothes in one of the city's stores. She will buy knitwear, shoes, pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc.

She wants to educate and feed her children, and thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: Buy knitwear, shoes, pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a 50-year-old mother with six children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Epenesa requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Epenesa hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia joined Paglaum MPC in 2012. She received various co-op benefits as she has maintained her membership in good standing. She received insurance benefits, loan rebates and trainings. These are the reasons why she treasures her membership with the Cooperative.

Ofelia has big dreams for her family. She takes care her agricultural activities that primarily supports her family. She applied to purchase fertilizer. She wants to make sure to prepare for next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carmela works hard to support her family.

She has a manufacturing handicrafts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Carmela is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Carmela has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony is a married woman, 39 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leony has a weaving business in the Philippines. Leony requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fiber and other materials for her business.

Leony has been in this business for nine years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fiber and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Joyce, 27 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Ekerenyo, a remote village in Nyamia. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. 

Joyce is happily married and blessed with a beautiful family. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Joyce is a member of Omorare Self-help Group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 57 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ninfa has a food production business in the Philippines. Ninfa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ninfa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ninfa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is a 59-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business of providing good services to people by transportation. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Koreti requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint color, a car seat and air conditioning to help her maintain the good services. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint color, a car seat and air conditioning

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a 29-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She is a mother for three sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a taxi driver with a low and unstable income. 

Six years ago, Rema opened a store for selling home products in the city. It is a very good business and the demand is high. 

Rema took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her store to resell. This will make her store more attractive and increase the sales. 

Rema appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store to resell

loans.name: Lewis

texts.en:
Lewis is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as dynamic and social. 

Lewis operates a retail business where he sells movies, and he has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located on a road side and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of movie DVDs. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. 

This is Lewis's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of movie DVDs

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a farmer from Mahayag. She is 38 years old and has expertise in farming. She has had this business for three years and is blessed to expand with another hectare of farmland from her savings. This is how she supports her family. 

Recently, she availed another loan  to pay for seedlings and compost. Arlyn wants to have a good harvest for this cropping season so she can purchase a hauling truck for easy transportation of her produce.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy 500 kilos of curdled milk

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is very thankful to Kiva for granting her a loan amounting to PHP 23,000, which she used to buy materials and for payment of the labor expenses for the repairs of her bakery space. Aurora's bakery is doing well, and the revenue of her business helped repair her old machine to be still used for mixing flour. She also now takes orders and delivers her bread to some general stores in the community. Now, more orders are coming in aside from her regular customers.

Aurora is requesting a new loan amounting to PHP 26,000 to buy more sacks of flour, sugar, lard, milk and oil to be made into bread and supply the demand of her customers.

With this, Aurora hopes to expand her deliveries to increase her income and be able to continuously support her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of flour, sugar, lard, milk and oil to be made into bread and supply the demand of her customers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es:
“Estrellas del Mar”, conformado por 3 jóvenes, emprendedoras quienes están solicitando financiación de ADIM, para poder crecer en sus negocios y así obtener mejores beneficios.
Su coordinadora es Karla Vanessa de 25 años, casada, su esposo la apoya con ayuda económica.  Se dedica a la comercialización de variedad de productos de 2da. mano, ropa, zapatos y bolsos. Maneja su negocio desde hace ya 4 años con ayuda de otras micro financieras. Piensa en invertir su préstamo en comprar pacas de ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, zapatos y bolsos para mujer, hombre y niños. Las ganancias obtenidas serán para el remodelar y ampliar su hogar. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son; Jennifer Yasuahara de 23 años, tiene su negocio en la venta de ropa y uniformes escolares de adultos y niños, el préstamo será utilizado para la ventas de calcetines, pantalones y camisetas para suministrar su local; Gabriela Lourdes de 25 años tiene una venta de cosméticos, accesorios y ropa para dama.
texts.en:
The Estrellas del Mar group is made up of 3 young entrepreneurs who are requesting financing from ADIM so that they can continue to grow their businesses and obtain better benefits.

25-year-old Karla Vanessa is the coordinator of this group.  She is married and her husband supports her economically.  She makes a living selling a variety of secondhand products such as clothing, shoes, and bags.  She has been running her business for 4 years with the help of other micro financiers.  She intends to invest this loan in bales of clothing such as pants, shirts, T-shirts, shoes, and bags for women, men, and children.  She will use the profits that she makes to remodel and expand her home.  

The other members of the group are Jennier Yasuahara, 23, who has a business selling clothing and school uniforms for adults and children and will use the loan to stock her store with socks, pants, and T-shirts, and Gabriela Lourdes, 25, who sells cosmetics, accessories, and clothing for women.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing such as pants, shirts, T-shirts, shoes, and bags for women, men, and children

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon has mastered her swine production in Oroquieta. This is how she makes a living, assisting her husband in raising their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing she may need. This loan of PHP 12,000 will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine and piglets for hog raising. Corazon hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine and piglets for hog raising.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su hija y su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará, en dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es un ditrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio donde vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros productos, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le permitirá ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 50 years old and lives with her partner and her daughter in the district of Pucará.  The major activities of the area are agriculture, trade, and ranching.  It's an average district that aspires to get better, located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierras of Peru.  

Vilma makes a living in commerce and she has a grocery store located in her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, and beans, among other products.  She has more than 15 years of experience with this business and very good personal references.  Due to her good service and experience, she has many customers from the area.  The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to increase the stock at her business, and this will allow her to offer a greater variety of products to her clients and in turn improve her level of income and the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase the stock at her business

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Donna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of banana to sell.

Donna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of banana to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Meet Salome, a smallholder dairy farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya! 

Kapsowar has a cool and wet climate which is ideal for agriculture. However, its rough terrain makes it almost impossible to do crop cultivation on a large scale. Most farmers resort to doing livestock farming and a bit of crop farming for subsistence. 

As for Salome, dairy farming is working out well for her. She is following up on its success by introducing poultry farming, which has a huge potential in the market. Starting out poultry farming requires having a significant number of hens to make the investment feasible and worthwhile. The main challenge that she is facing currently is lack of adequate capital for this.
 
Salome is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to invest in buying a brood of hens. She expects to get a lot of eggs which she will consume, sell and hatch. The hatched eggs will increase the number of poultry on the farm and also introduce meat product from cockerels.

Returns from this investment will enable her to raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Nomenjanahary Françoise

texts.fr:
Françoise a 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un petit enfant de 2 ans. Son mari est agent de sécurité, il travaille la nuit et appui sa femme dans l'exercice de son activité car c'est lui qui assure l'approvisionnement des marchandises.
Comme activité source de revenu, Françoise vend des sandales de fabrication chinoise et des chapeaux en pailles de fabrication locale. C'est une activité qu'elle a copiée de sa sœur. Elle possède 9 ans d'expérience dans cette filière.
Construire un matelas d'épargne est son objectif afin de sécuriser l'avenir de sa petite famille et la scolarisation de son enfant
texts.en:
Françoise is 25 years old, married and the mother of a small two-year-old child. Her husband is a security guard and works at night. He supports his wife's business activity since he supplies the goods.

As an income-generating activity Françoise sells Chinese-made sandals and locally-made straw hats. It is an activity that she copied from her sister, and has nine years' experience in this sector.

Her goal is to build up a savings reserve  to secure her family's future and her child's education.

loans.use: buy sandals and straw hats

loans.name: Marie Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Marie Jacqueline a 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants  âgés de 16, 13, 10, 7, et 2 ans. Ces derniers vont tous à l'école.  
Son conjoint  est coiffeur, quant à elle, elle vend des œufs et des volailles depuis déjà 17 ans: expérience acquise de ses parent, presque les siens exercent le même type d'activité. 
Elle doit faire  un long trajet pour l'approvisionnement des volailles, c'est pourquoi, elle demande un crédit pour qu'elle puisse effectuer une seule fois la semaine cet approvisionnement afin de gagner du temps dans la vente et réduire les dépenses de transport. Ainsi, le crédit va lui permettre de développer son activité.
Avec son travail acharné, elle espère pouvoir continuer à scolariser ses enfants et construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Marie Jacqueline is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children aged 16, 13, 10, 7, and 2 years. They all go to school.

Her spouse is a hairdresser, and as for her, she has been selling eggs and poultry for the past 17 years. She gained experience from her parents since they perform the same type of activity.

She must make a long journey to resupply with poultry, which is why she is requesting a loan so she can resupply only once a week. This will save time for sales and reduce transportation costs. Thus, the loan will enable her to expand her business.

With her hard work she hopes to continue to educate her children and build her own house.

loans.use: buy eggs and poultry

loans.name: Shaigul

texts.ru: Шайгул, 35 лет, замужем, 2 детей, им 3 и 5 лет. У Шайгул среднее образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 2002 году. На сегодняшний день прибыль Шайгул составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 30 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шайгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 25 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шайгул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Shaigul is 35 years old, married and has 2 children, who are 3 and 5 years old. Shaigul has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years, since starting this business in 2002. Today, Shaigul's profit amounts up to 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Her farm contains 8 cows and 30 sheep. To continue developing her business, Shaigul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy 25 sheep for fattening up and resale. Shaigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 25 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en:
Koleta is a 63-year-old mother with 6 children.

Koleta is strong and healthy, and she operates a business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 2 years with the help of her children. 

Koleta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosa Maria continues to make a living with her grocery store where she sells daily necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  She has been running this business for 5 years and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She would be happy to receive the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Erison

texts.es:
El socio Erison se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, el socio vende cemento, arena y clavos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Erison continues to make a living selling construction materials such as cement, sand, and nails. He works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. He has been running this business for many years and it is going well for him. His dream is to expand his construction materials business. He is requesting a loan to buy cement, nails, and sand. He would be happy to receive the loan and he is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.

loans.name: Meyilbubu

texts.ru: Мейилбубу 46 лет, замужем, есть ребенок, учится в 1 классе. У Мейилбубу среднее образование, она занимается животноводством на протяжении 5 лет. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 7 овец и 8 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мейилбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота. Доходы от кредита Мейилбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en: Meyilbubu is 46 years old, married and has a child, who attends 1st grade. Meyilbubu has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years. Today she has 2 cows, 7 sheep and 8 goats. To continue developing her business, Meyilbubu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Meyilbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and plans to save money to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as honest. 

Stephen operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. 

This is Stephen's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Guatemala Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Guatemala”, conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, dueñas de sus negocios que buscan el apoyo de ADIM  para sacar adelante su familia. Coordinado por Elvira Francisca de 40 años, casada y con 4 hijos, que  son su motor  de vivir.  Dedicada a la preparación y venta de nacatamales, sopas de carnes y cosa de horno. Quien como ejemplo de superación ha tenido este negocio desde hace 6 años, y lo inicio con la ayuda de su suegro quien inicialmente le presto dinero. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de 2 cerdos, para así criarlos y poder sacar sacarles más carne para realizar sus nacatamales. 
Sus dos miembros más, Dolores de los Ángeles, de 29 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, requiere del préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como zapatos deportivos, vestidos, pantalones y ofrecerlos a su variedad de clientes; Scarlet Jaqueline de 33 años, se dedica a la venta de bisutería y venta de ropa, con su préstamo comprara cadena y pulsera y jeans.
texts.en:
The "Guatemala" group is made up of 3 women who are fighting entrepreneurs and owners of their own businesses.  They are looking for support from ADIM to move their families forwards.  

The group is coordinated by 40-year-old Elvira Francisca.  She is married with 4 children, and they are the motor that keeps her life moving.  She makes a living preparing and selling nacatamales, meat soups, and baked goods.  She started the business with money lent to her by her father-in-law, and she has kept it going for 6 years, proving that she can overcome.  She is requesting a loan to buy 2 pigs to raise and produce more meat to use in her nacatamales.  

The other group members are Dolores de los Ángeles, 29, who has made a living selling clothing for 6 years and needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sports shoes, dresses, and pants to offer more variety to her customers, and Scarlet Jaqueline, 33, who makes a living selling jewelry and clothing and will use the loan to buy chains, bracelets, and jeans.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs to raise

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Салтанат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 теленок, лошадь, 10 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 2,95 ГА, где Салтанат выращивает фасоль для реализации оптовым покупателям. Салтанат в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма, разведения и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она вложит в расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Saltanat is 26 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. Thanks to Saltanat's hard work, today her farm contains 1 calf, 10 sheep and also 2.95 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale to wholesale customers. To continue developing her business, Saltanat requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale. She will invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Amigas” conformadas por 3 mujeres micro empresarias, trabajando el día a día para sostener a sus familias. Dirigido por Cira de los Ángeles, ella de 51 años de edad y madre de 5 hijos, de la cual hoy en día una hija adolecente de 14 años es la que está bajo su responsabilidad. Dedicada a la venta variada de ropa, sandalias y frijoles cocidos. Dedicada hace 10 años con sus ahorros. Solicita crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas. Con el fin de poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ganancias.  
Los otros miembros son de 41 años, Marling Soveyda, dedicada al negocio de la venta de ropa americana de ropa usada, como pantalones y blusas para dama y caballero; 54 años, Sara, dedicada al destace y venta de cerdo, solicitan su crédito para agrandar su negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Las Amigas" is made up of 3 women with small businesses who work every day in order to sustain their families. The group is directed by Cira de los Ángeles who is a 51 year-old mother to 5 children of whom, only her 14 year-old daughter is dependent on her. She makes a living selling a variety of clothing, sandals and cooked beans. She started this business 10 years ago by using her savings. 

She is asking for a loan to buy trousers, blouses and T-shirts in order to be able to expand her business and offer her clients a greater variety and thus increase her income. 

The other members of the group are Sara who is 54 years old and works as a pork butcher and Marling Soveyda who is 41 years old and runs a business selling American clothing and second-hand clothing such as trousers and blouses for both men and women. They are both asking for this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and T-shirts.

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es madre soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, su hija tiene 9 años y su hijo tiene 11 años de edad,  y los 2 estan estudiando, Maribel vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganederia, Maribel trabaja por horas de empleada domestica, Maribel se dedica a sembrar pequeñas huertas de alverja,papa, frejol y mas cultivos que se dan en la provincia donde ella vive. Maribel necesita el credito para  invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas y abonos para que sus cultivos le salgan sanos y tener buena cosecha, Maribel saca adelante a sus hijos sola ya que el padre de ellos no le apoya en nada, Maribel tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando y que sus hijas tengan buena caladad de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel, 27, is a single mother. Her daughter is 9 years old and her son is 11 years old; both of her children are studying at school. Maribel lives in the countryside and she makes a living farming and ranching and she also works by the hour as a housekeeper. Maribel sows small vegetable patches with peas, potatoes, beans and other crops that grow in the area where she lives. 

Maribel needs this loan to invest in buying fungicides and fertilisers so that her crops are healthy and have a good harvest. Maribel is looking after her children alone since their father doesn’t provide in any way. Maribel’s ambition is to keep working and to provide a good quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and fungicides.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 52 года, вдова, есть сын. Жылдызкан живет с ее сыном и невесткой. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова и 20 овец, а на участке, мерою 2,0 ГА она выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Доходы от бизнеса очень малы и их не хватает на достойную жизнь Жылдызкан. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить свое материальное состояние.
texts.en: Zhyldyzkan is 52 years old, a widow and has a son. Zhyldyzkan lives with her son and daughter-in-law. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years. Thanks to Zhyldyzkan's hard work, today her farm contains 1 cow and 20 sheep, and 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows beans for household consumption and sale. The income from the business is very low and not enough for a decent life. To continue developing her business, Zhyldyzkan requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount. Zhyldyzkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities in order to have an opportunity to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount and grow her income

loans.name: Fernando Audelo

texts.es: Fernando es un joven  de 19 años de edad, el vive en el campo con sus padres y hermanos que se dedican a la  ganaderia y agricultura, Fernando se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, Fernando solicita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos para tenerlos en chacheras que tiene su madre, la aspiracion de Fernando es de seguir trabajando  en el campo y tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a young man of 19 years old and he lives in the countryside with his parents and siblings who all make a living farming and pig raising. Fernando is a day labourer and he works raising the younger animals. 

Fernando is requesting this loan in order to buy pigs which he will keep in his mother’s pigpen. Fernando’s ambition is to keep working the land and to try and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gulaida

texts.ru: Гулайда 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Гулайды среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 15 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гулайды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, теленок, 15 овец, и земельный участок мерою 1,44 ГА, где она выращивает картофель для реализации оптовым покупателям. Экологически чистые и очень вкусные овощи пользуются большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Гулайды составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 56,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulaida is 40 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Gulaida has a secondary education and, to provide income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 15 years. Thanks to Gulaida's hard work and drive, today her farm contains 2 cows, a calf, 15 sheep and 1.44 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes for sale to wholesale customers. Her ecologically clean and delicious vegetables are in high demand. Gulaida's monthly income amounts to about 25,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 56,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 20 sheep. Gulaida plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Zhiydegul

texts.ru: Жийдегул, 46 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Жийдегул среднее образование, с 1998 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Жийдегул смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 5 коров, 82 овец. Также есть 1,60 ГА земли, где Жийдегул выращивает фасоль для реализации. Супруг и младший сын активно и с удовольствием помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль Жийдегул составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 32,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Жийдегул планирует направить на расширение ее бизнеса, также на постройку забора к ее дому.
texts.en: Zhiydegul is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Zhiydegul has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1998. Today, Zhiydegul has been able to develop her business and has 5 cows and 82 sheep. She also has 1.60 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale. Her husband and youngest son actively and happily help her with the business. Zhiydegul's monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 32,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow ecologically clean beans. Zhiydegul plans to use the earnings from the loan to expand her business and also to build a fence for her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow ecologically clean beans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yams and spaghetti

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yams and spaghetti

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Arcoiris Del Amor Group

texts.es:
“Arcoíris del amor”, un grupo mixto constituido de 3 hombres, y 1 mujer, personas laboriosas y emprendedoras, que han solicitado crédito a ADIM, para la mejora de sus negocios y así ayudarse económicamente. Su coordinadora Carmen Azucena, casada y madre de 5 hijos, esta mujer luchadora, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa americana mixta para adultos y niños. Requiere de este préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar mercadería como la compra de blusas, vestidos, short estilo comando y más. 
Los demás que conforman este grupo son Hamilton Rubén de 41 años, este comerciante se dedica a la venta de carne y pollo, y solicita el préstamo para ingresar al ramo de la venta de pan, así obtener más diversidad en su negocio y obtener más ganancias. Justo, de 52 años, se ha dedicado a ser caponero (motocicleta equipadas con asientos para transportar personas) el dinero lo ocupara para compra de más caponeras y dar mantenimientos a las existentes; Carlos de 22 años dedicado a la venta variada de zapatos, comidas y recargas.
texts.en:
“Arcoíris del amor” is a mixed group comprising 3 male members and 1 female member who are all hard-working and enterprising people. They have requested a loan from ADIM in order to improve their businesses and in turn improve their financial situations. Carmen Azucena is the coordinator of the group; she is married and is a mother to 5 children. She is a determined woman and her business is selling mixed items of American clothing for both adults and children. She needs this loan in order to expand her business and to buy more merchandise such as blouses, dresses, cargo shorts and more.

The other group members include; Hamilton Rubén, 41, whose business is selling meat and chicken and is requesting this loan to invest in the addition of a bakery so that his business will become more diverse and make more profit; Justo, 52, who makes a living driving a Caponera (a mototaxi with two seats used to transport people) and he will use the money to buy more Caponeras and upkeep his existing vehicles; and Carlos, 22, whose business is selling various items such as food, shoes and phone top-ups.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, dresses, cargo shorts and more.

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr:
Mère de famille, Nirina a 24 ans.Elle a deux enfants de quatre et deux ans. Ces derniers ne vont pas encore à l'école. 
Son mari est docker dont le revenu est faible et aléatoire. Pour aider son mari à soutenir la famille, Nirina a ouvert une activité d'achat et revente des légumes  frais avec un fonds qu'elle a emprunté de sa grande sœur. 
Le crédit va lui permettre de développer son activité: d'augmenter la quantité des marchandises et de les diversifier davantage pour attirer beaucoup de clients.
Actuellement, Nirina et sa famille habite dans la maison de ses parents et son rêve est d'avoir la sienne, d'être indépendante et autonome.
texts.en:
A mother of a family, Nirina is 24 years old. She has two children, who are four and two years old. They do not go to school. Her husband is a dockworker, and his pay is low and unstable. To help her husband take care of the family, Nirina started buying and selling fresh vegetables with funds that she borrowed from her older sister. 

This loan is going to permit her to develop her business by increasing and diversifying her goods so she can attract many customers.

At the moment, Nirina and her family live in her parent's home. Her dream is to have her own home and be independent.

loans.use: to buy white beans, red beans, Bambara peas, green peas, and other vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Doña Emérita, tiene 59 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, y  reside junto a su esposo y un nieto en una aldea del municipio de Yoro. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a obtener sus propios ingresos, lleva 15 años de vender golosinas como churros, refrescos y jugos naturales.  Esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo en la institución que es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar productos nuevo como refrescos, frutas, azúcar, churros y otros insumos para la elaboración de jugos y vender. Con esta inversión espera mejorar las ventas y sus ganancias. Su meta es mantener mas surtido el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Emerita, 59, lives with her partner and a grandson in a village of the municipality of Yoro.  She always has earned her own income and for 15 years has been selling sweets such as fritters, soft drinks and natural juices.  She is requesting her fourth loan through the institution.  It is for 10,000 HNL to buy new products such as soft drinks, fruits, sugar, fritters and other supplies to make and sell juices.  With this investment, sales and earnings will increase.

Her goal is to keep her business stocked with a wider variety of goods to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy new products such as soft drinks, fruits, sugar, fritters and other supplies to make and sell juices.

loans.name: Nidia Esperanza

texts.es: Las ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos es lo que ha llevado a Doña Nidia a establecer su propio negocio de venta de verduras al por mayor, inicio esta actividad hace 12 años con tan solo un canasto de verduras. Para seguir creciendo en el negocio solicita un crédito para comprar frutas y verduras, de esta manera podrá abastecer su negocio y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Dentro de los planes futuros de Doña Nidia esta comprar un camión para trasladar las frutas y verduras que ofrece en el mercado donde labora.
texts.en:
Her determination to provide for her children is what motivated Nidia to establish her own business selling wholesale vegetables.  She started her activity 12 years ago with only a basket of vegetables.  In order to continue growing she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  This is so she can stock her business and respond to customer demand.

Among Nidia's future plans is the purchase of a truck to transport the fruit and vegetables to the market where she works.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amalia Patricia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha superado gracias al crédito que recibió anterior mente ella ahora ha surtido mejor su negocio y también ha mejorado sus ingresos, pero ahora Amalia quiere seguir mejorando sus servicios en su tienda pero para poder hacerlo necesita de más capital, por tal razón solicita un crédito para comprar mercaderías como golosinas, jugos, arroz, azúcar frijol.
El gran sueño de Amalia es poder realizar esta inversión para seguir mejorando sus ingresos y construir la casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Amalia is a very hard-working woman who has improved herself thanks to the loan she received previously.  Now her store is better stocked and her income has improved.  But she wants to continue improving services at her store and is in need of more capital.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy goods such as sweets, juices, rice, sugar and beans.

Amalia's greatest dream is to be able to make the investment to continue improving her income and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store such as sweets, juices, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario las poderosas, lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas que luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, la coordinadora es Alexandra de 38 años de edad, viuda, madre de cuatro hijos por quienes trabaja duro, para darles un futuro mejor,  ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad desde hace 15 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y para pagar el molino. La segunda socia es Coralia de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos desde hace cinco años y Karen de 38 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva con cinco años de experiencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "Las Poderosas" consists of three hard-working women who struggle for their family's well-being.  The coordinator is Alexandra, 38, a widow with four children who works hard to give them a better future.  She has been selling tortillas in her community for 15 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, and to pay milling costs.

The second member is Coralia, 37, who has been selling new clothing and shoes for five years.  Karen, 38, has five years' experience selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime, and to pay milling costs.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
Jose desde hace 4 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de caña de azúcar.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.

El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose has been working in agriculture for four years.  Every day he goes to his land to care for his crops, mainly sugar cane.  He learned the trade on his own and little by little has perfected his technique and skills in this activity.

He also earns an income as a farm wage earner.  He is proud of what he has been able to achieve thanks to his efforts.  He is very grateful to Corporación Interactuar and Kiva lenders for the opportunities to progress that he has received.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers, sprays and pesticides in order to keep his cropland in optimum condition.  

His greatest dream is to have his own house and be able to enjoy his senior years alongside his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sprays and pesticides to keep his cropland in optimum condition.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 27 años de edad fuerte, trabajador, humilde y servicial lleva trabajando en su finca gran parte de su vida y todos sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a su familia que realizan actividades similares. 

Padre de un hijo de 10 años el cual quiere educar con las buenas costumbres del campo pero tratando de que pueda acceder a una buena educación y no le toque un trabajo tan pesado para sobrevivir pues no cualquier persona ejerce esta profesión. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos, semillas, entre otros buscando mejorar y aumentar su producción pues es ambicioso y piensa es darles a sus hijos todas las herramientas para forjar un excelente futuro
texts.en:
Carlos, 27, is strong, hard-working, humble and helpful. He has been working on his farm for most of his life and everything he knows he learned from his family who all do a similar line of work.
 
As a father of a 10 year old boy, Carlos wants to teach his son the traditions of farming but he also wants to make sure he has access to good education. He doesn't want his son to have to do such a tough job in order to survive; since not just anybody can do this profession.

Carlos is requesting a loan to pay for fertilisers, irrigation, seeds and other products as he hopes to improve and increase his production of crops. He is ambitious and aims to give his children all the tools they need to shape a wonderful future for themselves.

loans.use: to pay for fertilisers, irrigation, seeds and other products.

loans.name: Alvaro Ivan

texts.es:
