El señor Alvaro tiene gran experiencia en el área de cocina, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propio negocio que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar utensilios de cocina e insumos como carne, arroz, aceite, entre otros.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con mejor cantidad de insumos.
texts.en:
Alvaro has a lot of experience in the food industry, and a while ago he set up his own business which has given him great results. He has always preferred working independently, and he works for 5 hours every day.

Currently, Alvaro needs assistance to buy kitchen utensils and supplies such as meat, rice, oil and other products. The loan will allow him to work in better conditions and will guarantee the quality of food preparation. With this help he will be able to work in a more organised manner and with higher quality supplies.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies such as meat, rice, oil and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy locust tree seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Renovadas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Las renovadas, lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas coordinado por la joven Nordia de 24 años de edad acompañada, madre de un hijo, se dedica a la comercialización  de ropa usada y carteras, desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de faldas, blusas, zapatos, sandalias y zapatillas. La segunda socia es Carmen de 29 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y la tercer socia es Heidi de 33 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de rosquillas somoteñas.
texts.en:
The ‘Las Renovadas’ group comprises three hard-working women. Nordia is the coordinator of the group, she is 24 years old and has a live-in partner and a son. She has been making a living selling pre-owned clothes and handbags for three years and is requesting the loan in order to buy skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals and high heels.

Carmen, 29, is the second member, she makes a living selling tortillas, and Heidi, 33, is the third member, she sells traditional baked corn doughnuts.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals and high heels.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: La Sra. Josefina tiene 53 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, a uno de los cuales apoya económicamente. Desde hace más de 30 años que se dedica a los tejidos de prenda de punto, obteniendo gran éxito por el estilo y calidad de su prendas. La Sra. Josefina explica que quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos para salir adelante. Actualmente, está consolidando la ampliación de su taller de trabajo, y es por esto que se le otorgará el crédito para la compra de maquinaria para tejidos y compra de lanas e hilos para seguir con su actividad, obteniendo así la oportunidad de agrandar su taller. Adicionalmente, ella cuenta que quiere mejorar su nivel de vida y realizarse en el ámbito laboral, generando nuevas fuentes de empleo para mujeres que tengan la habilidad para el tejido a punto. La Sra. Josefina es muy conocida por la comunidad en su puesto de trabajo, el cual con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo constituirlo.
texts.en:
Josefina is 53 years old and has two children, one of whom she supports economically. For more than 30 years she has made knitted clothing textiles and has achieved great success because of the style and quality of her garments.

Josefina explains that she wants to make more income in order to get ahead. She is currently funding the expansion of her workshop, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy textiles machinery, wools and yarns so that she can carry on with her trade until she has the opportunity to enlarge her workshop.  

In addition, she says she wants to improve her quality of life and succeed in her occupation, generating new sources of work for women who are skilled at knitting. Josefina is very well known in the community in her place of work, which she built with a lot of effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy textiles machinery, wools and yarns so that she can continue with her trade and have the opportunity to expand her workshop

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
José Cristóbal, a sus 55 años,  es una persona humilde y  con una gran personalidad, originario de una pequeña comarca llamada Nandayure, en el departamento de Masaya. Con el fin de proporcionar a su acompañante de vida y a sus 2 hijos, inicio su negocio de compra y venta de calzado, elaborados artesanalmente y los industrializados para mujeres, hombres y niños desde hace 30 años con sus ahorros personales.
Su préstamo es para la compra de mercancía, y así poder cubrir la demanda del mercado. Entre sus mercadería esta la compra de zapatos, sandalias, chinelas de hule y calzado deportivo para su variedad de clientela. Su sueño es el de poder aumentar las  ganancia y agrandar su pequeña finca, comprar animales de granja (vacas, toritos, gallinas, etc) y poder dedicarse al crecimiento de su finca.
texts.en:
José Cristóbal, 55, is a humble man with a big personality and is from a small region called Nandayure in the department of Masaya. With the aim of providing for his life-partner and their two children he set up a business with his personal savings 30 years ago buying and selling handmade and commercial footwear for women, men and children.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise so that he can cater for the demand in the market. Some of the goods he requires are shoes, sandals, rubber flip-flops and trainers for his diverse clientele. His dream is to be able to increase his earnings and expand his small farm by buying more animals (cows, bulls and hens etc.) and to be able to focus on developing his farm.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, rubber flip-flops and trainers.

loans.name: Felisberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Província de Maputo tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de uma filha menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã que vive em sua casa. 
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 6 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como arroz, feijão, açúcar, sabão, amendoim e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku. Sendo que todos foram aplicados para mesma actividade. 
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com o seu negócio e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur was born in the province of Maputo. He is 27 years old and lives with his wife. He is the father of a young daughter and is responsible for his sister who lives with him. 

He has owned a store for over six years where he makes a living to pay for the household bills. He is applying for a loan to increase the amount of stock for his business by acquiring basic needs products such as rice, beans, sugar, soap, peanuts and other necessary items. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, all of which have been used for the same purpose.

In the future he would like to keep his business running and acquire a vehicle so he can transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to acquire basic needs products such as rice, beans, sugar, soap and peanuts

loans.name: Kota Group

texts.fr: Aminata est la responsable du groupe Kota. Elle est une femme battante, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a comme activité, la vente de gâteaux et du savon. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter de la farine de blé, de l'huile, de la levure et les autres ingrédients pour faire des gâteaux pour vendre. En plus de cela, elle achètera du savon à 50 000 francs pour revendre. Aminata a des notions en marketing ce qui lui permet de vendre facilement ses gâteaux. En effet, c'est elle-même qui va vers les clients.  A l'issue de ses ventes, le bénéfice d'Aminata lui permettra de s'occuper de ses enfants et de continuer ses activités.
texts.en: Aminata is the leader of the group named Kota. She is a dynamic woman, and is married with two children. She sells cakes and soap. She needs this loan to buy wheat flour, oil, yeast and other ingredients to make cakes to sell. In addition, she will purchase 50,000 francs worth of soap for resale. Aminata has some knowledge of marketing which enables her to sell her cakes easily. In fact, she goes to see her customers personally. After her sales, Aminata's profits will enable her to take care of her children and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy a 50 kg sack of flour,a 20 litre can of oil, and sugar for baking cakes to sell.

loans.name: Pierette

texts.fr:
Pierette a 25 ans.Elle est mariée et a 4 enfants dont les deux premiers de 8 et 6 ans vont à l'école et les deux derniers de 4 et 2 ans pas encore.
Son mari exerce une activité d’élevage porcin et l'appuie de temps en temps dans l'exercice de son activité de quincaillerie. Elle a démarré en 2013.
Le crédit va lui permettre de développer l'activité: augmenter les quantités des produits et les diversifier.
En plus , elle a quelques clients fixes en province et avec lesquels la vente doit être en gros
Son objectif est de construire une maison en dur car la sienne en ce moment est encore en bois, c'est pourquoi, elle s'efforce d'épargner davantage.
texts.en:
Pierrette is 25. She is married with four children of whom the two older of eight and six years old go to school, and the youngest of four and two do not yet.
Her husband works in pig farming and from time to time she helps with her work in hardware sales. She started her business in 2013.
The loan will enable her to develop this business: to increase the quantity of her products and diversify them.
In addition, she has some regular clients in small towns for whom the sales have to be wholesale.
Her aim is to build a proper house, for her present home is made of wood. This is why she is doing her best to save more.

loans.use: to buy cables, plugs, switches, bulbs etc.

loans.name: Pancita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Pancita works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store.  Pancita is borrowing 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Pancita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Virtud Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Fuerza y Virtud” ", que consta de dos mujeres empresarias y un negociante, quienes con esfuerzo diario mantienen a sus familias. 
Coordinado por Mayling del Carmen de 27 años, casada y con dos hijos de edades de 11 y 7 años dedicada a la comercialización de ventas de productos plásticos. Inicio este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, que la apoya a la venta del producto. El préstamo otorgado será invertido para surtir de variedad, comprando fruteras, baldes, vasos  y platos. Pudiendo así dedicarse también a ofrecer sus productos al crédito de casa en casa y obtener  mayores ingresos para sacar adelantes a sus hijos.
Sus integrantes, 38 años, Ivania Lisseth, compra y vende chinelas de hule para hombres y mujeres; 22 años Lederman José desde su propio tramo se dedica a la venta de pan. Requieren del crédito para agrandar sus micro-empresas.
texts.en:
The “Fuerza y Virtud” group is comprised of two enterprising women and a businessman, who with daily effort support their families. 

They are coordinated by Mayling del Carmen, 27 years old, married and with two children ages 11 and 7, who works selling plastic products. She began this business with the help of her husband, who supports her in the product sales. The loan granted will be invested to stock an assortment, purchasing fruit baskets, buckets, vases, and plates, being able in this way to work also in offering her products on credit from house to house and get more income to get her children ahead.

The other members are 38-year-old Ivania Lisseth who buys and sells rubber flip-flops for men and women, and 22-year-old Lederman José who from his own place works selling bread. They need the loan to expand their micro-enterprises.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment, purchasing fruit baskets, buckets, vases, and plates.

loans.name: Los Tigrillos Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Los Tigrillos”, habitantes de una pequeña comarca llamada Las Sabanitas, y conformados por un hombre y dos mujeres (Eliezer, Rosa Isabel, María Daysi). Todo ellos micro empresarios que se reunieron desde 6 meses con el objetivo de poder acceder a un financiamiento, y  poder asegurar la educación de sus hijos y aumentar las ganancia.
Coordina por María Daysi, de 59 años, ella y su acompañante de vida, y sus 10 hijos, de los cuales tiene como responsable a 4 de ellos, los gemelos 22  años, un joven de 19 años, y su bebe de 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, además de tener ingresos en su otro negocio de destace de cerdo. Solicita el crédito para comprar  cerdos, y compra de frijoles para cocerlos y venderlos en su casa.  Su sueño es poder mejorar su humilde vivienda y construir una nueva habitación. 
Los demás integrantes son Rosa Isabel, 21 años, ella comercializa ropa para varones y mujeres. Eliezer Leonardo, 35 años, es una persona dedicada a la soldadura, enderezado, pintura, mecánico, todo en el área automotriz y además se dedica a la venta de diversas frutas frescas
texts.en:
The “Los Tigrillos” group, inhabitants of a little village called Las Sabanitas, is made up of a man and two women (Eliezer, Rosa Isable, María Daysi). All of them are micro-entrepreneurs who have been meeting for the past 6 months with the goal of being able to access a loan and to be able to assure their children's education and increase their earnings. 

They are coordinated by María Daysi, 59 years old. She and her life partner, have 10 children, of whom she is responsible for 4, the 22-year-old twins, a 19 year old young adult and a 2-year-old baby. She works selling fruits and vegetables in addition to having income from her other business of pig butchering. She asks for the loan to purchase pigs, and purchase beans to cook them and sell in her house. Her dream is to be able to improve her humble house and build a new room. 

The other members are Rosa Isabel, 21 years old, who sells men's and women's clothing and Eliezer Leonardo, 35 years old, who is a person who works in soldering, metal work, painting, mechanical tasks, everything in the area of automobiles and also works selling a variety of fresh fruit.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and to purchase beans to cook them and sell them in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Voces Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Voces Unidas”, está conformado por 4 mujeres, dueñas de negocios propios que buscan el crecimiento económico y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Este grupo coordinado por Alejandra, 30 años, casada y con su pequeño hijo de 8 años.  Es una comerciante dedicada a la venta de frutas frescas. Comenzó su negocio con dinero prestado por sus familiares, y se ha mantenido en el ramo comercial durante 15 años.
Tiene 1 año de solicitar crédito con ADIM, y esta vez lo solicita para abastacer de frutas su negocio, y así comprar melón, papaya, piña y sandia. Con las ganancias quiere mejorar su casa. 
Los otros miembros grupos, Miuris (24 años), que tiene en su hogar una pulpería, requiere del préstamo para abastecer de productos como arroz, azúcar, chiverías y más; Johana  (28 años) dedicada a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas; Melissa de los Ángeles (21 años) se dedica a la venta de derivados del maíz como el pinol, pinolillo, tiste.
texts.en:
The “Voces Unidas” group is made up of 4 women, owners of their own businesses, who look for economic growth and to improve their living conditions. This group is coordinated by Alejandra, 30 years old, married, and with a small son who is 8 years old. She is a businesswoman working selling fresh fruit. She began her business with money lent from family members and has maintained herself in this field for 15 years. 

She has been getting loans from ADIM for one year and this time, she asks for the loan to stock the fruits of her business, so to purchase melons, papayas, pineapples, and watermelons. With the earnings, she wants to improve her house. 

The other member of the group are Miuris (24 year sold) who has a grocery store in her home and needs the loan to stock supplies such as rice, sugar, snacks, and more; Johana (28 yaers old) who works buying and selling fruit harvests; Melissa de los Ángeles (21 years old) who works selling corn products such as pinol [a drink made from roasted cornmeal], pinolillo [a drink made from cornmeal and cocoa] and tiste [a drink made from roasted cornmeal and cocoa].

loans.use: to purchase melons, papayas, pineapples and watermelons.

loans.name: La Gran Alianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA GRAN ALIANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Rosa la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas entre otros.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, imprenta, cevicheria, crianza de animales menores, sastrería, venta de golosinas, mueblería.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
The members belong to the "La Gran Alianza" communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Rosa, she continues working in the business of buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and others. She has been in this business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she will continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase chickens and more. 

The other members make a living selling crafts, printing, a ceviche restaurant, raising small animals, tailoring, selling candies, and a furniture shop.

The member is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy boxes of soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprará 3 maquinas de confección

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of farm materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of farm materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and she has two children. She describes herself as honest. Rose operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, milk, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

Rose will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, ella crecio con sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y la ganaderia.

Juana, tiene 21 años de experiencia en oficios domésticos y en la venta de productos lácteos, porque tiene ganado; todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su madre, quien dedicó la mayor parte de su vida, a realizar esta actividad.- Hoy en día Juana, lleva el sustento diario a su familia, gracias a las ganancias de todas esas actividades.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar alimento concentrado para el ganado y colocar una venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.- La venta de ropa será administrada por su hija mayor, para que tenga ingresos, para pagar los gastos de educación de ella y de su hermana. 

Los sueños de Juana, son mejorar las instalaciones en donde tiene su ganado, además desea apoyar en los estudios de sus hijas, ya que ambas sueñan con ser enfermeras y también sueña con adquirir un maquina descremadora de leche.
texts.en:
Juana, 43 years old, is married and has two children. She grew up with her parents who worked in agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Juana has 21 years of experience in domestic chores and in selling dairy products because she has cattle. Everything that she knows, she learned from her mother, who worked the larger part of her life doing this work. These days, Juana brings daily sustenance to her family thanks to the earnings from all of these activities. 

The money will be used to purchase concentrated feed for the cattle and to establish a business selling clothing for women, men and children. The clothing sales will be run by her oldest daughter so that she has an income to pay for her school expenses and those of her sister. 

Juana's dreams are to improve the facilities where she has her cattle, and in addition she wants to support her daughters' education since both dream of being nurses and also she dreams of getting a milk separator.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for the cattle and to establish a business selling clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is a student at Yerevan State Pedagogical University. She lives in Armavir town with her mother and brother. To help her  family with daily costs, Sona, while she is studying, works at a chocolate store as a seller. She works hard to manage her work and education. 

The loan that she has applied for will help Sona to pay for her university tuition. She hopes to receive lender's support and continue her education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a smallholder dairy farmer from Kaibatek location in the North Rift area of Kenya. She enjoys dairy farming because besides being passionate about it, milk is her main income source. Her biggest challenge is she has to lead her cows for a long distance to a water source for hydration. This takes up much of her time and energy and it also eats into her profit margin since animals use up energy that would otherwise go to milk production. 

Mary is seeking a loan in order to buy a water tank. Fetching water and bringing it to the animals is much easier that leading the herd. The tank will ensure constant availability of water for the cows to drink at their own convinience. This is set to increase milk production significantly over time. The tank will also pave the way for her to buy other water equipment such as pumps and pipes in the future to make her work even easier.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical checkups for herself and her son, and in addition to purchase the vitamins that the doctor prescribed for her.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, de 76 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios, está casado y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en Estados Unidos y su hijo menor le ayuda con el negocio de lácteos.

Gilberto, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 25 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, quien se dedicaba a la venta de productos básicos y de esta manera salió adelante con su familia, la venta de lácteos es su principal fuente de ingresos.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar productos básicos como frijol, maíz, azúcar, entre otros, porque sus clientes demandan estos productos, aparte de los lácteos, de esta manera comenzará a colocar una tienda de productos básicos, para obtener mejores ingresos que le servirán para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. 

Los sueños de Gilberto son,  tener una tienda surtida y amplia, además desea comprar un vehículo de carga, para que le sirva para trasladar mercadería a otras tiendas de su municipio; también quiere ayudar en la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 76 years old and is a person with excellent morals, he is married and has three children. Two of them are in the United States and his youngest son helps him with his dairy business. 

Gilberto has earned a living selling dairy products for 25 years. He learnt it from his mother, who earned a living selling basic products and managed to help her family move forward. Selling dairy products is his primary source of income. 

The money will be used to buy basic products such as beans, maize, and sugar amongst others, because his clients are asking for these products in addition to dairy products. Doing this he will begin to stock a commodities shop, to earn a better income which will help satisfy the needs of his household. 

Gilberto dreams of having a shop with and extensive and assorted range of products, as well as purchasing a van or pickup truck to move merchandise to other shops in his area. He also wants to help with the education of his grandchildren.

loans.use: para comprar productos básicos como frijol, maíz, azúcar, entre otros.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar un hombre de 27 años de edad, un agricultor eficiente y productivo que lucha de sol a sol para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior, logro comprar sus fertilizantes y semillas, con el que obtuvo muy buenas cosechas así también buenas ganancias, pero ahora ya se ha cerca nuevamente el cultivo de papa, Gaspar con el afán de seguir incrementando su cultivo, solicita un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes y semillas de papa.
Gaspar tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito, y poder así cultivar en esta temporada, para mejorar sus ganancias y terminar de construir su casa para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Gaspar, a 27-year-old man, is an efficient and productive farmer who fights day by day to get income and support his family. He says that, thanks to the previous loan, he managed to purchase fertilizer and seeds, with which he got a very good harvest and also good earnings, but now the potato season is approaching again. Gaspar, with the desire to continue increasing his crops, asks for a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds.

Gaspar has the hope of getting another loan and to be able in this way to grow crops this season, to improve his earnings and in the end build a house for the good of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell medicines such as serums, vitamins, and syrups

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Mrs. Linh is a hardworking woman, 45-years-old.There are four people in her family . Her family’s income is mainly from fishing and shrimp farming so she is able to repay the loan monthly. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rurii Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Cecilia , a member of Rurii Women group. She is 39-years-old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012.

Cecilia does maize, bean and banana farming in her small farm. She is grateful for Hand In Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training that has enabled her to manage the business well. She is borrowing a Kiva loan in order to purchase farm materials such as seeds and fertilizer that will help increase yields thus providing better income to enable her to support basic family needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

She is happy with kiva and their lenders for their intervention; she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm materials such as fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria is 34 years she is a good seamstress and she is still making coats, jackets and other stuff Victoria is married and her husband is 34 years old and he works fixing floors at many places at El Alto (mostly offices) Victoria is mother of 3 children that are going to school The house family has only two rooms for the entire family Victoria needs a loan to buy a new industrial machine that will help her with her business Victoria would like to improve her home in the future she hopes you can help her
texts.en: Victoria is 34 years old and a good seamstress who makes coats, jackets and other clothing. Victoria is married and her husband, also 34, works fixing floors, mostly in offices around El Alto. Victoria is the mother of three children who go to school. The family house has only two rooms for the entire family. Victoria needs a loan to buy a new industrial sewing machine that will help her with her business. She would like to improve her home in the future and hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a new  industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Patrih Primo

texts.es:
Patrih es un hombre de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 5 y 10 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, solidario, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’ situada al oeste de la ciudad, a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, en la meseta altiplánica y es parte de la aglomeración urbana más grande del país, el clima es frío durante todo el año y no llega superar los 17º grados Centígrados en verano.
Patrih es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina, que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la producción de estuco; esta es un grano fino compuesto de cal apagada, mármol pulverizado, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. Y que se endurece al ser mesclada con agua y se utiliza sobre todo para cubrir paredes y techos. “Inicié mi actividad porque la zona donde vivimos es productora de estuco por tradición y es el negocio propio del lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con compradores mayoristas que se ocupan de vender estuco por toda la ciudad, la desventaja es la falta de agua y combustible para trabajar.  Su sueño es constituir su empresa de comercio de estuco a nivel masivo, él desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Patrih solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco y alimentar a su familia
texts.en:
Patrih is a 33-year-old man, who lives with his partner and has two sons ages 12 and 8 and two daughters ages 5 and 10, and his business is making stucco. 

He is a good father, enterprising, supportive, with a good attitude, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in the community of Vichaya, located to the west of the city, at an altitude of 4000 meters above sea level, in the highland plains, and which is part of the largest urban agglomeration of the country. The climate is cold all year round and doesn't get above 17 degrees centigrade in the summer. 

Patrih has dark skin and eyes, short dark hair, is short, has a thin physique, his native language is Aymará which he speaks in this place and he also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the work he does. He shares his life with his partner who works in the same business and with their children who go to school. They live in their own house made of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting, which has electricity. It doesn't have running water or sewer services. His business is making stucco. This is a fine powder made up of lime, crushed marble, plaster, natural dyes, etc. and it becomes hard when it is mixed with water and it is used primarily to cover walls and roofs. "I began my work because the zone where we live is traditionally a producer of stucco and it is the business of the place..." he said. The advantage of his business is that he has wholesale purchasers who take care of selling the stucco all over the city. The disadvantage is the lack of water and fuel to work. His dream is to build his business of making stucco on a massive level. He wants to invest in his business through the purchase of firewood and fuel to mine stucco. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that he has been doing this work independently.

For these reasons, Patrih asks for a loan to purchase firewood and fuel to mine stucco and feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and fuel to mine stucco and feed his family.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella, 43, is a very family-oriented lady. She has been married to her husband for 30 years and has six children. For her to start helping her husband support the family, she ventured into mixed farming 20 years ago with her husband's half acre land as capital. Today, the farm has two cows and five head of poultry. The farmland is kept green and beautiful by the hundreds of trees planted on it. Isabella is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy cereal grains. Many farmers in Kenya make an extra living by selling cereals. Farmers lay out capital to aggregate cereal produce, and sell it to far away, profitable markets at a decent margin. Income from this investment will enable Isabella to lift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 51 años, de edad ofrece el servicio de construcción de vivienda en general, entre vecinos y otros clientes fijos, ubicados en el municipio de donde habita y tiene su negocio. Él es un hombre casado, padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 23 a 28 años, que habita con su familia y trabaja para incrementar cada vez más su bienestar. Hace 20 años, en el año 1995, inicio su negocio en el mes de Febrero, siguiendo la tradición de su familia, de quien había aprendido y posteriormente se capacitó para mejorar todas las técnicas constructivas de reparación, mantenimiento, construcción y remodelación de viviendas, actualmente su mercado lo conforman referidos a quienes ofrece sus servicios a través de tarjetas de presentación, con las cuales extiende cada vez más   su oferta. Diariamente trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 5 de la tarde comprando los materiales de contado y a crédito, mientras ofrece su servicio de contado. En la actualidad su meta es adquirir herramientas,  para adecuar mucho más su taller y finalmente terminar de reparar un apartamento, aunque su mayor desafío es la competencia y el insuficiente capital de trabajo para responder a su demanda. Carlos está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales de construcción, activos fijos, y herramientas. Con esta inversión se incrementarán sus ganancias pues es la meta que espera cumplir, haciendo así, de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Carlos, 51 years old, offers general home construction services to neighbors and other regular customers, located in the municipality where he lives and has his business. He is a married man, the father of 3 children between the ages of 23 and 28, who lives with his family and works to continue increasing their well-being. Twenty years ago, in 1995, he began his business in the month of February, following his family's tradition, from whom he had learned and later trained himself to improve every construction technique for repair, maintenance, construction, and remodeling houses. Currently his market is made up of referrals to whom he offers his services through business cards which continue to expand his offerings. He works daily from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon, purchasing the materials in cash and on credit, while he offers his services in cash. Currently, his goal is to get tools to outfit his workshop much more and finally to finish repairing an apartment, though his greatest challenge is the competition and insufficient working capital to respond to the demand. Carlos is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase construction materials, fixed assets and tools. With this investment, he will increase his earning since this is the goal he wants to achieve. Doing this, his Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, fixed assets and construction tools.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. He is 54 years old and he lives in a wooden-pile house with his wife (who is also a weaver) and his son, who is still studying. His three other children are already working and/or married.

Phoeun owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2013, he was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of men and women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Phoeun makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for his  family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for his fields, and to develop his business.

Thanks to this loan, he will buy silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of his loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful, traditional, handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of his loom

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es:
Martha, a sus 26 años de edad, es madre de 1 hijo, al que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio almacén de variedades; allí trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como productos de uso personal, ropa, artículos decorativos, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 

Martha manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha, at 26 years old is the mother of 1 son who she has gotten ahead with arduous effort and dedication. 

For a long time, she has worked as an independent saleswoman in her own variety store. There, she works for 8 hours every day and has managed to generate the income to cover the family necessities. 

She says that her interest in the loan is to invest in the purchase of a bulk assortment such as personal use products, clothing, decorations and more to stock up sufficiently and be able to satisfy her customers' tastes with the variety that she will offer. This will help her to improve her sales and the income that she gets, in addition it will address her greatest challenge which is to sustain herself in the face of the unfair competition which is in the area.

Martha says that her greatest desire is to improve the conditions of her house and to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk assortment of personal products, clothing, decorations, and more.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a brilliant 45-year-old farmer from Nyamira, Kenya, with a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. She practises diversified farming. Her main source of income is milk. Besides being a wife and a mother, she is also a long-time loyal client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization dedicated to elevating the quality of life for rural smallholder farmers. Teresa has a great credit history with the company. 

Teresa is seeking a KES 90,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders into her business. With your money, Teresa will buy a grain milling machine and set up shop where locals of Bosamaro village, where she lives, can have their cereal produce processed into flour. Flour is a key ingredient to most staple foods in Kenya such as ugali (hard porridge) and chapati. 

Your investment will not only have a big financial and social impact on Teresa's family, but it will also make grain milling easier and more convenient than ever for occupants of Bosamaro village.

loans.use: To buy a grain mill.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 20 years old and has one child. She owns and operates a small business cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. 

Bernadette requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run her business. She hopes to build a restaurant in the near future using her business profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Las Ñustas De Ollanta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ÑUSTAS DE OLLANTA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jessica tiene 41 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los socios se sienten  agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
The members belong to the Las Ñustas de Ollanta communal bank group. This bank is located in Ollantaytambo district, which is part of Urubamba province and Cusco department. 

Jessica is 41 years old, has 3 children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She has been working in this business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts into her business each day. The member wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, oil, legumes, and more. 

The members are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, legumes, and more.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is a smallholder farmer from the Koibatek location in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She practises dairy farming and the sale of milk is her main source of income. 

This year, Albina set her mind to venture into crop farming because she has enough space for it on her land. Beginning crop farming on fallow land is very expensive at first, but the cost drops with subsequent seasons. To get started, Albina is seeking a loan of KES 20,000. She will use the money to pay for labour (when breaking the ground), fertilizer and seeds. 

Having a mixed farm will prove to be very advantageous for her. This is because crop farming and dairy farming complement each other in many ways including more efficient utilization of farm byproducts such as manure and plant stalks. 

Increased income from the investment will help Albina to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To venture into crop farming by paying for labour (when breaking the ground), fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman with two children. She describes herself as focused. Jane operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She says her biggest business challenge is the dry season. 

Jane will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. She hopes that in the future she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with five children. He describes himself as God-fearing. Paul operates a bakery where he makes cakes and bread. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as changes in demand. 

Paul will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more ingredients for baking. He hopes that in the future, he will be a reliable and good service provider. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for baking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general beauty salon products which will serve as supplies and others to sell such as straighteners, dyes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman, and she has five children. She describes herself to be competent. 

Susan operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

Susan will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for land preparation. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

Susan will use the anticipated profits to plant more acres of land next season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Monica, a married mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the enterprise development training.

Monica operates a small grocery store where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, carrots, and kale to increase her stock and meet her customers' needs. She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, carrots, and kale to increase her stock and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman and she owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mwanatumu has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband manufactures and sells furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. Shabana's husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from common people for making or repairing wooden accessories. This business yields a good income for them, but their family's needs are increasing day by day and they needs more money to afford household expenses. 

Now, Shabana's husband wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why Shabana came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan so that her husband can buy raw materials for marking furniture. Shabana hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for their family. Shabana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to expand her husband's furniture shop

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 37 años de edad, está unido con su esposa con la que tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 11 y 13 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonio es un hombre que le gusta trabajar en el campo, pues él lo realiza desde hace 10 años, gracias esta labor él ha logrado mantener a su familia, el eligió esta actividad pues en la zona donde él vive la tierra produce muy buenas verduras.
Antonio por ser un hombre de campo y de mucha experiencia, ahora se ha dado cuenta que con el capital que tiene no se dará abasto para poder cultivar en esta temporada, por tal motivo ha decidido solicitar un crédito  para poder comprar sus semillas de papa, zanahoria y fertilizantes.
El guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder cultivar a tiempo, y así poder obtener buenas cosechas y ganancias, Antonio anhela poder construir su casa de dos niveles para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 37-year-old man who is close to his wife, with whom he has two children, ages 11 and 13. This lovely family lives in a community of Sololá. 

Antonio is a man who likes to work in the countryside, which he has done for the past 10 years. Thanks to this work, he has managed to support his family. He chose this work because in the zone where he lives, the land produces very good vegetables.  

Antonio, as a man from the countryside and who has a lot of experience, has now realized that the capital that he has will not be enough to be able to cultivate this season, so for this reason he decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase his potato and carrot seeds and fertilizer.

He has the hope of getting the loan to be able to plant in time, and in this way get good harvests and earnings. Antonio desires to be able to build a two-story house for his children.

loans.use: to purchase potato and carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco Yovanis

texts.es:
Francisco, de 29 años de edad, es muy trabajador y muy dedicado a sus responsabilidades laborales, muy conocido en su comunidad por su excelente comportamiento y por su alto grado de servicio a los demás.- Creció con sus padres, quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos principios; actualmente está soltero.

Francisco, es empleado en la oficinas de medio ambiente de su municipio, pero además se dedica a prestar sus servicios de chofer, desde la edad de 20 años, todo lo aprendió junto a su padre, a quien acompañaba todos los días en sus jornadas laborales; motivado por las ganancias económicas que le genera esta actividad, decidido continuar ejerciéndolas y ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.
 
El dinero será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta, pues le servirá para desplazarse hasta su lugar de trabajo, de esta manera le resultará más fácil viajar a su trabajo y retornar a su casa. 

Los sueños de Francisco, son tener una vivienda propia y amueblada, además quiere comprar un vehículo, apoyar en la educación de sus sobrinos y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 29 years old, is very hard working and very dedicated to his work responsibilities, and is well-known in his community for his excellent comportment and for his high level of service to others. He grew up with his parents who taught him and instilled good principles in him. Currently, he is single. 

Francisco is an employee in the environmental offices of his municipality, but in addition he has offered his services as a driver since the age of 20, all of which he learned alongside his father, who he accompanied every day in his daily work. Motivated by the earnings that this work generated, he decided to continue doing it and now it has become his primary source of income. 

The money will be used to purchase a motorcycle which will serve him to get to his workplace, and in this way it will be easier to get to work and return home. 
 
Francisco's dreams are to have his own house and furnish it, in addition he wants to purchase a vehicle, support his nephews' and nieces' education and have a family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Lowlence, a member of Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group. He is fifty-four years old, and married with ten children; he works hard to support his family. 

Lowlence does dairy, maize and bean farming. Having gone through Hand in Hand training on Enterprise development, he has gained a good number of customers in his enterprise. He is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feed for his dairy cow. This loan will help him to improve his farming output, thus generating more income to support his family.
 
Lowlence is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and animal feed that will help to improve output.

loans.name: Kivandini Adult Education Centre Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the name of the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She is 29 years of age, married, and has two children who are in primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 and has benefited from the group mobilization and enterprise development trainings.

Rebecca operates a tailoring shop, where she makes clothes such as dresses, trousers and school uniforms. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more tailoring cloth to increase her stock and hence satisfy her customers' needs.

She is thankful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring cloth, which will enable her to have diversified stock and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 44 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her mother. Her only child is 26 years old and works in Thailand. 

In 2002, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sophea makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay daily expenses and to take care of her elderly mother.  

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation fees.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronica is 27 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 in order to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

Veronica used to be a housewife before joining HiH EA. Now, she operates a food cafe in a nearby shopping center where she sells tea, snacks, and food. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy kitchen utensils such as cups, plates, and cooking pots for use in her cafe to be able to serve her customers well. Veronica is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils such as cups, plates, and cooking posts for use in her cafe to serve her customers well.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer that will help boost harvest thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Raksmi

texts.en:
Raksmi is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house  with her 20-year-old sister, her 15-year-old  brother and her parents. Her brother is studying, her sister and her parents work in the fields. Her family owns six hectares of rice fields and two hectares of cassava fields. 

In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Raksmi makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her parents cover fees related to the fields. 

Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 37-year-old mother with one child.

She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Maria requested for a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his tile workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as dry season. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own fish stall for years now and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To further improve her sales, Valeriana would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional dried fish to sell. With PHP 50,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of fish and other supplies which are needed in her business. She sincerely wants to let you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Valeriana hopes to grow her business and dreams for her children to finish schooling. She also aspires to have her own stall in the marketplace where she works. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Perfil Francisca 

Francisca es una señora muy trabajadora, Ella vive sola, sus hijos ya están mayores y viven con sus respectivas familias. La nieta mayor le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Su principal actividades la pulpería que atiende desde mediados del 2014. La clienta cuenta con su casa propia, lugar en el que hace más de 6 meses instala una pulpería, donde con gran éxito ha crecido,  distribuyendo  productos de primera necesidad. Necesita acondicionar el corredor e invertir en producto básico como arroz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros. Tiene proveedores de pan, frutas y refrescos que la visitan semana a semana, los presenta como referencias crediticias.



Ante una situación de salud y para evitar andar tanto tiempo en la calle, monta la pulpería, ofreciendo principalmente refrescos y golosinas, pero ante la demanda del vecindario decide mejorar la oferta de productos. Ella cuenta con el corredor de su casa como espacio físico, tiene una refrigeradora y una computadora donde brinda el servicio de recargas telefónicas y pago de servicios.

 	Francisca cuenta con 2 fuentes de ingreso, la pulpería y su pensión, la casa es propia y desea continuar trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La clienta ubica su negocio en su casa, en un barrio donde no existe otro negocio de este tipo y viven cerca de 75 personas. Los productos de la pulpería son adquiridos directamente por sus clientes, además al estar sobre carretera principal muchos conductores y ciclistas se detienen a refrescarse en estos calurosos días de verano. Tiene proveedores de pan, refrescos y golosinas, que la visitan semanalmente y la refieren en esta solicitud. No existe competencia en la zona y maneja los precios sugeridos por las empresas para la venta de productos. El negocio está en proceso de adquirir su patente, trámite que está en desarrollo.
texts.en:
Francisca's profile

Francisca is a very hard-working woman. She lives alone, her children are now adults and live with their respective families. Her oldest granddaughter helps her with her business. Her primary activity is her grocery store which she has had since mid-2014. She has her own house, a place in which over 6 months ago, she established a grocery store where she has, with great success, been expanding, distributing basic necessities. She needs to fix up the outdoor walkway and invest in basic products such as rice, beans, sugar and more. She has providers of bread, fruit, and soft drinks who visit her each week and she presents them as credit references. 

Due to a health situation and to avoid walking in the street so much, she opened the grocery store, offering primarily soft drinks and candies, but due to the neighborhood demand, she decided to improve her product offerings. She has an outdoor walkway in her house as a physical space, she has a refrigerator and a computer where she offers telephone charging and payment services. 

Francisca has 2 sources of income, the grocery store and her pension. The house is her own and she wants to continue working to improve her living conditions. 

She located her business in her house, in a neighborhood where there isn't any other business of this type and where about 75 people live. The products in the store are gotten directly by the customers. In addition, by being on the main road, many drivers and cyclists stop to refresh themselves in these hot summer days. She has providers of bread, soft drinks and candies who visit her each week and provide references for this application. There isn't any competition in the zone and she uses the suggested prices by the business for the sale of the products. The business is in the process of getting its business license, a process that is ongoing.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and improve the entrance of her grocery store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from poultry.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. Lorna hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, sacks of fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gulnarahon

texts.ru: Гульнарахон, 46 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей, вся семья с радостью помогает по хозяйству. У Гульнарахон высшее образование и большой трудовой стаж, она работает учителем. Также около 25 лет назад Гульнарахон стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульнарахон на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 0,51 ГА она выращивает рис для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнарахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для увеличения объемов продажи экологически чистого, вкусного домашнего молока. Гульнарахон планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulnarahon is 46 and married with four children. The whole family happily helps with the farm. She has a higher education and is a very experienced schoolteacher. She also started working in animal husbandry and agriculture about 25 years ago with 15,000 KGS she had saved. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows as well as 0.51 hectares of land where she grows rice for sale. Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnarahon has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase a cow with a calf in order to increase the amount of fresh, delicious organic milk she can sell. She plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow with calf in order to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: Elenura

texts.ru: Эленура, 30 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей школьников. Эленура на протяжении многих лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть лошадь и 10 овец, также выращивает фасоль на 1,0 Га земли. Эленура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Это позволит Эленуре увеличить поголовье скота и развить ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Elenura is 30 and married with two school-aged sons. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years and currently has a horse and 10 sheep as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows beans.

Elenura has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. This will allow her to increase her head count of livestock and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her husband are farmers living in Armavir town. They organize cultivation of tomato, eggplant, pepper, watermelon and also grow 15 trees of apricot. Anahit and her husband are also occupied in beekeeping. They keep 22 colonies of bees and get high quality honey, which is sold in local markets. 

To support her farming business and develop it, Anahit asks this loan. She plans to purchase fertilizer, to pay for cultivation work, fuel and to hire workers to prepare the farm for a new cultivation season.

Anahit has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Anahit will wait for lenders' support and hopes that this loan will help her in developing her farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, cultivation work, fuel and to hire workers to develop the farm and make it profitable.

loans.name: Tattibubu

texts.ru: Таттибубу 28 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Таттибубу - среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Таттибубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, лошадь. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 1,80 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, где Таттибубу выращивает картофель, перец и многолетние травы. Таттибубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и топлива. Развитие хозяйства позволит увеличить тем самым ее прибыль. Доходы от кредита позволят Таттибубу развить ее бизнес и сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Tattibubu is 28 and married with two preschool-aged children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture as an additional source of income so she can provide for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has one dairy cow with a calf and a horse on her farm as well as 1.8 hectares of her own and 1 hectare of rented land where she grows potatoes, peppers and hay.

Tattibubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel. Developing her business will allow her to improve her income from it, and profits from the loan will allow her to develop her business and do home renovations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fuel and seeds in order to grow organic produce

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 39 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 17 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. Главной ценностью жизни она считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье детей. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат Динары, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова, молоко которой Динара продает на ежедневной основе и 1 лошадь. Также есть 2,80 Га земли, где выращивает фасоль для реализации.  Динара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сомов (KGS) для покупки удобрений, семян и топлива для выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Она намерена увеличить свой бизнес, что приведет к развитию ее бизнеса и увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Dinara is 39 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in farming for 17 years. She counts her family's well-being, the health of her business and the happiness of her children as the most valuable things in her life. Thanks to her purposefulness, hard work and goal-orientedness, she currently has one horse on her farm as well as one dairy cow whose milk she sells daily. She also has 2.8 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. 

Dinara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers, seeds and fuel so that she can grow organic beans. She intends to increase her business, which will help develop her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fuel and seeds in order to grow organic beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and a drip irrigation system.

loans.name: Michatha (B) Organic Farming And Environmental Shg Group

texts.en:
The person standing in the middle of the photo is Esther, a member of Michatha (B) Organic Farming and Environmental SHG Group. She is 31 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does poultry keeping as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more chickens so that she can increase her income from sales. This will help her cater for family needs such as food and school fees for her child.
 
Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chickens that will improve income.

loans.name: Toa

texts.en:
Toa is 47 years old. She is married and has a son, so she works very hard to provide for the family. 

Shrimp farming and fishing provide the main income of her family. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standard as well as protect the environment.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
The person appearing on the photo is Isaack. He is 44 years old and married, and he has three children.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training especially on enterprise development and financial planning.

Isaack operates a second-hand clothes shop. He is borrowing the loan to buy more second-hand clothes so as to add stock and hence earn more income, which will enable his family to have access to quality healthcare services.

He is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes so as to add stock and earn more income, which will give his family access to quality healthcare services.

loans.name: Ndethye Ngutethye Self Help Group

texts.en:
Winfred is the name of the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

Winfred operates a secondhand clothes business. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more secondhand clothes to add stock and satisfy her customers' demands and thereby take better care of her family. Winfred is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to add stock and satisfy her customers' demands and thereby take better care of her family.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 26-year-old mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Zubaida's husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruit at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruit to his customers. He has been feeding his family using the income he generates from this fruit shop. 

Recently, the needs of their family have suddenly increased and they do not have the resources to cope with these needs. Therefore, Zubaida's husband decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of fruit. Therefore, Zubaida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal fruits. Zubaida thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments and cereals.

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is a 40-year-old woman with 4 children. She has sold fish  at the village market for a year. 

Sieni will use the loan to buy a fishing boat, ice, a torch, fishing gear, and a  fishing net to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, ice, a torch, fishing gear, and a fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti is a 47-year-old married woman with 4 children, She runs a landscaping and lawn mowing business to earn a living. Goretti has more than 10 years of experience with these businesses, and asks for another loan to buy a heavy duty leaf blower, a weed eater, machetes, chemicals, shovels, a chainsaw and outdoor gloves. 

Goretti hopes to use her profits to ensure the betterment of her family and especially her children's education.

Goretti has been with SPBD since 2013 to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy a heavy duty leaf blower, a weed eater, machetes, chemicals, shovels, a chainsaw and outdoor gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Ines; la socia continua con su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua elaborando diferentes platos de comida como pollo al horno, estofado de carne entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Señor de Puquin"; This bank is located in the Cusco district, which also belongs to the province and the department of Cusco.  

The member is Ms. Ines.  The member continues with her business of food sales.  The member thanks those who form part of her dream through these means and promises to comply with the repayment schedule in the established timeframe.  The member continues making different plates of food like roasted chicken, meat stews and others.   The member has some time in the business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day to the business, as this is the way she moves her family forward.  

The member requests this credit to buy consumables such as rice and oil, among others.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as rice, oil, and others.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a married woman in her mid 30s with three children, all attend school. She has sold wheat door to door for three years.  She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
