This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her inventory and has successfully repaid the loans.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, and household expenses.  She is happy with  the loan.  

She will use this loan to buy millet, maize, beans, and rice and meet her customer's demand and requirements.  She dreams of owning her grinding meal. 

She will make sure she  repays the loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy millet, maize, beans, rice.

loans.name: Señor De Tantanmarca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE TANTAMARCA, este banco está situado en la comunidad de Yanacona, distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Virginia tiene 47 años de edad es soltera y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, tomates entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicitó el crédito para la compra de tomates, zanahorias entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale a la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the SEÑOR DE TANTAMARCA communal bank. This bank is located in the community of Yanacona, district and province of Urubamba and the department of Cuzco.

Virginia is 47 years old, single and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling vegetables. She has had this business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She sells carrots, tomatoes and more. She wants to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy tomatoes, carrots and more. 

The borrowers are grateful for the loan and committed to making their payments.

The borrower who is in the added on photo had to excuse herself for getting to the meeting late for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots and more.

loans.name: Divino Rostro Group

texts.es: EL grupo ¨Divino Rostro¨ conformados por 4 mujeres emprendedoras, solicitan crédito para el crecimiento de sus microempresas. La coordinadora de grupo Irene, de 36 años, acompañada y con 4 hijos. Dedicada a la venta de dulces y cereales,  de manera ambulante. Orgullosa que sus hijos le ayuden en el negocio a la preparación de la venta. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz, azúcar, especies y más. Sus metas son el poder agrandar el negocio y proporcionar una excelente presentación de sus productos, así ser más comerciables. Las demás integrantes María Auxiliadora, 56 años, prepara y vende pinol y pinolillo. Nora de 36 años, desde su hogar vende tanques de gas y Juana de 62 años tiene una pulpería en su hogar.
texts.en:
The group "Divino Rostro" is formed by four enterprising woman who request loans to grow their micro-enterprises.  The coordinator of the group is 36 year old Irene who, accompanied by her 4 children, dedicates herself to mobile sales of sweets and cereals. She is proud that her children help her in her business in preparing the sales.  

She needs the loan to buy wood, corn, sugar, spices and more.  Her goals are to grow the business and give excellent presentation of her products, to be more marketable.  

The other members are María Auxiliadora, who is 56 years old and prepares and sells pineal (a corn meal drink).   Nora is 36 years old and from her house she sells tanks of gas and Juana is 62 years old and has a small store in her home.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn, sugar, spices, and more.

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
Grupo solidario, “Responsabilidad”, conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre, demostrando ser personas honorables y responsables, solicitan por 4ta. vez crédito a ADIM, con objetivo de seguir creciendo en sus negocios. 

Aracelly es la coordinadora del grupo, a sus 33 años, casada y con un hijo, maneja su negocio de diversos productos como ropa, calzado y preparación y venta de comida desde ya 8 años, esto lo inició  con los ingresos que tiene su esposo en el trabajo. Con el préstamo otorgado comprara zapatos, bisutería, blusas y pantalones para dama, camisetas para caballeros y ropa de cama. Y ofrecer a su variedad de clientela más gama de productos aumentando sus ganancias. 

Los otros miembros son Karen de 32 años que se gana la vida dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada desde ya 3 años; Leonel Abraam de 24 años tiene una pulpería en su hogar y desea comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, gaseosa y tomates.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Responsabilidad”, is made up of two women and a man, who have shown themselves to be honest and responsible people, ask for the fourth time for a loan from ADIM, with the goal of being able to continue growing their businesses. 

Aracelly is the coordinator of this group. At 33 years old, she is married with one child. She has run her business of various products such as clothing, footwear, and making and selling food for the past 8 years. She began this with the income that her husband has in his work. With the granted loan, she will purchase shoes, costume jewelry, blouses and pants for women, shirts for men and bedding, and will offer to her variety of customers, a wider range of products, increasing her earnings.   

The other members are Karen, 32 years old, who has earned her living selling cosmetics and used clothing for 3 years now and Leonel Abraam, 24 years old, who has a grocery store in his home and wants to purchase rice, oil, sugar, soft drinks and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, costume jewelry, blouses, and pants for women, shirts for men and bedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 63 years old, married and has seven children.

Nelida is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Nelida requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nelida has been in this business for four years now, and she also earns additional income from a general store. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nelida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 29-year-old single woman with three children, 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has had a food vending business for 5 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy flour, sugar and other items for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies, dyes, creams, nail polish, gel, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hardworking 31-year-old farmer from Koibatek village which is found in the North Rift area of Kenya. She owns a beautiful home littered with granaries for threshed grains. Crop farming has worked out well for her in the past seasons and this year she is looking to expand and grow more crops. 

To expand, Juliana needs money that she doesn't have to buy fertilizer, seeds, farm tools and to pay for hired labour. She is therefore seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to pay for these basic farm inputs. 

The impact of your loan will be felt by Juliana's family after she reaps what she will plant this season. An increase in income will enable her to be a better provider for her family.

loans.use: to expand her crop farm

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre trabajador y muy humilde que se dedica  a la agricultura por ser su fuente de ingresos y sostenimiento de la familia, él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro comprar su fertilizantes, semillas y pago la mano de obra para el cultivo de papa, gracias a Dios que con esta cosecha le fue muy bien porque logro venderlos a un buen precio, ahora su cultivo ha incrementado y él se encuentra muy satisfecho, el ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar nuevamente sus semillas y fertilizantes.
Manuel tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para que su vida y la de su familia siga cambiando.
texts.en:
Manuel is a hardworking and very humble man who works in agriculture to earn his income and support his family. Thanks to the previous loan, he was able to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for the labor to plant the potatoes. Thanks to God, this harvest went really well for him because he was able to sell it at a very good price. Now his crop  has increased and he is very satisfied. Now he is asking for a new loan to be able to buy seeds and fertilizer again. 

Manuel hopes to get the loan so that his and his family's life will keep changing.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semillas.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio, de 73 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, él no estudio, porque su familia era de escasos recursos y tuvo que dedicarse a los trabajos agrícolas, para apoyar en las necesidades de su familia.

Serapio, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de trasporte con su vehículo, en donde trasporta personas y mercadería todos los días de la semana, también se dedica a la agricultura desde la edad de 18 años, decidió continuar desempeñando este tipo de trabajos para sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos pares de llantas, realizarle afinado al motor y revisión y reparación del sistema de suspensión de su vehículo.- De esta manera dará un mejor servicio y mayor seguridad a sus clientes.

Los sueños de Serapio son, tener un vehículo nuevo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, cancelar el crédito y apoyar en la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Serapio, 73 years old, is partnered and has 4 children who are now adults and independent. He couldn't go to school because his family had limited resources and he had to work in agriculture to support his family's needs.   

Serapio works offering transportation services with his vehicle, in which he transports people and merchandise every day of the week. He has also worked in agriculture since the age of 18; he decided to continue working in this type of job to get his family ahead. 

The money from the loan will be used to purchase two pairs of tires, to have a tune-up on the motor, and check and repair the suspension on his vehicle. In this way, he will provide better service and more safety to his customers. 

Serapio's dreams are to have a new vehicle to provide better service to his customers, pay off the loan, and support his grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase two pairs of tires, to have a tune-up on the motor, and check and repair the suspension on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of foodstuff and flour for her kiosk and posho mill.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is 31 years old and unmarried with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Sau needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Sau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake and a new machete

loans.name: Ry Group

texts.en:
Ry is a 29-year-old  married farmer with two young children. She lives in the Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. One  child attend school. Her husband is 34 years old and  has a motorcycle with a trailer to sell vegetables, fish, and pork  in the nearby villages. 

Ry and her husband earn approximately $6 each day. Ry, a group leader, would like to take out a group loan with five members, she will use her portion to buy foundation parts of a latrine. 

This loan will help her have enough money to build a latrine for the family  and improve the hygienic conditions. She is going to help expand her husband’s business and support her children to earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale is a 28-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Losivale    requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis  is a 46-year-old married farmer with 3 children who are 14, 7, and 3 years old. 

Francis has been a mixed farmer for 20 years, earning a monthly income of 65,000 KES. He has previously borrowed 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. 

He has asked for a loan to purchase a calf and animal feed.  He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children, pay for family medical care, expand his mixed farming business, pay for transportation of his farm products to the market, and repay his loan.
 
His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business, secure more local and foreign market for his farm products, and enjoy an improved quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a calf, animal feed, fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides, and hire laborers.

loans.name: April Mae

texts.en:
April Mae is a married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. April Mae is 28 years old.

April Mae has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and fishing net, and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

April Mae has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and fishing net, and to pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 48-year-old married entrepreneur with six children, all attend school.

Aida has had a fishing business for 5 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment, a fishing net, and maintenance for her boat.

She would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, a fishing net, and maintain  her boat.

loans.name: Philadephia Group

texts.en:
Grace greatly thanks Kiva for the loan they provided and she successfully increased her business. She used the loan to buy extra quantities of second-hand clothes and this effectively helped her to increase her profits. 

Grace used the profits to pay school fees for her children and she was able to provide them with other basic needs such as clothing, food, and shelter.

She would like to obtain another loan and buy 2 more bales of second-hand clothes. In the future,  Grace plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Pirickilla

texts.en:
Pirickilla is a very industrious, honest, and hardworking 53-year-old woman from the Nyamira area of Kenya.

She has  farmed  for 33 years, has gained much experience, and is considered among the best farmers in her village.  She sells milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Pirickilla is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. She wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits farming, she has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereal. 

She seeks a loan to buy cereal because Kenya's Nyamira area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Pirickilla could increase her profits and satisfy the demand. Acquiring  funds has been a challenge for Pirickilla, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo  partners with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality by providing training and financial assistance. 

Pirickilla believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Pirickilla to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Agée de 51 ans, Il  est marié et père de 5 enfants dont le dernier qui a  16 ans est  encore à charge et suit ses études en classe de première au lycée. Les quatre autre enfants qui sont tous déjà majeurs n’habitent plus auprès de la famille. Sa femme s’adonne à l’activité de vente de fruits.
Martin est gargotier, il a démarré en 2008. L'activité était exercée ensemble par les deux époux, or actuellement la femme vend des fruits pour que la famille ait deux différentes  sortes d'activités, génératrice de revenu.
Avec le crédit, Martin va pouvoir améliore et diversifier ses plats(de spécialités malagasy) pour fidéliser les clients actuels et attirer d'autres nouveaux.
La famille est propriétaire du local où elle habite mais chaque année, le quartier  est toujours inondé en période d'été. A long terme, la famille envisage d’acquérir un autre terrain et construire une autre maison dans une zone non exposée à des inondations.
texts.en:
Martin is 51 years old, married and father to five children, the youngest of whom is 16 years old, still a dependant and in his penultimate year at high school. The four other children are all adults and no longer live with their family. Martin's wife has a small business selling fruits, while Martin himself runs a small restaurant, which he began in 2008. The couple used to run the restaurant together but now his wife sells fruit so that they can have two different income-generating activites.

With his loan Martin is going to be able to improve and diversify the dishes he serves (Malagash specialities) so that he can retain his current customer base and attract new customers.

The family owns the house where it lives but each year the neighborhood is flooded during the summer. In the longer term the family intends to acquire another plot of land and build another house in an area which is not exposed to floods.

loans.use: to buy rice, meats and a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo is 25 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Palolo  requested a loan to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collections of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy barber shop items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She maintains her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day, so she requires some beauty salon-related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. Therefore, Noreen made contact with Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

Noreen is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy material for her own beauty salon

loans.name: Saliha

texts.en:
Saliha is 36, married, and has one child.  To contribute to the household budget, she began selling underwear from her home and one day a week from the local market.  With her second loan from Maya, she will buy underwear wholesale.  In the future she wants to open up a lingerie shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff:
Saliha Hanım 36 yaşında evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Evin bütçesine katkı sağlamak için evinden ve haftanın bir günüde semt pazarında çamaşır satışı yapıyor.  Maya’dan 2. kredisini kullanan Saliha hanım bu kredilerini sermaye amaçlı kullanarak toptan çamaşır satın aldı.  Gelecekte bir iç çamaşır dükkânı açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, 46, is married with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Phillipine pesos from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment, including a fishing net, and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Rosalie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including a fishing net, and pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Aylin

texts.en:
Aylin is married and has two children. She and her husband sell curtains at the local market. 

Their customers first choose their preferred design and colour from a catalogue. Aylin then visits their homes to measure the windows and has the curtains made according to the customers’ wishes. 

With her third loan from Maya, Aylin is preparing to open a curtain store.

loans.use: to prepare to open a curtain store

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 63-year-old farmer from the Kenyenya area of Kenya. He owns a small piece of land which hosts both his home and business. Jeremiah farms bananas used to prepare "matoke," which is a staple food for the locals. 

To grow bananas, deep holes need to be dug to host the plant. This makes banana growing very labor intensive and time consuming. To make work easier, Jeremiah needs to employ the most modern and efficient tools that he can easily afford and maintain. 

Jeremiah is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will be used in the bed preparation of his banana plants. Having new and efficient tools will reduce the load and save time. Making the work move faster will save him a lot of time and reduce hired labor costs. 

Returns from this investment will help his family meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy farm implements to be used in the bed preparation of his banana plants

loans.name: Nthongoni Adult S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Mariana, 51 years old and a mother of three children. She is a member of Nthongoni Adult S.H.G Group and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training sessions on enterprise development.

Mariana operates a general retail shop. She is borrowing to buy sugar, salt, and cooking fat so as to add stock to her general shop and hence meet her customers needs and earn more income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and cooking fat to add to the stock of her general store and meet her customers' needs and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new gloves, boots, a machete and crops

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service bicycles and buy more bicycles. His business goal is to own a motorbike within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a quality life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service bicycles and buy more bicycles

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 64 years old, widowed and has six children.

Tita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Tita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Tita has been in this business for 15 years now; she also earns additional income from a general store and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ann is 31 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ann requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment and fishing net and pay for maintenance for her boat.

Ann has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment and fishing net and pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 37 years old and married with four children.

Melody works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, soft drinks and personal care products.

Melody has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Melody aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, soft drinks and personal care products

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a first-time borrower in UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is a married man with four children.

He is boda boda (motorcycle transport) cyclist in Kyengera, a suburb of Kampala 8 kilometers from the city center. He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy a new motorcycle.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have always offered to people within his vicinity, and above all, looks foward to accessing greater support today and in the near future.

Pictured is Deo and the UGAFODE credit officer (from left to right).

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Meet Linet. She is a 56-year-old woman who has been a farmer for 35 years. She is based in Bosamaro village, where she has a 2-acre farm and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. 

On the farm, she grows vegetables that she uses for both consumption and sale. This business has enabled her to raise four children. Linet's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending school. She is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. 

With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. 

The money from the investment will enable Linet to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way toward empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such seeds and fertilizer to boost farming yields.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 38-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. He is well-trained in his trade. Due to his efficient and good work, his number of clients increases day by day, so he requires some beauty salon-related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. Therefore Mumtaz made contact with Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, and to buy more beans to sell to help supplement his income.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as they will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fugalaau

texts.en:
Fugalaau is a 30-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fugalaau became a member of South Pacific Business Development this year. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag and coolio to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in her community.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag and coolio

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is a 39-year-old mother with five children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant and cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Leata requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. 

Leata hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 57 years old, married to Mokeira, and he supports 6 family members. He has been a brickmaker and seller for the last 18 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES. 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet the customers' needs in milk supply. He will use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and start up a retail business.

His future hope and dream is to have a stable family and educate his children to higher levels of study.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a single man. He operates a farm where he grows maize and also keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a productive area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

He will use his KES 70,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for land preparation costs. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to plant more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and cover land preparation costs

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 56 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

Anabelle has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lenis

texts.es:
Perfil Lenis


 Lenis, es madre de un hijo; jefa de hogar. Ella vive en la Isla de Chira, lugar ubicado a 45 minutos en bote de la ciudad de Puntarenas, en este lugar existen altos índices de desempleo, siendo la pesca la principal actividad generadora de ingresos en el lugar. Ella ha trabajado con empresas pesqueras en la Isla de Chira en el área de contabilidad, hace un año decide iniciar un negocio comercial de venta de productos tales como: ropa, zapatos, perfumes bolsos,  entre otros, además tiene un BN servicios que es utilizado por muchos vecinos, cerca de 45 clientes en ambas actividades.  Inicia vendiendo a familiares productos de catálogo; en un año ha aumentado sus pedidos por lo que requiere de capital de trabajo. Cuenta con proveedores como ditaires y también realiza compras en tiendas tanto en Puntarenas como San José. Además cada 15 días,   aproximadamente,  tiene que ir a recoger pedidos a Puntarenas por lo que debe sacar un día completo para esta diligencia. Es una persona que busca generar ingresos a su hogar en una zona donde la principal  fuente de empleo es la pesca.

Inicia con un préstamo familiar por ¢100.000 colones. Atiende el negocio de BN Servicios en su casa,  para lo que cuenta con equipo de cómputo. Para desplazarse en la Isla de Chira cuenta con una moto para desplazarse en la misma.

La empresa cuenta con un mercado en crecimiento. En Isla Chira es escasa la oferta de tiendas de ropa, tampoco existen empresas bancarias (tiene BN Servicios), por lo que las actividades que tiene Lenis son una excelente opción para atender estas estos clientes. En la zona de residencia no existe competencia para ella. Además con su moto puede cubrir toda la Isla, llevando el producto a sus clientes. Los precios de venta son de catálogo y la mercadería en general se maneja con un margen de ganancia mayor al 50%, esto debido a lo costoso de traerlos a este lugar. Vende durante todo el año ropa de temporada. Se diferencia atendiendo en forma personalizada y ofreciendo mercadería de temporada y de buena calidad;  en una zona de difícil acceso y escasa oferta de bienes y servicios.
texts.en:
Lenis’ profile

Lenis is head of the household and has a son. She lives in Chira Island, which is located 45 minutes by boat from the city of Puntarenas. The unemployment rate is high there, and most people fish in order to generate their income. Lenis has worked in the accounting department for different fishing companies in Chira Island. One year ago she decided to start selling products such as clothes, shoes, perfumes, and purses. She also offers banking services and many neighbors use them. In total, she has around forty-five customers.

She started selling products on a catalogue to relatives. Orders have increased in a year, so she is in need of working capital. She has different suppliers, such as Ditaires, although she also purchases products in stores located in Puntarenas or San José. Every second week, she has to pick her deliveries in Puntarenas, which takes her a whole day. She is a person looking to generate income for her family in an area where most people work in fishing.

She is requesting a family loan of 100,000 colones [CRC]. She offers the banking services at home, and for this she uses her computer. She has a motorcycle and uses it to travel around Chira Island. Her customer base is growing. There are few clothes stores in Chira Island, and few people offers banking services, which means that Lenis can fulfill the needs of locals. She has no competition, and can cover the whole island with the help of her motorcycle. She makes a 50% profit on the products she sells from the catalogues, due to the high costs of bringing them to the island. She sells different seasonal clothes throughout the year. She sells face-to-face and offers seasonal and good-quality products, which makes her business special in an area where goods and services are scarce.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, and be able to offer better banking services.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a business manufacturing nipa roofing in the Philippines. 

Annie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing

loans.name: Zakaria's Group

texts.en:
Zakaria is 35 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Zakaria has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Zakaria also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as they will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Zakaria's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zipindule Group

texts.en:
Lufina thanks Kiva for the previous loan that was granted her. She used the loan to buy farm inputs, and this helped her to increase her output.

She is requesting another in order to rent a better selling place in the market, where she can sell her farm produce. She plans of sending her children to better schools and hopes to build a better house for her children.

loans.use: to pay rent for a better selling place for her farm produce

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a farmer living in Aygeshat village of the Armavir region. She lives there with her mother, who is 75 years old and has a retirement pension. 

Mariam, since her childhood, has been running their family farm. She cultivates tomato, watermelon and grass in arable land near their house. Mariam also takes care of a fruit orchard, where apricot, cherry and plum trees are grown. 

To prepare her farm for the coming new season for harvesting and cultivation, Mariam asks for this loan. She needs to purchase seeds (tomato, watermelon), hire workers for land cultivation and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. 

This is her second loan. Mariam faced difficulties in paying her first loan to another financial institution, because of hard financial times of the family. Now, ensuring that her farming business is sustainable enough to cover monthly loan payments, Mariam has applied for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Through this program, more than 600 loans were disbursed, 80% of which were funded and helped individuals like Mariam to develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for seeds (tomato and watermelon), hire workers for land cultivation and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to prepare the farm for the new cultivation season

loans.name: Nagnouma's Group

texts.fr: Nagnouma,  qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, et qui portant un foulard vert clair, est membre d’un groupe de 3agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kenieroba au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Nagnouma, âgée de 58 ans, est la mère de 13 enfants âgés de 21 à 42ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Nagnouma à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50ans. Nagnouma cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que  le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Nagnouma entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité  et des formations et techniques agricoles . Cette année Nagnouma effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1.75 hectares. Cela fait maintenant 50ans que Nagnouma cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Nagnouma planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d‘ acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin, Nagnouma  espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que le mariage de ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Nagnouma, appearing in the middle and wearing a light green scarf, is a member of a group of three farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Kenieroba, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 58 years old and the mother of 13 children, aged 21 to 42, of whom three are currently in school. 

Nagnouma is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. So she was encouraged to do this work for 50 years. She grows peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of farm supplies. 

Nagnouma is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the quality seeds and the training in farming techniques. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 1.75 hectares. She has been growing peanuts for 50 years for its value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a base for cooking sauces. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market. 

With greater yields and higher income, Nagnouma is planning on buying some farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to build a house for the family, as well as plan for her children’s marriages.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Salvación  Divina Group

texts.es:
¨Salvación Divina¨, un grupo mixto compuesto por 3 mujeres  y 1 hombre, todos ellos con negocios diferentes pero con un objetivo sacar adelante a sus familias. José Nemetrio, líder del grupo de 36 años se gana la vida vendiendo leche a domicilio, este negocio lo comenzó por unas vacas que le fueron regaladas.  Así saca adelante a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Invertirá su préstamo en la compra de leche. Y ahorrar con las ganancias obtenidas, con esto piensa mejorar su casa y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los otros miembros del grupo son María Gregoria, de 50 años, dedicada a la venta de verduras en el mercado local de Masaya; Aura Lila de 27 años comerciante vende ropa usada para su variada  clientela; Petronila de 61 años dedicada a la venta de verduras.
texts.en:
"Salvación Divina" is a group made up of three women and one man, they all have different businesses, but share the goal of providing for their families.

José Nemetrio, aged 36, is the leader of the group. He earns a living selling milk door-to-door, a business he began when he was given some cows as a gift. This is how he provides for his three young children. He will use the loan to buy milk, and will save up using the earnings he obtains. With this, he hopes to improve his home and offer his family a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are María Gregoria, aged 50, who sells vegetables in the local market in Masaya; Aura Lila, aged 27, who sells used clothing to her diverse customers; and Petronila, aged 61, who sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Las Naranjeras Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario “Las Naranjeras”, conformados por 3 mujeres luchadoras, dueñas de negocios y dispuestas a salir adelantes para ayudar en la economía del hogar, solicitan por 2 ocasión crédito a ADIM. 
María Josefa de 50 años es la líder del este grupo, tiene su pequeño negocio  a la venta de cítricos y perecederos. Este negocio lo inició hace nueve años con el apoyo financiero de su pareja. Requiere del préstamo para la  compra de plátanos y naranjas. 

Los demás miembros son Karla Patricia de 39 años dedicada a la venta de perecederas e invertirá en la compra de chiltomas, tomate, naranja agria y más. Silvia de 43 años dedicada a la venta de cítricos y perecederos comprara naranjas, mandarinas, aguacates y más. Este grupo se compromete a ser puntual con los pagos en plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Las Naranjeras" is made up of three determined ladies, who are all business owners and ready to move forward to help with household costs. They are requesting a loan from ADIM for the second time.

María Josefa, aged 50 is the leader of the group. She has a small business selling citrus fruits and other fresh foods. She started this business, with her partner's support, nine years ago. She needs this loan to buy bananas and oranges.

The other members include Karla Patricia, aged 39, who sells fresh foods and who will use the loan to buy sweet peppers, tomatoes and bitter oranges among other things. Silvia, aged 43, sells citrus fruits and other fresh foods, and will buy oranges, mandarins and avocados as well as other products. 

The group are committed to make punctual payments in time with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy bananas and oranges

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 47 años de edad, es muy conocido en su comunidad por su excelente comportamiento y servicio a los demás, creció con sus padres quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos principios, está casado y tiene tres hijos.

Guadalupe, se dedica a la albañilería desde la edad de 20 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, a quien acompañaba siempre en sus labores diarias, la albañilería le ha dado la oportunidad de ganar dinero para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, su esposa le ayuda económicamente, pues ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana, de esta manera cubren sus necesidades.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que en la parte exterior de su casa, pretende construir unos cuartos para rentarlos a maestros que laboran en el centro escolar. 

Los sueños de Guadalupe son, tener una vivienda amplia y amueblada, adquirir un nuevo préstamo para comprar un vehículo y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, ya que uno de ellos sueña con ser doctor.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 47 years old. He is known in his community for his good behavior and his will to help others. He grew up with his parents, who taught him and made him a man with principles. He is married and has three children. 

Guadalupe has worked as a mason since he was twenty years old. He learned from his father, who took him with him to work. This activity has given him the opportunity to earn money to cover the family’s basic needs. His wife helps him by selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas] on weekends.

He will use the money to buy construction materials to build some rooms to rent them to teachers working at the local school.

His dreams are to have his own furnished house, receive another loan to buy a car, and be able to pay for his children’s education. One of them dreams of becoming a doctor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build some rooms and rent them out.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 38-year-old married mother of three children, and a Palestinian refugee.  She started selling childrens clothes five years ago, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 
Nisrine is a an ambitious lady who has a good reputation in her region.  She has succeeded, over the years, in gaining her own loyal customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her business.  She will increase her business inventory, with a new collection of children's clothes for the Spring and Summer season, to satisfy her customers' needs.
Nisrine hopes to expand her business in the future, to increase her income, and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increas her merchandise with a new collection of children's clothes

loans.name: Sobhiya

texts.en:
Sobhiya is a 64-year-old married mother of one child. She opened a women's clothes, underwear and Brazilian gold shop lately to support her husband, who works as a house painter to provide their living expenses.

Sobhiya is a hard worker and ambitious lady, who is working hard to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer collection. She hopes to stay in good health and to be capable of supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special spring and summer collection

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Roca Group

texts.es:
¨Jehová es mi roca¨, este grupo solidario, por 6to. Ciclo préstamo seguir creciendo con sus negocios  y sacar adelantes a sus familias. Su coordinadora Charlotte de 37 años, acompañada y madre de 5 hijos, de edades de 16, 12, 10,4 y 1 años, son su motor de vida. Tiene su negocio propio de costura en el área de vestidos típico de niños, invertirá su crédito en la compra de telas, cintas, hilos, elásticos, aguja y aceite para las maquinas. Su meta es con los ingresos obtenidos comprar máquinas y ver crecer su microempresa.  
Las demás miembros son Yahaira del Carmen de 35 años, se dedica a la venta de cajetas y ropa de niños, invertirá su crédito en la compra de vestidos así ofrecer   variedad de estilos a su clientela. Eulalia de 58 años ejemplo de superación dedicada a la venta de dulces, comprara churros, toronja, espumia. María Elena de 58 años dedicada a la venta de platanitos.
texts.en:
The supportive group Jehová es Mi Roca, is going through their sixth cycle of loans. They want to continue growing their businesses and help further their families. The coordinator, Charlotte is 37 years old. She has a partner and is the mother of 5 children, ages 16, 12, 10, 4 and 1. They are the engine that runs her life. She owns a sewing business specializing in children's typical dresses. She will use this loan to buy fabric, ribbon, thread, elastic, needles and sewing machine oil. Her goal is to buy more sewing machines with her profits to grow her small business.
The other members are Yahaira del Carmen, 35; she sells home-made candy and children's clothes. She will use this loan to buy more dresses to have a large variety to offer to her custimers. Eulalia, 58, a living example of perseverance, sells sweets, fritters, grapefruit juice and home-made ice cream. And, María Elena, 58, who sells local bananas.

loans.use: to buy fabric, ribbon, thread, elastic, needles and sewing machine oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Joisi

texts.en:
Joisi is a married woman, and she has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, and her primary customers are individuals. 

Joisi will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 32 year old female, living in Kasese, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children.  Justine is a salt miner and also sells crude salt. She has been in that business since 2010, and she has managed to look after her children, using the profits from her business. She has a dream of educating her children.  Her main challenge is lack of protective gear, while mining the salt. Justine wants money to buy crude salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for sale.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 52 years old and married with nine children living in Kasese Uganda. He sells cassava flour as the main source of income. He also practices farming crops such as cassava, sweet potatoes and others. He has a dream of being the biggest supplier of cassava flour. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Johnson is requesting for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant crops this season
